story:
About Me / Sobre Mi

¡Hi!. My name is Juan Francisco Zerpa. I am a singer/songwriter/drummer born in Caracas, Venezuela. I am working in the pre-production of the official music video of my new single “No está en discusión”. With your help, I will be able to cover the expenses of Production and Post-Production crew labor and promotional expenses. You can help by backing this campaign or simply by sharing it with your friends and family. I hope you can be a part of this journey with me.

 

¡Hola!. Mi nombre es Juan Francisco Zerpa. Soy un cantante/compositor/baterista nacido en Caracas, Venezuela. Estoy trabajando en la pre-producción del videoclip oficial de mi nuevo sencillo “No está en discusión”. Con tu ayuda, yo podré cubrir los gastos de Producción y Post-Producción del video asi como los gastos de promoción. Tú puedes ayudar siendo patrocinante de esta campaña o simplemente compartiéndola con tus amigos y familiares. Espero que puedas ser parte de este viaje conmigo.

 

My Music / Mi Música

To listen to my full discography, please visit my website / Para escuchar mi discografía completa, visita mi sitio web

www.juanfranciscomusic.com.ve

 

No está en discusión #NoEstaVideo

No está en discusión is a song about accepting and letting go. it's about to flow with life.

No está en discusión es una canción que trata acerca de la aceptación y de dejar ir, Es acerca de fluir con la vida. 

 

Melao

She is a wonderful actress and she will plays the star role in the music video.

Ella es una maravillosa actriz y tendrá el rol principal en el video.

 

¿Where the money goes? / ¿A dónde va el dinero?

Videographer-Director / Camarógrafo-Director

Editor

Actors / Actores

Locations / Locaciones

Art Design / Diseño Artístico

Make Up Artist-Stylist / Maquillador-Estilista

Storyboard / Guión Gráfico

Food-Drink for cast-crew / Comida-Bebida para el equipo de rodaje y el talento

Video promotion / Promoción del video

 

The Campaign

Producing and promoting a music video is not a cheap or simple process. The entire project could cost more than the $500 goal, so even if the objective is reached, please continue to share the campaign and encourage others to backing. Any support, monetary or otherwise, is greatly appreciated.

Producir y promocionar un video musical no es un proceso barato o sencillo. El proyecto completo podría costar más de la meta de los 500 $, por lo que aún si el objetivo es alcanzado, por favor continúa compartiendo la campaña y anima a otros para que la patrocinen. Cualquier apoyo, monetario o de otro tipo, es muy apreciado.

 

Other ways you can help / Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

It would be much appreciated if you can spread the word.  Just share this campaign on your social networks so your friends and family can find out about it. 

¡Thanks so much!.

Te agradecería mucho si puedes correr la voz. Sólo comparte esta campaña en tus redes sociales para que tus amigos y familiares puedan verla.

¡Muchas gracias!.

 

Juan Francisco Zerpa

 

#NoEstaVideo

story:
My Story

Thanks for being here and a part my campaign. Some of you may know me from my years touring and playing in the studio with some very famous artists. I have been SO blessed to work with artists like Keith Urban, Kenny Loggins, Peter Cetera, Kelly Clarkson, Michael W Smith and Megadeth. With nearly 70 songs written over the last few years, I'm ready to release my own album.

My Solo Release 

In the old days a "Record Label" would pay for the record, including marketing and promotions. Nowadays, WE ARE THE LABEL.  It's up to us to pay for everything. We will need to finish the record, manufacture it, and then market and promote it. Therefore, I am raising a limited amount of funds to help cover these costs.

The Perks 

I have come up with some pretty unique perks, special experiences and personal items from my personal collection. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be grateful if you would help us get the word out and make some noise about what we are doing. You can share with your friends using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Overview

We are Varkan, an emerging power-thrash metal band from Phoenix, Arizona. Our debut album, Varkan, has been in the works for years, and we are excited to finally unleash it onto the world! 

We're holding this pre-order campaign to make people a part of this launch, which is very near and dear to our hearts. Instead of offering pre-orders solely on Bandcamp, iTunes, and other digital outlets, we're hosting it on Indiegogo to give our friends a chance to order tangible perks, like hand-drawn album artwork, handwritten lyrics, autographed CDs, and more. 

We will be using the funds from this campaign to go toward the creation and shipping of this merchandise, as well as other investments in the band's future, such as recording time, future merchandise (vinyl, anyone?), music videos, stage production, touring, and more.

By participating in this campaign, you are contributing directly towards the fulfillment of your desired items, and you are also helping us get closer to achieving our long-term goals as a band. Everybody wins. :) 

Thank you for your support, and we hope you enjoy the album! 

Sincerely,

Alec, Dom, Mike, and Sal

story:
Introduction

Hi! I'm Will Payne Harrison. I have been writing songs for a long time, but I believe that these 12 songs that I am about to record may be the best I've ever written. I'm very proud of this next record and the musicians that I have on the project. If you aren't familiar with me here's a bit about me:

  • I am an Americana/Roots songwriter and artist in Nashville, TN.
  • I host a podcast on songwriting in Nashville called Americana Station.
  • I'm a Libra and I like long walks on the beach at sunset.
  • I have spent the last three years touring the US, writing songs and spending every last dime on my craft.
  • Here are a few quotes from some press on my last album:

"Easy, clean and humble, this, his follow-up to Louisiana Summer, is well-written but simple." - Offbeat, New Orleans, LA

"Harrison follows in the footsteps of his heroes, telling stories that can make you smile right before they make you cry. Willie Nelson and John Prine would be proud." - Mother Church Pew, Nashville, TN

"East Nashville Blues lets Will Payne Harrison get 'Lost in the Sway' on a weaving fiddle run as he ponders a 'Strange Contradiction' regarding life in the fast lane, and quietly walks down Woodland Avenue into 5 Points after a night of drinking asking a companion to 'Stay with Me'." - The Alternate Root Magazine, Los Angeles, CA

"Harrison has unveiled smooth, sweet vocals to match the heartfelt lyrics on the new album." - Herman Fusilier, The Daily Advertiser, Lafayette, LA

Living With Costs

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the cold hard truth:

  • In order to record this album, I need $6000 alone just for recording space, production, hiring musicians and mixing. 
  • A PR campaign costs around $4,000 (Heard your favorite band in that magazine or blog? That's what PR is for!)
  • Merchandise costs will be $2000.
  • That's around $12,000 for a conservative estimate in cost to produce this album.
  • I have been saving up for this record, and have drained my bank account. In order to make this record work, I need at least $5,000 in support to move forward. I'm not asking you for the entire amount, but  I am humbly asking for your help to get to my goal.

The Impact

  • By donating to this campaign, you will help keep me on the road promoting the album!
  • By relieving some of this financial burden, I will be able to focus on radio tours, growing my fan base and making sure everyone in the recording process gets a fair wage.

Risks & Challenges

  • The truth is being an independent artist is an uphill battle. There is no record label for me to fall back on. I don't have a team of people behind me. If I fall short on this money, it will take much much longer to find ways to come up with the money to finance this being properly released.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow my Artist Page on Spotify. Save my album ahead of time so you know when it drops. Play the songs on repeat.
  • Share this campaign with your richer friends. Guilt is a great tactic, ask your mother.
  • Retweet, Re-share, & Recycle.

story:
Hola, soy Isra (@isramusica), cantante y vocal coach venezolano.

Desde pequeño, inicié mis estudios como cantante con diferentes profesores y entrenadores vocales; todos de amplia trayectoria en Venezuela.

Asimismo, para nadie es un secreto que provengo de una familia rodeada de músicos, de manera que la música forma parte de mi vida desde que nací: mis padres se conocieron gracias a la música.

Por un lado, mi mama es cantante coralista, perteneció a la Schola Cantorum de Venezuela durante muchos años y formó parte del grupo instrumental de la Universidad Simón Bolívar; por otro, mi papá es licenciado en música, productor musical y arreglista, ex integrante de la Schola Cantorum de Venezuela, del grupo instrumental de la USB, ganador de La Siembra del Cuatro, músico de la reconocida agrupación venezolana Serenata Guayanesa, actualmente director y arreglista del grupo coral Ave Fénix, entre otras cosas.

 

TRAYECTORIA

Para el año 2013 se me presentó la oportunidad de audicionar en el Grupo Tártara, reconocida agrupación venezolana,  y de  inmediato comencé a formar parte de los cantantes principales, lo que me llevó a compartir tarima en muchas ocasiones con artistas venezolanos de la talla de la superbanda de Venezuela Guaco, Aditus, La Matarica, Grupo EA, Oscar de León, Oscarcito, Victor Drija, Victor Muñoz, Jonathan Moly, Gustavo Elis, Corina Smith, entre otros; e internacionales como Maluma. 

Toda esta experiencia, me permitió rodearme de personas muy talentosas y me abrió las puertas del medio artístico de Venezuela, motivo por el cual decidí iniciar mis proyectos personales: (1) en conjunto con dos amigos fundé la ‘coverband’ Tono 3 (@tono3music), una agrupación conocida por sus arreglos de muy alto nivel vocal y musical, que me hizo crecer aún más como artista y me generó otras oportunidades, como poder tener un tema principal en uno de los más recientes dramáticos de Venevisión, “Para verte mejor”. La canción se llama ‘Volverás’ y es el sexto promocional del cantante venezolano Fran Strippoli en colaboración con Tono 3; (2) formar parte, como vocalista principal, de ‘La Marcha’, bajo el liderazgo del reconocido productor y compositor venezolano José Alfonso Quiñones, agrupación que logró posicionarse con el número uno en la Cartelera Nacional de Pop y en el Top 100 nacional del Record Report con el tema ‘I wanna feel the boom boom’.

Actualmente soy el director vocal de la banda de Corina Smith (@corinasmith), soy el director vocal de la agrupación Emusic (@emusicve), me desempeño como vocal coach de Shantal Marsuian (@shantalmarsuian), Marielen (@marielen.oficial), el dúo Los Muchachos (@losmuchachosmusica) y Corina Smith; y, en paralelo, me encuentro trabajando arduamente en mi proyecto musical como solista, estimando que el lanzamiento del primer tema promocional se lleve a cabo para el segundo trimestre de este año.

 

'Isra' EL PROYECTO

Con este proyecto, pretendo combinar el género urbano con un sonido anglo muy internacional que combina elementos del pop y el R&B que reflejan mi identidad como cantante, para poder enseñarles quién soy a través de mi música y cumplir todas la expectativas del público a nivel nacional e internacional.

Los fondos recaudados serán destinados a la producción de la imagen artística, diseño y producción del show, producción audiovisual, introducción del producto (primer sencillo promocional) al mercado, promoción radial en las principales carteleras a nivel nacional, prensa y gira de medios.

Durante mucho tiempo, como integrante de grupos bailables, como corista o como vocal coach he vivido mi sueño a partir del sueño de otras personas. Ha sido una experiencia increíble, he conocido gente maravillosa, he aprendido muchísimo y definitivamente me he formado como artista. Pero creo que llegó la hora de apostar a mi proyecto, a mis ideas y a mi propuesta. Nada es fácil, pero tampoco es imposible; tal y como me ha enseñado siempre mi familia: el trabajo es la mejor forma de progreso.

story:
Check out the "UNCLE PECK" video  - (about my real uncle who would never, ever leave New Orleans)

Hello and thanks for visiting.

Composers write music about their experiences!  A recent extensive journey has made deep impressions, and I feel compelled to tell these stories in the best way that I know how – through musical composition and performance. 

Songs are bubbling up that need to be shared. 

So, I’ve assembled an incredible team of artistic peers (old friends like John Faddis and new ones like Jansel Torres) from different continents who help me articulate and record my thoughts. The music reflects some amazing cultural traditions from far-away lands as well as from home in the USA.

I’m very grateful to have these musical collaborators on board:

Argentina: Fernando Martinez, Miguel Marengo, Mauricio Dawid, Carlos Michelini                     

Cuba: Jansel Torres

New Orleans: John Wooton

New York: Jon Faddis, Ralph Lalama, Gary Smulyan, Matt Hall, Tara Helen O’Conner, Ayako Oshima, Taylor Burgess, Dave Lewitt and Angel Lau.  Fun Photos from the Recording

The project is a combination of jazz, Latin, and world music influences. I’ve been immersed in all of these for most of my life. But it’s really more about community than category.

It's a celebration of values that we all share -  looked at from several perspectives. There are pieces about Bali, New York, India, Brazil, New Orleans, Africa, and Patagonia. The more I write, play and travel, the more vivid these connections become. ​

 

This is an exciting adventure that requires coordination, vision, and careful planning. The basic tracks were done in Buenos Aires and additional recording is being done in New York.

Contemporary technology facilitates easy sharing of musical files across continents and allows me to maintain a cohesive concept of the project’s artistic statement. The North and South American musicians function astoundingly as one team with a unified artistic goal. 

The project is complex, and involves a lot of people in many places. Recording, mixing, mastering, fees, production, and promotional expenses are formidable on a high quality CD. We are raising $8,000 now so that it can be completed on schedule for a 4th quarter 2018 release. The timing is important and your assistance would be much appreciated.

What better way to create and distribute an album reflecting on various communities than to create our own community within this album process! Check out some interesting donation perks!

Your participation will make this meaningful recording a reality, as well as make a statement about cultural connectivity.

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Or if you have contributed and want to do more, here's what you can do: get the word out about my campaign by posting on facebook, forwarding to friends over email, phone call, etc. by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much,

Ted

The basic tracks were done in Buenos Aires and additional recording is being done in New York.Contemporary technology facilitates easy sharing of musical files across continents and allows me to maintain a cohesive concept of the project’s artistic statement. The North and South American musicians function astoundingly as one team with a unified artistic goal. The project is complex, and involves a lot of people in many places. Recording, mixing, mastering, fees, production, and promotional expenses are formidable on a high quality CD. We are raising $8,000 now so that it can be completed on schedule for a 4th quarter 2018 release. The timing is important and your assistance would be much appreciated.What better way to create and distribute an album reflecting on various communities than to create our own community within this album process! Check out some interesting donation perks!Your participation will make this meaningful recording a reality, as well as make a statement about cultural connectivity.Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Or if you have contributed and want to do more, here's what you can do: get the word out about my campaign by posting on facebook, forwarding to friends over email, phone call, etc. by using the Indiegogo share tools!Thanks so much,Ted

story:
I plan to allot:

$455 to completing the demo (acoustic) tracking of my songs.

  • Track all raw vocals in a full-sound-proof voice-chamber through state of the art microphones (Blue Bottle [with all capsules], Manley Cardioid Reference [molded with Vintage Mullard 12AT7 Tube], Neumann u67, Sony C800g). Directed by a professional studio engineer. ($255) (85USD/hr).
  • Benefit from the help of a studio musician to embellish and track the piano leads that I composed (but admittedly struggle to play flawlessly) on a full-mic Weber Grand Piano. ($200) (100USD/hr).

$1,000 to the production of my songs. This crucial process entails the outsourcing of a music producer, referenced to me by my study manager, who will turn my acoustic demos into "pop" songs through the addition of vocal effects, synths, and beats via LogicPro and ProTools. ($1,000).

$600 to the composition of social media packaging. As an independent artist working for the support of both labels and listeners, a competitive social media presence is vital to the melding of an "image" and the popularization of my music over youtube and music distribution platforms.

  • Directed by graduates of the Los Angeles Film School.

$5 to something I'm probably forgetting.

story:
This is my first Indiegogo InDemand. We've already funded the project on Kickstarter (thanks to my backers) and now we want to spread the word and get you to know the project. Also, since it'll be recorded in Argentina where there's a big economic crisis, having more funds won't hurt!

While on tour in Japan this year, my manager and I had a really interesting idea that turned into one of the most exciting projects I've taken on. I hope you find it as fun and surprising as I did!

Piazzolla 2020 – La Historia Continúa (The Story Continues)

Eleven composers who perform their own music are getting together to breathe life into a project, one that seeks to send a reply to Piazzolla, to continue his work, and to tell the story of what tango in 2020 means to them.

Astor Piazzolla, one of the most renowned composers and bandoneonists in history, was known as a disrupter. He always wanted to be his own contemporary, and he sought to express “the now in the now” using techniques and forms from “the now.” In many interviews he stated that anyone who planned to see him perform within a year shouldn’t expect that he would still be playing the same way…he even created more than 20 versions of his piece Adiós Nonino because otherwise he believed he would get bored.

Among his more than 500 works  is a piece called Histoire du Tango. Tango, like so many other musical genres, went through many transformations based on the society that created it. In Histoire du Tango, Piazzolla decided to take snapshots of four moments in tango history: 1900, 1930, 1960 and “today” which at the time of creation was roughly 1990.

Simply look at this timeline and it's clear that another 30 years have passed since the last chapter in Piazzolla’s saga.  We believe that as representatives of today’s tango, it’s our duty to keep telling the story, honoring the memory of maestro Astor.

I am convinced that we’re making tango history in many regards: we’re creating 11 new pieces that will serve as a snapshot of what tango means to us in our era; there is no other album like this, in which great tango artists come together, leaving individualism aside but respecting our own individuality to honor a hero by adhering to his ethos of “respect yourself and your moment.”

For as long as Piazzolla has existed we haven’t known what do to with him. He was always controversial, and he was also constantly being both imitated and rejected. With Piazzolla 2020 we feel that for the first time we have an opportunity to do something positive: he left something for us, and we are taking on the challenge. Ramiro Gallo, Agustín Guerrero, Los Púa Abajo, Exequiel Mantega, Bernardo Monk, Pablo Murgier, Shino Ohnaga, Fernando Otero, Adrián Ruggiero, Martín Sued and myself will each create a piece and record it with our groups.

It’s an ambitious, unique project and we’d love it if you would help us make it happen.

To that end, we’ve prepared different rewards…you can even choose to have one of the composers write a new piece for you!

One more thing: this is the first Piazzolla album without any music by Astor…pretty cool right?

About the Composers

Fernando Otero is a GRAMMY®-winning  composer, pianist and vocalist based in New York City.

Ramiro Gallo is an  violinist, composer, bandleader and lyricist.  He founded his quintet in the year 2000. He is based in Buenos Aires.

Agustín Guerrero (Buenos Aires) is a pianist, composer, arranger and conductor. At age 16 he created and directed an orchestra, and he founded his quintet in 2008. 

Los Púa Abajo (Buenos Aires) is an instrumental duo conformed by guitarists, arrangers and composers Ángel Colacilli and Leandro Coratella

Exequiel Mantega (Buenos Aires) is a pianist, composer, educator and conductor. He's released 12 albums and has completed over 20 US and European tours. 

Bernardo Monk (Buenos Aires) is a saxophonist, multiinstrumentalist, composer and lyricist. He brings a new sound to tango and is a member of acclaimed jazz groups. He is a graduate of Berklee College of Music. 

Pablo Murgier (Paris) is an Argentine pianist and composer, and winner of the Tango Sin Fin 2017 competition. 

Shino Ohnaga (Buenos Aires) studied piano and harpsichord in her native Japan.  She has lived in Buenos Aires since 2013 where she plays in many tango groups and is the leader of her own group, Barrio Shino. 

Adrián Ruggiero (Buenos Aires) is a bandoneonist, guitarist, composer and the director of the documentary film Pugliese, Pugliese, Pugliese.

Martín Sued (Paris) is an Argentine bandoneonist and composer, born in 1983. He is largely self-taught. 

Adam Tully  is a guitarist and composer from New York based in Buenos Aires. He leads the Adam Tully Trio and hosts the  segment Guitarra, guitarra mía on La2x4 FM.

Expenses

· Composers fees

· Recording fees for musicians

· Recording Studio (10 days)

· Mixing Sessions

· Mastering Sessions

· Piano tunings

· CD Design

· CD Printing

story:
Isolation Blues

 

So it's that time again, I started this in the 2nd lockdown reminiscing about non covid times with The Broken Broadcast. Anyhow, I finished this off last week, songs from 'How Not To Cut A Buffalo', 'Find Us When We Drift' and 'The Long Dark Bright', plus a goldie oldie, made with just a few tools.

 

'Isolation Blues' is out November 19th, accompanied by a launch gig in Stockton On Tees

 

Tracklisting

1. The River

2. We're Already Seen The Dead

3. Deer

4. We're Just Waiting For Our Friends

5. Everything That's Yours Is Mine

6. The Long Dark Bright

7. Tiptoe (So Long, Goodbye)

8. Sea Coal Collectors

9. Captain Of My Soul

10. My Lovely Bones

story:
RAINBOW STAR: Music From The Rainbow Sparkle Palace: Vol. II

Introducing the sequel to MFTRSP: Volume I.
 

**This campaign is on "fixed" funding - so it's all or nothin,' baby!  The album will only be born with YOUR help!

 

(A personal letter from RAINBOW about the making of this 'fempowering' project:)

 

Dear sweet musical dreamer,

After a 13 year perfectionism-and-self-doubt-induced songwriting hiatus, fairy muses interrupted the children’s book I was writing & illustrating to bestow two volumes of heart-wide-open folk & folkpunk songs upon my Dulcimer & me, where we sat unexpectantly at The Rainbow Sparkle Palace... 

It’s been one year since your support launched my debut album, Volume I of Music From The Rainbow Sparkle Palace. I could crawl out of my screamin' skin with excitement over sharing part 2 of that musical story with you.

ALL of this happens with your support, for your eyes, for the joy that arises in the collective consciousness when we are supported in living our creative dreams. Thank you for making this possible. 

Here's the juicy background on the journey, for your reading pleasure...

 

 

The Music

MFTRSP: Volume II has been in the works for nearly two years!  It is a bit different from its predecessor, with a stronger folk-punk connection & a full-fledged 'PARENTAL ADVISORY' label. 

This brand new auditory journey features an existential crisis, feminist anthems, a domestic violence survival story, and powerful tales of love; its beautiful beginning & epic end. The full-length album (18 tracks and counting!) is flanked by field recordings of myriad wildlife in the woods at my tiny house & homestead, The Rainbow Sparkle Palace, and ends on a high note, with 'Sun Song,'  the happiest tune I've ever written, which ends in proclamation

"I'm alright, I'm alright, I'm alright..."

 

 

The Concept

The concept for the album & its execution is based in authenticity.  The songs are unapologetic, even when vulnerable & soft as kitty fur.  They are raw in their birthing; many tracks you'll discover are the song as it was being born. I literally felt it coming, grabbed my phone and instrument, and hit record.

What you hear is as real, fresh, and raw as it gets.

You'll find refreshingly minimal post production here, yet I can honestly tell you this record will sound as good on your car stereo as the first, professionally recorded, mixed & mastered MFTRSP: Volume I. 

 

 

The Feminism

I want this project to empower women & femusicians, in as many ways I can squeeze from it (and I hope you want that too. When women are uplifted, everyone wins!)

How you will empower women by backing this project:

  • Employing women & women-run companies for every step of this process (yes, I even wrote each major digital distributor & CD manufacturing company to find which employed the highest percentage of women, at the highest ranking position). 
  • Launching an uber-economical yet badass-sounding record proves to women (who suffer globally lower wages & are far underrepresented in the music industry) that successful musicianship can be achieved despite financial difficulty
  • Supporting a record that speaks out about domestic violence and sexual harassment shines light on the dark, and eradicates it from hiding. This powerful motion facilitates healing for DV survivors (statistically, mostly women), and is a movement toward social change.
  • Financially facilitating my fempowering professional music video for 'Patriarchy Song,' (a self-produced project, inviting women the world over to alchemize #metoo moments into nourishing fuel, and challenging social taboos regarding female nudity), fuels a powerful global movement toward healing humanity through honoring the divine feminine & her power to turn dark to light.
  • Because 10% of profits for the lifetime of this record go to Hope's Wings, a local Domestic Violence Shelter,  you are aiding vital efforts to free women from the enslavement of violent relationships.

 

 

The Album Art

A dreary winter forest - spring on the horizon. Facing the camera in vintage breezy dress, cupped hands blow glitter stars at you.  Shininess emerges from the dark. 

Ariana Jordan is photographing this scene during our music video shoot.  The stars will be collaged (by me! Yay, art degree coming in handy!) onto the printed photo, then scanned in.  Abby Marium, who helped with album art for Vol. 1, will duplicate the text we used for that record, for continuity, and add it to the new art in Adobe Illustrator.

 

 

The Music Video

Have you ever felt stifled, oppressed, and after decades of it clawing at you, it dawned on you a way to start feeling free?

That's what 'Patriarchy Song,' the first single & bigger-budget music video for MFTRSP: Vol. 2 is about.  Women worldwide are being invited to participate virtually, or in person; anonymously or not, in an alchemizing ritual where #metoo moments are magically reborn as nourishing fuel. 

Women will present their #metoo moments on poster, then toss them into a burning wood stove, which will heat our meal.  We'll sit together eating and enjoying each other's company, then take the ashes from the stove and fertilize an oak sapling we will plant together.  Women the world over are mailing in bits of ashes from their own private rituals, which will be added to our group ashes during planting. 

I've gotten deep, heartfelt letters of gratitude from several participants, relaying horrifying stories, and assertions that this event is healing them and giving them hope.  The video will be shot by Ariana Jordan on March 13 & 14 in special outdoor spaces near Berea.

 

 

The Budget

So, what does it take to make an album?  Even an uber-low-budget record like this takes a lot of work. 

Times have graciously shifted in favor of the musician, and it's been a dream come true to  release my music independently under my own record label, Rainbow Sparkle Palace Publishing (est. 2018 via BMI).  Not being signed to a label gives me a folkton of freedom, and it means that I alone am responsible for funding my music; making every single detail run smoothly, and promoting my music solo.  It's been an 80 hour per week job, studying 'the new music industry' & building my music business over the last 3 years, all while working part-time as an entrepreneur cleaning houses & organizing for local clients.  It really feels like I'm in a self-run college for music marketing.   

It's a cat-ton of work & responsibility!

But I've found the reward of making music FOR & WITH my fans makes it the kind of work that fuels me li'l soul. 

Music From The Rainbow Sparkle Palace: Vol. I released in August 2018; for financial & practical reasons, I decided not to release a double volume debut album all at once.  With your help, though, we can make this happen in Spring 2019. 

It's important to be transparent (perfectionism is a killer) and let ya know the challenges I face as an independent musician.  I'm uber-grateful to fans who have supported me in the past (we raised $2500 in the campaign for Volume I last year!), and have continued to purchase music and merchandise between releases, which allowed this album to be made!

Y'ALL KEEP THIS MUSIC KICKIN'. 

For a detailed Budget Outline, click here.

 

How You Can Be Involved

Early Supporters get up to 50% off!  Just choose your bundle & you're officially a Co-STAR.

 

PALACE BUNDLE!

Dang, you're frikkin' ROYALTY, friend! 
The Palace doors creak open wide for you, and won't anyone who meets ya think otherwise. 
With this oh-so-very 'extra' bundle, you'll receive full access to The Rainbow Sparkle Palace, including the entire MFTRSP collection, my live album, a Limited Edition Extra Large & Extra Cute Rainbow Sparkle Palace Mug, a Limited Edition Cowcat T-Shirt, 1 pc. magical RAINBOW STAR Bubbles, a Super Slap Bracelet, unreleased songs & behind-the-scenes unreleased music video footage from Patriarchy Song!

Perk includes:

  1. Limited Edition XL Palace Mug
  2. Limited Edition Cowcat TShirt
  3. MFTRSP: Vol. I- Signed CD
  4. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
  5. MFTRSP: Vol. I- Download
  6. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)
  7. Live @ Cowan Chapel - Download
  8. MegaDownload: Unreleased Songs
  9. Unreleased Music Video Footage
  10. RAINBOW STAR Bubbles!
  11. Super Slap Bracelet!

 

 

SPARKLE BUNDLE!

Ooh, Shiny! 
Look at SparklyAss you! That's what folks'll be doin' bc you're going to look SO FLY with one of the sweetest R. STAR merch collections around. Listen to rad music in your R. STAR t-shirt, with your slap bracelet on, while blowing bubbles! Spreadin' allll the joy.

Perk includes:

 

  1. Limited Edition XL Palace Mug
  2. Limited Edition Cowcat TShirt
  3. MFTRSP: Vol. I- Signed CD
  4. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
  5. MFTRSP: Vol. I- Download
  6. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)
  7. Live @ Cowan Chapel - Download
  8. RAINBOW STAR Bubbles!
  9. Super Slap Bracelet!

 

RAINBOW BUNDLE!

You look gorgeous in rainbows!

Be your own sunshine on a cloudy day with this essential merch pack, featuring the artwork of Adele Gilani on your new favorite mug, plus your new fave folkpunk record on physical & digital, AND my live album, recorded here in hilly Ky.

 

Perk Includes:

  1. MFTRSP: Vol 2. Physical CD, Signed
  2. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 Digital Download, 1 week before eeeveryone else
  3. Live @ Cowan Chapel Digital Download

 

FAIRY BUNDLE!

Fairy muses whisper 'thank you' to you & your offering - you keep the music alive with this lovingly hand-signed CD set, packaged just for you @ The Palace. Discountin' it hard bc I love that you're helping me make this reality!

 

Perk Includes:

  1. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
  2. MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Digital Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)

 

 

More Ways You Can Be Involved

SHARE this campaign every few days with your network - Look for the Share buttons at the top of this campaign

EMBED this campaign on your website or blog

Spread the word to your friends & colleagues who might enjoy new FolkPunk music

Music reviewers/ promoters: I have spaces for interviews! Please send a message to thisisrainbowstar@gmail.com with the subject line: "Interview" 

 

The Palace awaits you. Off to set out tea for your arrival!

 

Love,

RAINBOW

make an album?  Even an uber-low-budget record like this takes a lot of work. Times have graciously shifted in favor of the musician, and it's been a dream come true to  release my music independently under my own record label, Rainbow Sparkle Palace Publishing (est. 2018 via BMI).  Not being signed to a label gives me a folkton of freedom, and it means that I alone am responsible for funding my music; making every single detail run smoothly, and promoting my music solo.  It's been an 80 hour per week job, studying 'the new music industry' & building my music business over the last 3 years, all while working part-time as an entrepreneur cleaning houses & organizing for local clients.  It really feels like I'm in a self-run college for music marketing.   It's a cat-ton of work & responsibility!But I've found the reward of making music FOR & WITH my fans makes it the kind of work that fuels me li'l soul. Music From The Rainbow Sparkle Palace: Vol. I released in August 2018; for financial & practical reasons, I decided not to release a double volume debut album all at once.  With your help, though, we can make this happen in Spring 2019. It's important to be transparent (perfectionism is a killer) and let ya know the challenges I face as an independent musician.  I'm uber-grateful to fans who have supported me in the past (we raised $2500 in the campaign for Volume I last year!), and have continued to purchase music and merchandise between releases, which allowed this album to be made!Y'ALL KEEP THIS MUSIC KICKIN'. For a detailed Budget Outline, click here. How You Can Be Involved
Early Supporters get up to 50% off!  Just choose your bundle & you're officially a Co-STAR. PALACE BUNDLE!Dang, you're frikkin' ROYALTY, friend! The Palace doors creak open wide for you, and won't anyone who meets ya think otherwise. With this oh-so-very 'extra' bundle, you'll receive full access to The Rainbow Sparkle Palace, including the entire MFTRSP collection, my live album, a Limited Edition Extra Large & Extra Cute Rainbow Sparkle Palace Mug, a Limited Edition Cowcat T-Shirt, 1 pc. magical RAINBOW STAR Bubbles, a Super Slap Bracelet, unreleased songs & behind-the-scenes unreleased music video footage from Patriarchy Song!Perk includes:
Limited Edition XL Palace Mug
Limited Edition Cowcat TShirt
MFTRSP: Vol. I- Signed CD
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
MFTRSP: Vol. I- Download
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)
Live @ Cowan Chapel - Download
MegaDownload: Unreleased Songs
Unreleased Music Video Footage
RAINBOW STAR Bubbles!
Super Slap Bracelet!
  SPARKLE BUNDLE!Ooh, Shiny! Look at SparklyAss you! That's what folks'll be doin' bc you're going to look SO FLY with one of the sweetest R. STAR merch collections around. Listen to rad music in your R. STAR t-shirt, with your slap bracelet on, while blowing bubbles! Spreadin' allll the joy.Perk includes: 
Limited Edition XL Palace Mug
Limited Edition Cowcat TShirt
MFTRSP: Vol. I- Signed CD
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
MFTRSP: Vol. I- Download
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)
Live @ Cowan Chapel - Download
RAINBOW STAR Bubbles!
Super Slap Bracelet!
 RAINBOW BUNDLE!You look gorgeous in rainbows!Be your own sunshine on a cloudy day with this essential merch pack, featuring the artwork of Adele Gilani on your new favorite mug, plus your new fave folkpunk record on physical & digital, AND my live album, recorded here in hilly Ky. Perk Includes:
MFTRSP: Vol 2. Physical CD, Signed
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 Digital Download, 1 week before eeeveryone else
Live @ Cowan Chapel Digital Download
 FAIRY BUNDLE!Fairy muses whisper 'thank you' to you & your offering - you keep the music alive with this lovingly hand-signed CD set, packaged just for you @ The Palace. Discountin' it hard bc I love that you're helping me make this reality! Perk Includes:
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Signed CD
MFTRSP: Vol. 2 - Digital Download (1 week before eeeveryone else!)
  More Ways You Can Be InvolvedSHARE this campaign every few days with your network - Look for the Share buttons at the top of this campaignEMBED this campaign on your website or blogSpread the word to your friends & colleagues who might enjoy new FolkPunk musicMusic reviewers/ promoters: I have spaces for interviews! Please send a message to thisisrainbowstar@gmail.com with the subject line: "Interview"  The Palace awaits you. Off to set out tea for your arrival! Love,RAINBOW

story:
Our Story

River City Worship has worked hard over the years to write songs that speak hope, drawing worshippers further into intimacy and awe of our incredible Savior. Our desire is to continue writing songs relevant to where people are at by helping put words to their pain, their struggles, their opportunities, and their tomorrow. Through these songs, we explore the depths of God's character and focus our attention and hope on Him. We have dreamed of opportunities to keep recording these "anthems" so that people can continue singing them long after the event is over.

What We Need & What You Get

This album is a continuation of that dream coming true. It is more than just a musical project; we believe it is a glimpse into the divine, an opportunity to loudly sing the anthems that God has gifted to River City Church. We believe we have an opportunity to capture a moment that will continue to change lives for years to come.

We need $25,000 to cover the live sound engineering, media company shooting video, and the post-production costs which will give the album that final professional touches. We are utilizing Indiegogo and our recording event to help fund this project. Your preorders and desire to attend the event will help us with the cost required to record and deliver songs from River City Worship.

All of the resources given to River City Worship will go directly to funding the filming, recording, and production of this much-anticipated project. All financial gifts are considered charitable giving and tax-deductible.

We also have a handful of unique perks that I think you will enjoy.  

Risks & Challenges

We will have a lot of work to do leading up to the live recording event, and even more work to do afterward.  We are looking forward to the challenge and are grateful that you've taken the time to check this out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially but would still like to help, please share this project with your friends and help get the word out!  You can even use the built-in Indeigogo share tools.

If you would rather give to the project via River City PushPay, visit https://pushpay.com/g/rivercitychurchlewiston and select Worship Project in the dropdown, or simply bring your donation to us.

story:
The Y B ÷ Movement and our message:

Y B ÷ is a socially-minded, San Diego based apparel  company whose mission is to ignite a global movement to Harmonize Humanity.
The Y B ÷ logo poses the question - Why Be Divided? Whether these divisions are racial, religious, political, national, or within ourselves. Seeing the Y B ÷ logo sparks a moment of clarity and introspection that transcends the divisions throughout our world and inspires tolerance and positivity.
When you wear a Y B ÷ shirt or hat you tell the world you stand for peace, compassion, unity, equality, acceptance and love.
            Our Story:
Y B ÷ started two and a half years ago after Founder, Steve Leisher traveled to Nicaragua in search of truth and purpose. With newfound inspiration, perspective and the support of his family, Y B ÷ took flight with humble beginnings. After producing a limited amount of apparel we received an overwhelmingly positive response from the community, local retailers, non-profits, musicians, artist, and via social media internationally. We knew we were on to something truly meaningful and powerful and we want YOU to help spread this positive vibration and what people are calling the new peace sign of our times!! Throughout this last year Y B ÷ has been organizing for widespread acceptance and has rapidly grown a galvanized fan base of 51k+ Facebook and 26k+ Instagram followers. With a newly designed website we are poised for our first major round of production and ready to make a huge splash in 2015!

Our Products:

Y B ÷ offers apparel that has an immediate attraction and appeal to people of all ages and backgrounds. Our designs are colorful, fun, thought-provoking and timeless and are intended to generate a smile and a shift in consciousness. We pride ourselves in providing complimentary, comfortable and quality products that are meant to inspire a positive action.

Our Goals:

We here at Y B ÷ embrace the motto 'Reach For The Stars' and dream... BIG!!  It is our purpose to be the unified voice that raises awareness to the many divisions that are present in the world today.  We intend to encourage the efforts of the many organizations and individuals who strive to expose these illusions of division. A major goal of Y B ÷ is to create collaborative efforts with non-profits working for social and environmental harmony to design products that raise money and awareness for their important work. With your support Y B ÷ has no shortage of inspiration and passion to continue to create new products and marketing avenues to further spread our message and effect positive change for the world in which we wish to live in today.  

Our Perks

             


      





         


        

             

              

                       

                        

                        


Use Of Funds

                        Your donations will be used in a variety of ways to help ensure our movement and companies success. These funds will greatly assist in Y B ÷'s transition into a functional and equipped office/warehouse space where we can house and ship our production of new inventory. In addition we plan to utilize these funds to bring on new employees to the Y B ÷ team who will be vital in management, marketing as well as design and development of future products.


FAQ: The Perks

Q: How do I know I'll receive the size, sex and color perk I want?

A: We will be contacting donors throughout and post campaign to request your size, sex and color perk of your choosing.

Q: When will I receive my perks?
A: We anticipate for you to receive your perks within 60-90 days after the completion of our campaign. 

Q: Are all of the perks available in all countries?

A: Yes, all the perks are available for international shipping but will include an additional shipping fee depending on the destination of the perk and country. 

Q: What if I want more than one perk package (or standalone perk)?
A: Get gifts for the whole family! You can make multiple pledges on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure to use the same email address and login, so we'll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Hallo Freunde,

Ich freue mich sehr, das Ihr euch die Zeit genommen habt dem Link zu folgen. Mein Name ist ToblerUno, Ich bin 25 Jahre alt, lebe in Saarbrücken und mache deutsche Rap Musik. Seit meinem 14ten Lebensjahr schreibe ich meine eigenen Texte und versuche meine Gedanken auf das Blatt zu bringen. Meinen ersten Track habe ich mit 18 Jahren aufgenommen. 2012 folgte mein erstes eigenes Album "LIBERTÁ",  das aufgrund fehlender finanzieller Mittel leider nur 500 mal gepresst wurde.

"CARCHARODON" … mein 2tes Studio-Album steht nun in der Planung und ich suche Unterstützer, um mein Projekt erfolgreich abschließen zu können. 

Mit eurem Support, kann ich Großes erreichen!


Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

EUR 3.900,– benötige ich, um mein Projekt zu stemmen. 17 Tracks + 3 HD Videos sind geplant.

 Leider gibt es heutzutage nichts mehr umsonst, das Studio, der CD Druck, das Verpackungsmaterial,  sowie verschiedene Werbeartikel und 2 Videos werden mit eurer Unterstützung finanziert! 

Mit dem Video "Gefallener Engel" gebe ich euch einen kleinen Einblick in mein Projekt, das mir sehr am Herzen liegt.

Sichert euch verschiedene Perks, wie zum Beispiel, das Carcharodon Special Paket für nur EUR 16,– oder das Supporter Sticker Paket für nur EUR 8,– direkt zu euch nach Hause.  

  

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Natürlich, wäre ich euch auch sehr dankbar, wenn Ihr euren Freunden und Bekannten von meinem Projekt erzählt und diese Seite verbreitet.

Danke für Alles!
Euer ToBlerUno

story:
susvarã

susvarã is an organisation that has been started to promote Indian Classical Music in the form of chamber concerts. The concerts will be streamed live in the internet so that Classical Music enthusiasts can watch it from all over the world. We intend to start our concert series in Chennai, India from 20 Feb 2015. 

The Need

susvarã requires funding as follows:

  • Buying sound systems: 300 USD (one-time cost)
  • Concert cost: 100 USD (includes artist conveyance charges, basic refreshments, live streaming internet charges, other misc charges, etc - reccuring cost per concert).

Expectation

This organisation was started with the main aim of encouraging upcoming Indian Classical Music performers by providing them a stage and audience. We firmly believe that our effort will encourage more and more youngsters to pursue Indian Classical Music at least as a hobby.

Other Ways

Money is essential for our cause but it isn't the only thing that is required. Here are few things that you can help us with, apart from your monetary donations:

  • Venue: You may provide us with enclosed / semi-enclosed space (12'x12' or above). It can even be your home's living room. Electricity would be the only basic requirement. If Broadband Internet is available, that would also help us.
  • Refreshments: You may bring some refreshments (light snacks / beverages) to the venue for our audiences and artists. Not that we won't provide any refreshment, but your contribution would definitely help us.
  • Voluntary performances: If you're a budding artist, you may volunteer to travel at your own cost to the venue and perform. 
  • Other forms: Indian donors can also directly (cheque/DD/MO) send your donations to us. Please contact us for more details.
  • Spread the news: You may also help us spread the news by sharing the message with your friends.
All the donations that we receive (cash / kind) will be mentioned in our website. Every donation small/big is considered the same.

story:
*WHO I AM and WHAT I'M DOING*
Hello, my name is Ruby Lovett.  I am a singer/songwriter originally from south Mississippi, but have been living in middle Tennessee for 25 yrs.  Though I have pursued a career in country music, my first love was/is gospel music.  In an effort to get back to my roots, I would love to, with your help, record a full length gospel album featuring some of the songs I love and cut my teeth on growing up singing in church, gospel music singing conventions and bluegrass festivals. 
*WHAT THE PROJECT NEEDS and WHAT YOU GET*
 I have set my goal at $10,000.  This money will go to pay for studio time, musicians, engineer, the making and pressing of the actual CD.  The perks you get for your donations are pretty cool...  autographed(or not, if you prefer..ha!)CDs, my favorite is the Ruby Lovett T-shirt depicting an artist rendering of my Daddy's yellow pulpwood truck....the subject of one of my songs entitled "Pulpwood Haulin' Truck". 

  



*HELP SPREAD THE WORD*

I know times are tough, so don't worry if you can't contribute financially.  You can help by spreading the word about my project.  You can do this on your social media page/pages and by using the Indiegogo share tools!  I would be so grateful.

story:
The Idea

Vincent Lee is seeking to release an album with an impact. The music he writes deals with issues directly related to his experiences as a bipolar transman. He hopes that his music will educate those who have not walked in his shoes and help those who have. His hope is to use some of the proceeds from his music to give back to GLSEN Southern Maine's Students for Safe Schools Leadership Team, an activist group he proudly has participated in over the course of the past few months. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to release this album, Vincent needs your help, but don't think that your help will go unrewarded. Perks include digital and physical copies of the album, chord sheets, and more!

Risks & Challenges

The 30-day deadline does not apply to fundraising alone. It also applies to the recording of the album. While there has been some recording work already completed, the bulk of the work remains to be done. However, we believe it is completely reasonable to get this work done in this amount of time, and if we do not, it may delay you receiving your perks but we assure you, you will get them. In the event we do not reach our goal, we will still release the album on band camp. However, no physical copies will be available.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this indiegogo campaign! Let people know that we are striving not just to release an album but to educate and empathize with the world. Tell people why this album is so important to YOU, and encourage them to donate.

story:
This year The Slackers have been around for 25 years and Ernesto’s has been in existence for 26 years, perfect timing to organize their 27th concert at Ernesto's that took place on Monday, November 21, 2016. After 2 earlier live CD's it’s time to celebrate this union with a 3rd recording (even on vinyl). That is, if you support our plan and spend a few bucks on our crowdfunding-campaign to realize this live-CD/LP. As reward: a memory for eternity.

Ernesto's

Next to being a great and very cosy Mexican restaurant Ernesto’s is also a infamous stage for maverick musicians. Bands like La Troba Kung Fu, Los de Abajo, The Slackers, The Skatalites, M.D.C., The Paladins, Jaya The Cat as well as “local” heros like The Wolff, Mo'Jones, the WW-Band and the Janse Bagge Bend have played here. Even though they might attract bigger in clubs or even stadiums most bands return as often as they can because they enjoy the interaction and bonding with the crowd. 

Ernesto himself

The creative power behind this place is Ernesto America. Born and raised in Sittard with genuine Mexican roots (or is that caused by tequila intake) he has been connected with music and hospitality form an early age on. "My love of music started on the infamous stage of pop music called Donkiesjot in my hometown. My former band the WW-Band was also founded there. It wasn’t long after that that I brought a tray of tequila shots into the dressing room of The Slackers, who decided pretty soon after that to play in my bar. That gig was recorded and one thing led to another. Together with Jan van Montfort and Rino Vincken, owners of record shop Music Machine, and Rob Driessen of 3Sun Recordings, I started my own record label in 2004”.

The Slackers

The Slackers are self-styled masters of Reggae, Ska and Rock’n’Roll from New York City. They began in 1991 in NYC. After years of local gigs and rehearsing in a dingy basement in Manhattan’s lower east side, the band released its debut album in 1996. The band’s success resulted in the re-lease of a second album in 1997. Since then The Slackers have released 14 more albums amongst which 3 live albums (Live at Ernestos, Upsettin' Ernestos, Slack in Japan), several EPs and numerous singles and compilation tracks. Since 1997 The Slackers have played yearly over 100 shows on all continents of the world and abroad. The band’s musical style is distinctly from their contemporaries; a mix of early Jamaican music with classic 50’s and 60s American styles. There are influences from 50s and 60s Rock’n’Roll, Rythmn and Blues, Jazz and Latin music. Singer Vic Ruggiero has coined the term ‘Jamaican Rock’nRoll.’ to describe it. With the demise of record companies over the last 5 years, The Slackers have suc-cessfully used crowdfunding to release new music including the latest release, The Slackers [self-titled] in February 2016.

De crowdfunding campaign

There’s that certain kind of chemistry brewing between Ernesto's and The Slackers. Every year the New York boys visit the small town of Sittard, their home away from home. Their European tours nowadays mostly end with a homecoming concert in Ernesto’s. This year The Slackers have been around for 25 years and Ernesto’s has been in existence for 26 years, perfect timing to organize their 27th concert. After 2 earlier live CD's it’s time to celebrate this union with a 3rd recording (possibly even on vinyl). That is, if you support our plan and spend a few bucks on our crowdfunding-campaign to realize this live-CD/LP.

What We Need & What You Get

Recording and producing a CD/LP requires an investment so we need your help. Support our crowdfunding-campaign and you will of course be rewarded. Irrespective of your donation, our gratitude will be immeasurable! Dependent on the size of your donation we also bring joy to your ears with heavenly notes via MP3, CD or vinyl, accompanied by a stunning cover and exclusive booklet. This special booklet will be exclusively given to those who support our campaign. It will NOT be sold together with the CD/LP in shops later on.

Recordings & Party

As Ernesto stated himself:  “It’s my goal to bring parties together to have a party.” The party and the recording of the album took place November 21st at Ernesto’s. 

What is the production investment?

Costs live recordings € 2500,- (already spent) Costs technical facilities € 1000,- Costs CD's/LP's production, covers, booklets, inlays € 4500 (min 500 ) Costs rights, design promo € 2000,- Total investment: € 10.000,-

What can we achieve together?

All our benefits are stated here. You can be as rude and reckless as you want; for 10 bucks you will get a download link to exclusive MP3-materiaal, for 20 bucks you will get a CD recording and for only 30 bucks you will be able to add a new LP to your record collection. Your donation will be returned to your account if we don't reach our goal. If our donations exceed the targeted amount we will spend the money on getting The Slackers to the release party of the CD/LP in the spring of 2017. Possible exceeding amounts after that, will be given to a charity-organization with a musical purpose.

Record label

The CD and LP will be released under the Music Machine Records label. The recordings are done by 3Sun Recordings. The release is planned in the spring of 2017. Music Machine and Ernesto's have already produced several live recordings of The Slackers and other artists like La Troba Kung Fu and The Paladins.

Spread the word

So spread the word and help us! Donate, share and spread the news. Choose one of the options and use social media tools to spread this perfectly innocent and fun musical virus. For more information send us an e-mail. Stay informed and like us on our Facebook-page.

Note!

1) Since the concert already took place, the voting on the setlist has stopped.
2) Payments can only be done with Paypal. You can use this link for instructions about using Ideal or your creditcard.

story:
MY STORY.

My name is Matthew Fagan and I am a 10 String guitarist and multi-instrumentalist from Australia. www.matthew-fagan.com Initially I set out to become a doctor and then chose the path of music for my career. It was a very tough choice as there was a lot of pressure on me to become a doctor. Ironically I say I chose a great stable future for myself.

I performed in the evenings throughout my medicine degree.  I couldn’t disguise how much music excited me as well as commanding an audience’s attention and the prospect of travelling the world.  Music was my passion and eventually it took over and was augmented when I was accepted into the Classical Guitar performance course at the Victorian College of the Arts.

I have since had the opportunity to perform in more than 120 countries worldwide as a soloist, with orchestra and bands including extensive touring across Europe, South America, Alaska, Canada, China, Japan and South East Asia

The biggest highlight of my music performance career so far has been touring with Billy Connolly for 53 nights in 1999 to 2000. Billy was the greatest mentor that I have had on learning how to be a world entertainer. Billy’s gift of his banjo to me at the end of the tour was like receiving an Olympic Gold Medal.  It has been a dream/goal to make a recording with the banjo since that moment.

Over the last few years I have been brainstorming ideas for a project to give back something what I have received in life and my music career and decided on creating a recording to raise funds for Parkinson’s awareness and support.

MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT’S IMPORTANT TO ME.

My campaign is the recording and production of CD A Song for Billy and provides a great platform to create Music and express my gratitude to the unique life changing experience I had by touring with  Billy Connolly, and by recording a Cd with the Banjo he gifted to me.   The surplus donations above the project goal, from purchases of perks and sales of the CD will be donated to Parkinson’s Australia. http://www.parkinsons.org.au/ Parkinson’s disease has been of interest to me since my medical training and it is the medical area that I have chosen to give back to.

(This is an example of CD Artwork and not the final artwork to be used in production)

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP ACHIEVE

Your donation will help me to fund the recording and manufacture of a great CD called A Song for Billy.

I have received assistance by Phil Deeh Productions for producing one song from the Album, which is ready for you to check out right here at this secret link https://soundcloud.com/matthewfagan/billys-danc...

Surplus donations above the project goal from donations, purchases of perks and sales of the CD will be donated to Parkinson’s Australia.

Parkinson’s Australia rely on fundraising and generous donations from the community to continue and grow their delivery of education, advice and peer support services and fund vital research. 

Your contribution will help provide information, education, advice and peer support services to improve the life for people living with Parkinson’s. 

Support extends to those living with Parkinson’s, their families and carers, peer support groups and health care professionals.

Parkinson's Australia launched the findings of the 2015 Deloitte Access Economics report on Living with Parkinson's at Parliament House on 15 September 2015 and presented this video to help politicians better understand the needs of the community. 

 

As quoted on this video

"We welcome you at the front door or your disease, all the way through the course of it as it gets more and more increasingly difficult for you" Associate Professor Simon Lewis

Monica Hall, living with Young Onset Parkinson's, speaks from the heart at the launch of the Parkinson's Australia Action Framework at Parliament House on 15 March 2016. Watch her inspiring plea to Make Parkinson's a Priority.

HOW MUCH FUNDING WE NEED AND WHAT YOU WILL GET

The funding we seek will go mainly towards studio time with a stellar team ($5500) and the fee for our amazing session musicians ($3000). This leaves us with $1470 to go towards the presentation/design and production of the album itself. $2000 has been allocated to help spread the word about the campaign on Radio, Print and Social Media. In total $11,970.

Here’s the breakdown of what it’ll cost to make this all happen:

Studio Recording time, Audio engineer for tracking mixing, post production mastering of the CD- $5500

Studio musician hire (Bass, Drums, Fiddle, Bag Pipes) - $3000

Manufacture of 500 CD’s (1st Run) - $870 http://www.implant.com.au/

If the first run of hardcopy CD’s are sold there is approximately $10,000 in revenue

(some CD’s are sold cheaper for 2)

CD Manufacture contingency- Per Needs basis.  Depending on response to campaign it may be required to order extra run of CD’s and these funds will be taken from donations towards the campaign.  The revenue from the purchase of CD’s after the target is reached will still be donated to Parkinson’s Australia

CD artwork design by Mark Russel – $80 p/h $600

Advertising– Radio/Newspaper/Social Media $2,000

Project management, administration and publicity time will be donated in kind to this project

EXCITING UNIQUE PERKS THAT ARE BEING OFFERED

I've put together a really exciting group of perks, some that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

I am no longer teaching privately but availing myself for some Banjo or Guitar lessons exclusively for this campaign for all levels of players and even first timers.  The perks are a 30 minute or 1 hour banjo or guitar lesson via Skype.  I am a tertiary qualified teacher with over 30 years of experience. With a B.Mus, B.Arts Performance, Graduate Diploma in Education, Masters of Cultural Development.  You will definately learn something!  

Or what about a 90 minute Solo concert with me performing the album and more in your living room for you and your friends!

If you want to donate and don't want a perk click the BACK IT Button at the top right hand side of the screen and donate what you like.

WHERE THE FUNDS GO IF ENTIRE GOAL IS NOT REACHED.

  • This is a fixed campaign so if the funds are not raised the money will be refunded.                We encourage you to donate your contribution to the Parkinson’s cause.

THE IMPACT

THE VALUE OF THE PROJECT TO MYSELF

The project is special for me as it’s an opportunity to produce some new great. Music has become the medium for healing that I practice for myself and those that listen to it.  People often tell me how listening to my music has helped them get through hard times. So even if I did not get to become a doctor I believe that I have been able to help people through music.

Of course also this is the ultimate project to return the great friendship and mentoring Billy Connolly has personally given me since 1997.   Not only from the profound effect of Billy giving me his own Banjo, but also his gift and sharing himself with me as a touring artist and as a fan.

Billy especially made sure that we shared private time together each of the 53 nights I was with him, before I went on stage.  Speaking from experience, many “stars” would never even meet their “opening act”.   We played music together and Billy always had a story with a great lesson in life to share with me.  Billy made me very welcome as part of his touring family.  Every time he returns to Australia right up until 2015, when we are re-united backstage, Billy always greets me with a hug, recalls funny stories and always asks after my family.

I was deeply saddened to see the deterioration in Billy’s health when we met in 2013.  But I was even more deeply moved by Billy’s bravery to keep going and to keep living and giving by touring while his health was increasingly affected.  He is a true inspiration, and his joy of life always has warmed my own heart when I have had to face challenges and “hard times” in my own life. 

I couldn’t think of a greater gift to have received Billy’s Banjo that he gave me is a constant physical reminder and symbol of Billy’s spirit.  And it is this gift of uplifting spirit that I want to share, particularly for the people whose spirit could need a lift. 

Not just those with conditions of Parkinson’s, but their friends and families who experience the hardship with their loved ones.

It is important to raise awareness of Parkinson’s.  The great life lesson of Billy Connolly that I want to share by people hearing music on his banjo is that there is still hope and life even when suffering a terrible affliction, and above all, people do not have to feel they have lost their humanity when living with any dis-ease.

THE PROJECTS VALUE TO THE WORLD

We have developed the philosophy that it’s best to start in our own backyard, hence why the focus of our campaign starts in Australia.  We have been informed by Olivia Nassaris, Campaigns and Communications co-ordinator from Parkinsons Australia that in Australia the majority of funding goes towards research with major corporate backing. Onground support is where there is a funding short fall and where more funding is required.  So it makes sense to make sure that funding for those who are suffering with the disease are looked after also until a possible cure is found.

STATEMENT FROM PARKINSON’S AUSTRALIA

Parkinson’s is a neurodegenerative condition with no cure to date. Because of its chronic progressive nature, insidious onset, complicated and diverse motor and non-motor symptoms and limited management options Parkinson’s is one of the most challenging diseases.

Parkinson’s Australia is the national not-for-profit body working to support and advocate for all people affected by Parkinson’s and other movement disorders. Our mission is to create an environment that is responsive to the needs of all people affected by Parkinson’s. It is estimated that there are currently 70,000 Australians living with Parkinson’s.

The State-based Parkinson’s organisations provide a variety of services to people living with Parkinson’s, these include:

·        Education for patients, clinicians and health care workers

·        290 support groups nationwide for people living with Parkinson’s 

·        Support through the 1800 info line

·        Counselling services for people living with Parkinson’s and their carers

·        Clinical support for people living with Parkinson’s through specialist nurses and allied health professionals

·        Support for research including scholarship programs

 

PREVIOUS SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS

I have previously recorded 8 CD’s

2015. Recording of two new Albums in the USA, “Solstice” Guitar and Piano CD which features classical masters Beethoven, Rodrigo, Bach, Albeniz and Vivaldi and a Festive Guitar Album with Christmas and Celtic Music

2013. Recording of,“Virtuoso- A Homage to My Ancestors” which pays homage to Matthew’s ancestor Cecil Parkes child violin prodigy who toured with Dame Nellie Melba & “Ukuleleland” a world music Ukulele CD at Green Jean Studios Kansas, USA.  Virtuoso features compositions from classical masters Vivaldi, Mozart, Paganini and Spanish Classical and Flamenco, Celtic and Renaissance Lute Music. 

2012. Matthew’s Arrangement of Tocatta (From CD One Day in Nashville) was licensed by Mana Music  for ABC TV Program “A Moody Christmas”. Matthew’s Composition Arabesque (from CD  Voyages & Journeys)  & Morning Song (From CD Indigo Moon)  were licensed by Level 2 Music for Network 7 Program “Winners & Losers.

2011. Recording of CD “One Day in Nashville” First American Recording.  From Bach to Beatles, Spanish to  Led Zepplin and Celtic Medleys on 10-string Spanish guitar “One Day in Nashville”  records for the first time Matthew’s impressive 10-String Arrangements that he composed for touring with Shirley Bassey, Natalie Cole, The Buena Vista Social Club, Michael Crawford and Billy Connolly.  Steel String Guitar features in the unique arrangements of Celtic Tunes i.e. Amazing Grace, and Matthew’s own Celtic Inspired pieces “Ashokan Farewell”, “A Woman’s Lament” and “Renaissance”.  A particular highlight on Celtic Steel String is Matthew’s Arrangement of J.S Bach’s Toccata which was very popular in Matthew’s show when he toured with Scottish Comedian Billy Connolly.

2009 Recording of Album Voyages and Journeys with guests Rona Iranian Music Ensemble, Indigenous Australian Musicians and Indian percussion. The album was signed to American record label called favoured nations of famous American Guitarist Steve Vai.  Tommy Emmanuel is the only other Australian Guitarist signed to this label.    The album covers genres from world music and pop with flavours of Spanish Flamenco and Spanish Classical music, Celtic American Roots and Blues, Afro Cuban and Middle Eastern music.

1996. Recording of Album, Indigo Moon containing original compositions and arrangements of traditional celtic and spanish music including for orchestra.

1992. Recording of Album, Point of Departure.

Listen online

http://www.cdbaby.com/Artist/MatthewFagan1

From 1997 to the present I have been the music director and main facilitator for the Voyages Community Multi-cultural Performing Arts Project. Between 2004-2010 I was commissioned as Music Director/Composer by the Victorian Government and Pan Events of “Voyages” Australia Day Public Concert, at Federation Square to audiences of over 20,000 people.  The Voyages project was funded by the Australian Arts Council and Vic Health in 2004 for a regional tour to 8 Victorian Communities with a budget of over $450,000.

I was also the recipient of funding through the The City of Port Phillip Cultural Development Fund and on the 24th of June, 2012, and presented 'Voyages" at the St Kilda Town Hall, with over 200 Multicultural and local Community Artists performing to a full house.  The Voyages Project also received funding from the City of Kingston and the Victorian Government- Victorian Multicultural Commission, and Bendigo Bank- Highett and another large scale concert was presented at the Kingston City Hall on the 27th of October, 2012.

For Background, Photos, Media, Video go to

http://www.matthew-fagan.com/#!voyages-cultural-projects/oz7l8

http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Voyages-Commun...

Risks & Challenges

There is the risk of possibility of not meeting the target.

How we can overcome these hurdles.

We have a very experienced team who regularly promote events and festivals with hundreds of attendees and participants. 

Plan for solving these challenges.

We will make use of our existing network and we have support from Parkinson’s Australia and The Shake it up Australia Foundation to share with their networks.  We will be getting publicity on all media from radio, print and social media.

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Get this Perk" button on the perk of interest  Every little bit counts.

If you are not able to contribute No problem! There are a bunch of other ways you can help.       It would be truly helpful if you could help get the word by sharing the campaign link on facebook and twitter with the social media share buttons on this page.  Also by liking and sharing the facebook page A Song for Billy https://www.facebook.com/ASongforBilly/            and twitter https://twitter.com/ASongforBilly

Thank you so much for your time and for supporting this campaign in the ways that you can!
