especially made sure that we shared private time together each of the 53 nights I was with him, before I went on stage.  Speaking from experience, many “stars” would never even meet their “opening act”.   We played music together and Billy always had a story with a great lesson in life to share with me.  Billy made me very welcome as part of his touring family.  Every time he returns to Australia right up until 2015, when we are re-united backstage, Billy always greets me with a hug, recalls funny stories and always asks after my family.I was deeply saddened to see the deterioration in Billy’s health when we met in 2013.  But I was even more deeply moved by Billy’s bravery to keep going and to keep living and giving by touring while his health was increasingly affected.  He is a true inspiration, and his joy of life always has warmed my own heart when I have had to face challenges and “hard times” in my own life. I couldn’t think of a greater gift to have received Billy’s Banjo that he gave me is a constant physical reminder and symbol of Billy’s spirit.  And it is this gift of uplifting spirit that I want to share, particularly for the people whose spirit could need a lift. Not just those with conditions of Parkinson’s, but their friends and families who experience the hardship with their loved ones.It is important to raise awareness of Parkinson’s.  The great life lesson of Billy Connolly that I want to share by people hearing music on his banjo is that there is still hope and life even when suffering a terrible affliction, and above all, people do not have to feel they have lost their humanity when living with any dis-ease.THE PROJECTS VALUE TO THE WORLDWe have developed the philosophy that it’s best to start in our own backyard, hence why the focus of our campaign starts in Australia.  We have been informed by Olivia Nassaris, Campaigns and Communications co-ordinator from Parkinsons Australia that in Australia the majority of funding goes towards research with major corporate backing. Onground support is where there is a funding short fall and where more funding is required.  So it makes sense to make sure that funding for those who are suffering with the disease are looked after also until a possible cure is found.STATEMENT FROM PARKINSON’S AUSTRALIAParkinson’s is a neurodegenerative condition with no cure to date. Because of its chronic progressive nature, insidious onset, complicated and diverse motor and non-motor symptoms and limited management options Parkinson’s is one of the most challenging diseases.Parkinson’s Australia is the national not-for-profit body working to support and advocate for all people affected by Parkinson’s and other movement disorders. Our mission is to create an environment that is responsive to the needs of all people affected by Parkinson’s. It is estimated that there are currently 70,000 Australians living with Parkinson’s.The State-based Parkinson’s organisations provide a variety of services to people living with Parkinson’s, these include:·        Education for patients, clinicians and health care workers·        290 support groups nationwide for people living with Parkinson’s ·        Support through the 1800 info line·        Counselling services for people living with Parkinson’s and their carers·        Clinical support for people living with Parkinson’s through specialist nurses and allied health professionals·        Support for research including scholarship programs PREVIOUS SUCCESSFUL PROJECTSI have previously recorded 8 CD’s2015. Recording of two new Albums in the USA, “Solstice” Guitar and Piano CD which features classical masters Beethoven, Rodrigo, Bach, Albeniz and Vivaldi and a Festive Guitar Album with Christmas and Celtic Music2013. Recording of,“Virtuoso- A Homage to My Ancestors” which pays homage to Matthew’s ancestor Cecil Parkes child violin prodigy who toured with Dame Nellie Melba & “Ukuleleland” a world music Ukulele CD at Green Jean Studios Kansas, USA.  Virtuoso features compositions from classical masters Vivaldi, Mozart, Paganini and Spanish Classical and Flamenco, Celtic and Renaissance Lute Music. 2012. Matthew’s Arrangement of Tocatta (From CD One Day in Nashville) was licensed by Mana Music  for ABC TV Program “A Moody Christmas”. Matthew’s Composition Arabesque (from CD  Voyages & Journeys)  & Morning Song (From CD Indigo Moon)  were licensed by Level 2 Music for Network 7 Program “Winners & Losers.2011. Recording of CD “One Day in Nashville” First American Recording.  From Bach to Beatles, Spanish to  Led Zepplin and Celtic Medleys on 10-string Spanish guitar “One Day in Nashville”  records for the first time Matthew’s impressive 10-String Arrangements that he composed for touring with Shirley Bassey, Natalie Cole, The Buena Vista Social Club, Michael Crawford and Billy Connolly.  Steel String Guitar features in the unique arrangements of Celtic Tunes i.e. Amazing Grace, and Matthew’s own Celtic Inspired pieces “Ashokan Farewell”, “A Woman’s Lament” and “Renaissance”.  A particular highlight on Celtic Steel String is Matthew’s Arrangement of J.S Bach’s Toccata which was very popular in Matthew’s show when he toured with Scottish Comedian Billy Connolly.2009 Recording of Album Voyages and Journeys with guests Rona Iranian Music Ensemble, Indigenous Australian Musicians and Indian percussion. The album was signed to American record label called favoured nations of famous American Guitarist Steve Vai.  Tommy Emmanuel is the only other Australian Guitarist signed to this label.    The album covers genres from world music and pop with flavours of Spanish Flamenco and Spanish Classical music, Celtic American Roots and Blues, Afro Cuban and Middle Eastern music.1996. Recording of Album, Indigo Moon containing original compositions and arrangements of traditional celtic and spanish music including for orchestra.1992. Recording of Album, Point of Departure.Listen online http://www.cdbaby.com/Artist/MatthewFagan1From 1997 to the present I have been the music director and main facilitator for the Voyages Community Multi-cultural Performing Arts Project. Between 2004-2010 I was commissioned as Music Director/Composer by the Victorian Government and Pan Events of “Voyages” Australia Day Public Concert, at Federation Square to audiences of over 20,000 people.  The Voyages project was funded by the Australian Arts Council and Vic Health in 2004 for a regional tour to 8 Victorian Communities with a budget of over $450,000.I was also the recipient of funding through the The City of Port Phillip Cultural Development Fund and on the 24th of June, 2012, and presented 'Voyages" at the St Kilda Town Hall, with over 200 Multicultural and local Community Artists performing to a full house.  The Voyages Project also received funding from the City of Kingston and the Victorian Government- Victorian Multicultural Commission, and Bendigo Bank- Highett and another large scale concert was presented at the Kingston City Hall on the 27th of October, 2012.For Background, Photos, Media, Video go tohttp://www.matthew-fagan.com/#!voyages-cultural-projects/oz7l8http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Voyages-Commun...Risks & ChallengesThere is the risk of possibility of not meeting the target.How we can overcome these hurdles.We have a very experienced team who regularly promote events and festivals with hundreds of attendees and participants. Plan for solving these challenges.We will make use of our existing network and we have support from Parkinson’s Australia and The Shake it up Australia Foundation to share with their networks.  We will be getting publicity on all media from radio, print and social media.If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Get this Perk" button on the perk of interest  Every little bit counts.If you are not able to contribute No problem! There are a bunch of other ways you can help.       It would be truly helpful if you could help get the word by sharing the campaign link on facebook and twitter with the social media share buttons on this page.  Also by liking and sharing the facebook page A Song for Billy https://www.facebook.com/ASongforBilly/            and twitter https://twitter.com/ASongforBillyThank you so much for your time and for supporting this campaign in the ways that you can!

story:
It has been 11 years since Mel Melton & The Wicked Mojos recorded "Papa Mojo's Roadhouse". The band has been performing steadily since 1998, this project will be the third CD and the first with an open crowd funding campaign. The band has a lot of new material they are ready to record. YOU can be a part of helping Mel, Max, T.A., and Kelly bring another round of "Mojo Music" to fans everywhere.

A little background: Mel Melton is a local celebrity chef and musician in North Carolina, he was born and raised in Gastonia, NC but found his path and lifelong calling to South Louisiana in 1969 when a college friend invited him to visit his home town of Lafayette, LA. It is there where he met his future band mates, Sonny Landreth, and Dave Ranson. He fell in love with the rich culture and physical beauty of Southwest Louisiana and did not leave for 20 years. During his time there he cultivated his harmonica skills, and supplementing his income he entered the diverse culinary history of the region. Working his way up from dishwasher to cook, eventually developing his cooking skills to become a Certified Chef. Along the way he was nurtured by local chefs, friends, and taking classes to Chef Certification.  

In 1982, Mel formed the band "Bayou Rhythm" with Sonny Landreth, and Dave Ranson, eventually adding C.J. Chenier to the line up. They recorded "Way Down in Louisiana" in 1985, which featured the song "Congo Square", co-written by Mel and Sonny and has since been recorded by the Neville Brothers, John Mayall, Tom Principato, and other artist. Bayou Rhythm toured heavily and headlined national shows and also opened for legendary musicians including Ray Charles, B.B. King, Dr. John, The Neville Brothers, Stevie Ray Vaughn, Dave Edmonds, and The Fabulous Thunderbirds. Mel, Sonny, and Dave still have the occasion to appear together on stage, most recently at the 2016 Bonita Beach Blues Festival in March 2016. 

Fast forward almost 20 years to 2007 when Mel joined his passion for the food and music of Louisiana in a restaurant project inspired by the CD of the same name, "Papa Mojo's Roadhouse" in a strip mall in South Durham. During the 7 years of operating Papa Mojo's Roadhouse he brought in top notch international and local bands, hosted an extremely popular Open Mic Night, and won many awards for his Louisiana inspired cuisine. Mel often was a guest with the bands he booked at Papa Mojos including some of the hottest names in blues, Zydeco, and roots music. Past musicians appearing at Papa Mojo's Roadhouse include: George Porter Jr. & The Runnin Pardners, Mingo Fishtrap, Ligthnin' Wells, Big Bill Morganfield, Greg Humphreys, Dennis Gruenling & Doug Deming with the Jewel Tones, DelToro Richardson, Rich DelGrosso, Tom Principato, Joe Taylor Group, John Dee Holeman, Big Joe & The Dynaflows, Teresa James & The Rhythm Tramps, Jimmy Thackery, Will MacFarlane, Bill "Sauce Boss Wharton, Randy McAllister, Bobby Messano, Leigh "Lil Queenie" Harris, Bobby Radcliff, Lil' Brian & The Zydeco Travelers, Bill Lyerly, Michael Burks, Damon Fowler, Nathan & The Zydeco Cha-Chas, Randall Bramblett, R.J. Mischo, Lil' Ronnie Owens, Steve Riley & The Mamou Playboys, Don Dixon, Studebaker John, Joe Filisko, Scott Ainslie, The Soul Rebels, The Scissormen,  C.J. Chenier & The Red Hot Louisiana Band, and Sonny Landreth Band. Oh, and that is not a complete list!

Mel describes the Wicked Mojo's sound and his music as "Mojo Music", he says it's "like the food. Down in Louisiana everybody cooks,  and they like to stir it up their own way". Be a part of Mel's new project, with new original songs written by Mel with some old standards spiced up his way. He has been planning this project for a long time and he needs your help to see it through. For those that know Mel, that have been a fan of his music, seen his shows, even been to his cooking shows, everyone knows he is a natural born entertainer. For new fans, discover his "Mojo Music" for yourself!

Nothing describes Mel Melton better than a Chicago Sun-Times headline from 1986, "MELTON COOKS ON STAGE AND OFF!"

Here's the breakdown:

  1. Pre-production $1500
  2. Production $10,000
  3. Graphic Design $5000
  4. Post-production $5000
  5. PR, Advertising $3500

story:
Indiegogo Sample: Rites of a Goddess Sample 

My name is Chaz Samuel. I've played piano for almost 25 years as a hobby of mine. I am by no means a professional pianist. However, I've played violin for 7 and gained certifications from the Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music when I was a child. I am a graduate of University of West Florida with a degree in Creative Writing and currently working on a novel but music is my passion. Since I was 13 years old I've wanted to make music for Nintendo. Specifically, I've wanted to make music for "The Legend of Zelda". I've studied the music over and over and listened to countless hours of soundtracks and fan creations. 

This soundtrack's ultimate purpose was to provide catharsis for me. I've played through and have completed the latest entry in the series--"Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild". Upon completion I realized how little of the main themes I heard in the game. Granted it was a stylistic choice I respected, but I longed for something more bombastic and orchestral. The few songs peppered throughout the game were among the best in the series but I needed more. I searched the internet and found various cover songs and re-orchestrations of the themes but felt that the only way I could fill this hunger for more music was to create my own.  

So I gathered all the necessary equipment and instruments I would need to make a re-score of Breath of the Wild's soundtrack but I realized quickly that a simple re-score would not be good. Using my creative writing background I sat down and analyzed the history of Hyrule and made a few notes regarding the events directly preceding "Breath of the Wild". The focus of the soundtrack changed from re-score to fan-made soundtrack.  

Let me start off by saying this, the soundtrack is complete. 

So naturally the question is why ask for funding at all? Well in order to publish the soundtrack online to iTunes and Spotify and Amazon.com, I will need the necessary Mechanical Licenses for each song, a fact I did not realize until it was time to publish the soundtrack. I am asking for $1,500.00

The soundtrack is a 3 disc set with a total of 38 songs. A Mechanical License for each song will be handled through DestroKid. Their fee is $1.00 per song, per year billed annually. So in actuality it will be $12.00 per song and that comes out to about $456.00 just to release the soundtrack for which I will be handling the upkeep yearly.

"Yes, but even with that...you're left with $944. Do you need that much?" The short answer is yes. My goal is also to provide physical copies of the soundtrack  as perks of backing the project. The total physical discs produced would be 300 for $820.00 through CDBaby.com. I would also commission actual artists to assist in making a 2 hour long youtube video telling the story and creating the website and promotional material. The cost breakdown is here:

"But, wait! It shows a cost of $3,000 for instruments and samples. Are we paying that too?" No. I've done 59% of the work, all I need is your help with the other 26%. If the project is funded beyond the $1,500.00 then we can talk about artists and all that. 

"So what do I get out of this and what do you get out of this?" Well for starters, since the soundtrack is complete and is ready to go for the most part, $2 gets you the entire soundtrack and $10 nets you a fancy physical copy. That's it. No fluff, no outlandish promises. As a thank you for backing the project you receive 38 songs for a $2 donation or a physical CD for $10. As to what I get out of it, well--I get the satisfaction that the songs are being heard by someone and out of legal trouble with Nintendo.

Regardless of the funding situation, the soundtrack will be available to all iTunes, Spotify, and Amazon.com users by the end of July. If by chance the project does not meet the goal, I will use the funds to offset the cost for the Mechanical Licenses and send out the physical CDs to backers who requested it. There may be a delay in shipment. 

This project is only the beginning. This is my first large scale project. I've done commission work before and have always felt proud of my accomplishments. However, this project is different. I feel especially fortunate to have my friends and family supporting me. This will hope to introduce new themes to the world. One of my many talents is melding themes together. My hope is that when a composer hears these songs that they are inspired to make music too.

To show you my record here are some CDs and singles I've published in the past:

Chaz Samuel: Spotify

Soundtrack Samples: 

1-01: Tales of Hyrule Past
1-02: Main Theme
3-06: Indiegogo Trailer Reversed

This soundtrack means a lot to me and I want to make sure you get as much enjoyment out of it as I had when making it. There are a few songs here that make me tear up slightly, I just hope you enjoy them too. 

 

At this point I need your help to get the soundtrack over the finish line. I face legal trouble with Nintendo if I just put these songs out there on the internet without the proper permissions. These Mechanical Licenses help with that.

Some may not be able to contribute monetarily. I ask that those of you who can, get the word out. Spread the word through "The Legend of Zelda" fanbase. Let them know that something is coming. That a story is about to be unleashed on the world. Direct them back here and let them know that we will have new music to them be the end of this year. There are plenty of share tools on this page, use them! :D

story: Hey guys! I'm working to raise 2500 hundred dollars to get me out the Nashville to record! I believe this is the next big step with my music career, and I'm so excited to have this opportunity. This record will be heard internationally! I couldn't have gotten this far without you guys supporting and encouraging me the whole way. Please take the time to watch my video and consider contributing; there are lots of fun perks that you get for doing so!

story:
Celebrating our Mothers

Our annual Mother's Day Gospel Celebration started in 2015 as a way to celebrate our mothers and come together over a meal with other families. This year we are hoping to hold the celebration on a larger scale and donate the profits from ticket sales to a mother-related charity (or cause) supporting struggling mothers and mothers in need.

 

What We Need

We are using this campaign to cover the costs of the venue and running the event for our gospel celebration, allowing us to donate all profits from ticket sales to our mother-related charity.

Any extra funds raised for this campaign will also go to the support of mothers in need.

 

The Impact

The support of this campaign and our gospel celebration event will help mothers who are struggling, whether that be from poverty and financial strain, homelessness, single parenting, chronic illnesses, cancer, or family trauma and violence.

We will be collating items for several MothersInNeed Care Packages (care packages created for our event) and donating all profits to a charity that will be chosen by our supporters, families, and friends. Scroll down to see more info about the 3 charities we have chosen to vote for this year.

 

What is Gospel Music?!

Gospel music is a music genre in Christian music. It can be known to contain dominant vocals and a strong use of beautiful harmonies! Gospel music often has elements containing choirs, acapella sections or whole songs, music breaks, clapping, stomping, praising and dancing. An all around AMAZING experience!

 

Campaign Perks!

You can make a donation of any value or purchase one of our awesome perks. Our perks range from $10-$900 and include funky music aspects. Some also include tickets to our gospel celebration!

 

How You Can Help

  • By donating / backing this campaign
  • By purchasing one of our awesome PERKS!
  • By donating items towards our MotherInNeed Care Packages
  • By attending the event!!

You can also help by:

  • Inviting friends, families, and mothers to attend the event!
  • Sharing this campaign on your social media and with your friends and family!

 

Vote for a Charity / Nominate a Mother

We want our supporters, families, and friends to vote for the charity we choose this year. 

  • Vote for a charity here - www.motivation-studios.com/CharityPick
  • Nominate a mother to receive one of our MothersInNeed Care Packages - www.motivation-studios.com/Nominate

Thank you for your support!

By donating items towards our MotherInNeed Care Packages
By attending the event!!

You can also help by:

Inviting friends, families, and mothers to attend the event!
Sharing this campaign on your social media and with your friends and family!

 
Vote for a Charity / Nominate a Mother
We want our supporters, families, and friends to vote for the charity we choose this year. 

Vote for a charity here - www.motivation-studios.com/CharityPick

Nominate a mother to receive one of our MothersInNeed Care Packages - www.motivation-studios.com/Nominate



Thank you for your support!

story:
Mark Wade - Corpo - Lorenzo De Finti European Clubs Tours 2017 - 2018

Artists Welcome Message

 

A Flexible Campaign

We propose a campaign with a flexible goal, it means the campaign will raise all the fund collected same if the financial objective is not reach.  We choose that type of campaign because as the first objective of this fund is to support the tours of these musicians during the season 2017/2018 it is not necessary to be restricted by a "go no-go" campaign.

Based on the flexible goal principle we propose to reach different milestones to finance the tours and be able to record an evening for a future release of these great bands.

What Have We Done So Far? 

We’ve spent the last months preparing the groundwork to organize the season of concert 2017/2018.

Firstly, we've met up with the jazz promoters to schedule gigs for a first leg between November 27th and December 15th 2017.

3 concerts have been booked in 2017, November 30th in France and Switzerland, December 2nd in Belgium. We have the possibilities to extend the tour in Germany, Poland, Denmark, Austria, Luxembourg and Estonia.

Secondly, we work actively to create our proper SVOD platform to make available our productions on any platform.  Our Jazz SVOD channel will be launched January 1st 2018.

BYP.tv will feature exclusive content, full concerts, educational music programs and jazz documentaries.

Why We Need Your Help With Funding

First, we need your help to make these tours happen. A club remains the venue where the primary entertainment is the performance of jazz music and the first place for the audience to discover new talents. For bands, to perform in a club is the first opportunity to open doors to develop their art. As they are rather small compared to other music venues, it is very difficult for the artist and the venue to balance financially a gig especially when the venue is not located in a big city.

Secondly, we need your help to complete the budget to produce an audiovisual recording of these performances. To work in the best conditions and offer a quality level suited to your experience, we will have to rent a venue and recording devices then work with talented sound engineer and director.  

Artists On Tour

Mark Wade Trio - American Jazz

Voted one of the top 10 bassists of 2016 by the prestigious Downbeat Magazine Reader’s Poll, Mark Wade has been an active bassist in the NYC area for over 20 years.  In February 2015, Wade released his debut album Event Horizon to international acclaim.  The album received great critical reviews from a host of domestic and international publications such as Downbeat Magazine, Jazz In Europe, The New York City Jazz Record, All About Jazz, Jazz Life (Japan), and several others.
Arnaldo DeSouteiro, founder of Jazz Station Records and NARAS-GRAMMY voting member, voted Event Horizon in the top 10 for his Best of 2015 in the categories of Best Acoustic Bass, Best Composer, and Best Instrumental Group, and #16 for Best Album of the Year. Event Horizon was played extensively on radio stations throughout the U.S. and Europe.

Currently, he plays with pianist and composer Takashi Asai, soprano Melinda Hughes, pianist Cecilia Coleman, trumpet player Bill Warfield.

Lorenzo De Finti Acoustic Quartet - Modern Jazz

With his outstanding technique and artistic expression, Lorenzo was immediately recognized by the media and began playing some of the most important musical venues in Europe very early. Specialized in jazz and contemporary music, Lorenzo has traveled back and forth from Europe to the United States, collaborating with important musicians such as J. Gregg, B. Dameo, T. Robinson, S. Kimmons, D. Freemann, G. Goldstein, C. Vilchez, S. Hunt, D. Martinez, T. Scott, T. Dambley, A. Acuna, E. Rodriguez, E. Marienthal, F. Gambale, M.Abrams, The Harlem Gospel Singers, J. Bisonette, F. Bosso and many others.

"WE LIVE HERE, suite for jazz quartet" is the first album of Lorenzo's acoustic quartet, and has been released by the Norwegian label Losen Records. A big success, top ten download album in the Norwegian and Canadian itunes official download charts, reviews from all over the world and many concerts around Europe, Italy, Switzerland, Norway, Lithuania, Poland, England. Lorenzo currently holds his own jazz and classical radio show on Rete Due Swiss national network in Lugano (Switzerland), interviewing many important musicians and musicologists and commenting on live concerts.

Mikael Godée's CORPO - New Jazz

CORPO presents new Jazz in the best meaning of the phrase.  The band, leaded by Mikael Godée, has been working as a group since 1992, and toured in Europe and went for a very successful tour to South-Africa in 1999. The South-African audiences did really appreciate CORPO, mix of Nordic melodies and African percussion.

Mikael Godée is one of the main ingredients of what we call Swedish jazz. His involvement with the Corpo and Änglaspel groups, where his lyrical and warm soprano saxophone creates a unique musical atmosphere, has been very important in today's jazz scene. "
This skilled and social musician who has covered numerous constellations with a pleasantly melodic atmosphere and great integrity has been rewarded with a Grammis (Swedish equivalent of the Grammy Awards) and a Jazz in Sweden Award.

”A lot consists only of a bright, shining surface. We are supposed to be impressed by the brilliance. But most often it lacks substantional context. Refreshing, then, to discover music with bone and marrow, as was the fact in Piteå, to have a chance to see a musical performance that didn’t need any ”show or glitter”, just music that lingers in the open minded listener’s head. Together the musicians create a music that penetrates the listener. The different tune characters change, of course, but are all inflicted with complex rhythms and meditative levels. All the band members are greatly skilled musicians, capable of conveying musical statements. Rich, intense, rhythmic and with humor. Music that stands alone. We want to hear more from CORPO!” – Lars-Erik Forsgren

Milestones

1 - Support the tours: Between 0€ and 7260€

The money collected will support the tour of each artist, to cover the promotion, transport fees, the accommodations, the salary of the musicians and the staff, the compensations the days off between concerts, assure a fund to support the local venues to organize a concert. 

The money collected in the 1st milestone will allocated in equal shares to support each band individually.

2 - An Evening With: 13000€

This amount to be collected to produce and promote an exceptional evening to experience these 3 exciting concerts in a well-known club in Europe. 

If the amount collected is under 13000 euros, the money is allocated to the 1st milestone. 

3 - An Audiovisual Production: 20000€

This amount to be collected to record the 3 concerts for an digital audio and video releases in 2018. 

To be sure to let you experience the intimate atmosphere of a jazz venue, the footage will be professionally captured by 6 ultraHD 4k camcorders, the videos of these 3 concerts will be distributed through BYP.tv and available on AppleTV, iOS, Android, Chromecast and Roku.  Means these concerts will be available on any platform, from your Desktop, iPhone, iPad, Android device, a smartTV, a media player or a game console.

The audio will be released in digital in web stores worldwide via our partner Finetunes/The Orchard (Sony Music).

If the amount collected is between 13000€ and 20000€, the money is allocated to enhance the previous milestones to produce concerts.

Badass Yogi Productions Believes In Better Music Business

We believe that music business can have a positive social impact, so 25% of all money collected over 20000€ will go to the King Baudouin Foundation.

Development Timeline for BYP.tv

Rewards & Perks for Your Support

We'd love to invite you to become a Founder Member of BYP.tv and play an important role in our mission to support independent Jazz artists, productions and develop new talents.

As a member of BYP you get streaming access to all the exclusive content and all future releases of BYP.  Get unreleased audio material from our artists and bands.  Get discount code for concert and products.  Get entries to giveaways.

Meet Badass Yogi Productions

Laurent Cordier

President and CEO

10 years experience in producing and managing bands.  He founded Badass Yogi Productions in 2008.  Laurent has a solid experience with a global leaders in entertainment and digital multi-platform content.     

Instruments: Drums, Guitar

Rudi Jeanperrin

 

Director Board
Founder of Badass Yogi Productions, business manager and responsible for overseeing the organization’s activities.  Instrument: Electric Bass

Christophe Agnessen

 

Director Board

Christophe assures the technical coordination of artistic projects and productions.  Instruments: Clarinet, Electric Bass, Double Bass

Rémi Corsin

 

Music Video Director

The man behind our audiovisual "jazz-rock threat" production "The Great Cosmic Journey" which received a warm welcome from Jazz critics in Europe.  Instrument: Didgeridoo

Jérémy Wahl

 

Graphic Designer

Graphic arts teacher, Jérémy designs the cover art works and promotional material for bands.  Instrument: Colouring Pencils

  

Our Risks And Challenges

BYP has been promoting and producing jazz music for nearly 10 years now and the booking model really hasn’t changed. Promoters of concerts (who may be the owners of clubs, labels and agencies or artists themselves) keep taking risk after risk, hoping for the best while artists roll the dice on the secondary and tertiary markets they are playing. With the reach that social media has and the popularity of crowdfunding we don’t need to take that risk and send artists out on the road wondering how shows will be.

Other than contributing, how can I help?

Whether or not you’re in a position to make a financial pledge at the moment, we’d still really value your help in getting the message out about these bands, and this crowdfunding campaign.  You can do this by sharing this page via social media, or mentioning Badass Yogi Productions to friends who you know are interested in Jazz and music.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. We all really appreciate it.

FAQ

 

About the Tour

Will bands be impacted by the success of the campaign?
Yes, to succeed the first milestone will let us organize more concerts for you, first between November 24th and December 15th then later in 2018.  From these concerts, opportunities in festivals could be proposed by promoters what's really crucial to develop their activities and propose new projects in the future.

I'm a promoter and I would like to welcome Mark, Mikael or Lorenzo in my club.
Feel free to contact us at info@byp-online.com, we will find a way to make it happen.

About BYP.tv and the Perks

How much will it cost?
The subscription to BYP.tv is projected to cost €5.99-a-month from January 2018.

Will you carry advertising on BYP.tv?
No. We think that if you are paying for a subscription, you shouldn’t get ads.

Will BYP.tv be available globally?
Yes, the channel will be available to access from anywhere in the world.

Will BYP.tv be impacted by the success of the campaign?
No, we take advantage of this campaign to propose a membership including an unlimited access to the content of BYP.tv.   If we reach the third milestone, three new productions will enrich the exclusive catalogue of the channel in 2018.

 

About the Campaign

I have questions, how can I reach your team?
For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, feel free to email us at info@byp-online.com.

Can I get a refund if I change my mind?

Yes of course. You can get a refund at any time during the campaign. You can initiate the refund directly from your confirmation email or Indiegogo account. We are unable to issue refunds after the campaign has ended.

story:
I am an artist and musician.  Often my process as an artist is interdisciplinary in nature, as many of my visual and audio works are interrelated.  This is my 4th full length recording.  It’s been a labor of love to write and record these songs over the past few years.  This is my most accessible album to date, and I made this recording with the intention of creating an experience to be enjoyed on vinyl.  

I am hoping to raise enough money to press 25 copies of this album onto 12” vinyl records.  The album is 36 minutes in length, with 18 minutes per side at 33 1/3 rpm.  Each contributor pays $45.00 to receive a vinyl record and small limited edition screen printed piece of art.  Since this is a special edition limited pressing, the cost per record is a bit higher than a standard vinyl LP.  The $45 donation pays for the pressing of the vinyl, packaging, and shipping.

story:
Update1: 

Here we have our first charity cause. "Breast Cancer Research Foundation" ecourages you to "Be the end of Cancer!". The mission of the foundation is to prevent and cure breast cancer by advancing the world's most promising research. Get involved with the cause and start saving lives!

Check the association website on www.bcrfcure.org



For the first time in history.

The internet takes over the world.

Just imagine:

Any country. Any artist. Any landscape. Any duration.

One single price: 20$ per day.

All the profit goes for charity!

Bring your own booze and food! 

Sounds interesting? 


The world of internet comes along together to create something that is going to be legendary forever. A brand new festival, on the largest scale, "designed by the people, for the people".

Hardwell, Armin Van Buuren, Martin Garrix, Tiesto, Avicii, David Guetta, Skrillex, Steve Aoki, Calvin Harris, Afrojack, Major Lazer, Wu Tang Clan, Zedd, Kaskade, Swedish House Mafia, Daft Punk, Fedde Le Grand, Carl Cox, Dash Berlin and more others, SKY IS THE LIMIT!

Our vision:

You are fed up with festivals organised by associations, companies, city councils or other people that have their own interest only. It's time for a new vision. All the profit goes for charity!

And here it is: THE BIGGEST FESTIVAL IN THE WORLD, COMPLETELY BY THE IDEAS AND THE OPINIONS OF THE CONTRIBUTORS !

100% donations, 100% internet, 100% you !

Our idea is to organise a festival that implies the smallest sum of money that can be possible used for a festival, but on the largest scale. Couldn't it be low-cost and good enough? We strongly believe it is possible! And yes, it is!

You'll be able to bring your own food and booze, you won't be restricted in any way!


All money goes for charity!

It is a "flexible-funding" campaign, so you will question what will happen with all the money if the target sum is not reached. 

Well, all the money will be donated to charity organisations. We are still searching because we want to help as many as we can, so any suggestion is welcomed. 

Perhaps you are involved in this kind of activity and you need some help. The same thing will happen to any sum of money that will exceed our target. 

Any income cent will be sent towards charity purposes, after the closing of the festival. Feel free to contact us and share your knowledge at: charity@megafestival.org

Join in!

  • Do you want to feel the sand at the bottom of your feet? No problem!
  • Do you want Armin Van Buuren or maybe Afrojack? No problem!
  • Do you want to see Versailles from France or maybe Netherlands does fascinate you since your childhood? No problem!
You're on a large plateau, in the yard of a bavarian castle, on the top of a mountain. There you can see the Alpes through the horizon, also the air and the sun are caressing your face. The music is wonderful.
 
In front of your eyes, you see the sunrise. The water splashes your knees. The sky is clear and blue. The sand is tickling your feet. Your lover is next to you. The music is marvelous.
 Far away, you'll see plenty of cars and impatient people. You just don't care. The lasers are giving their reflection over the nearby buildings, thousand of colorful lights make you jump simultaneously with the speakers. The music is astonishing.



What We Need

The expenses included in the budget are the following:

-volunteers fees (including accomodation, transport and so on)

- licences, organising fees.

- equipment and anything related to the technical part of organising (scene, decorations, proper camping areas, toilets, showers, and so on).

- fees that go to the artists (including accomodation, transport and other miscellaneous fees that may occur)


HOW DOES THE OPINION OF EACH CONTRIBUTOR MATTER:

First of all, there will be 4 main types of contributors, each one having a different level of access and costumization of the festival:

Basically, according to the amount of the funds given, you can be involved more or less in the costumization of the event and your preferences truly matter!

  1. Basic - For 10€ : Favourite landscape. You can choose between the beach, the mountain or the city landscape.
  2. Moderate - For 20€ : The duration of the festival: 3 days, 4 days or a week. +Vote for Landscape
  3. High - For 50€ : Favourite country. You can choose between the 10 countries that are involved in the project, as it follows: U.S.A., England, Germany, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, France, Switzerland, Canada or Romania (yes, you heard it well, Romania!) +Vote for Landscape and Duration
  4. Extra - For 100€ : A chart of the favourite artists. Each contributor will send an e-mail to the organisers who will line up weekly a chart of the favourite artists chosen. Any name sent will be taken into consideration. +Vote for Landscape, Duration and Country

The contributors are provided with free tickets and a drop-off during the festival, available for the foodstuff, as it follows:

  • Basic - 10%  off + 50% for 1 day ticket
  • Moderate - 20% off + 1 day ticket
  • High - 25% off + 2 day tickets
  • Extra - 50% off + 3 day tickets

Warning! Beer is not counted as foodstuff!

Other Way You Can Help - Volunteering!

We need volunteers!
 We are searching for volunteers in the following domains: 
  •  HR
  •  Marketing 
  • Security 
  • Backstage 
  • Engineering 
  • PR and social media 
  • Website maintenance  
 Every volunteer is provided by us with accomodation, food and free entry to the festival!
For signing up, sens us an email in which you must mention your favourite domain of work, also a CV attached to the following adress: help@megafestival.org

For more details, check our website: 

MegaFestival.org



FAQs and Press/Media

Who are you? 

 My name is Paul Bucur, I am 23 years old, I study international business at one of the best universities in Romania, in the heart of Transilvania, Cluj. In my free time I dance and teach dancing, after 10 years of gaining experience in this domain.

 What do you really want to acomplish by this campaign?

 The main goal is to show everyone that is possible. Ordinary people can organise such an event, without any help from other companies, agents or politicians that may lead the project and gain some benefits. I want a festival completely organised by people, for the people. I want anyone to afford to come to this kind of large-scale festival. I also want to show everyone that any income can go back to people, to charity organisations that really need help.
 
How did you come out with this idea? 

 Recently in Cluj were organised two big festivals. Both of them huge. Biggest names in the domain, a big amount of people, but very high prices, even if they were organised with the support of the community or local leadership. Public money has been used and it was nothing different than a private festival. Sponsors that imposed certain brands, many restrictions and all income redirected to certain "aknowledged people". 

 What is so different about this festival?

 Firstly, all income will be sent to charity organisations. Then, our main sponsors are the contributors themselves and in this way we won't be put in any situation to give any right to set the price of their products during the festival. In this way, when you're on a budget, this could be much smaller than any festival you've been at. Also, the basic price will be 20€/day for everyone. Another inovative thing is the voting sistem for the costumization of the festival. Our contributors speak their minds and choose the landscape, the duration, the country and the artists.
 Also, you'll be able to bring your own food and booze, not being restricted in any way! Be aware though: We'll still be having shops from where you can buy anything you like.
 
Have you ever been involved in the organisation of a festival? 

I never took part in the organisation of such a big festival, I was just volunteering before. I organised many other small events. 

 Did you get in touch with any charity organisations that you would like to support? 

Yes. I hope that I will help them and I'm expecting the same thing from the other.

What will happen if you don't achieve the target sum of money?

 This makes the most important question, because, as you can tell, it's a "flexible-funding" campaign, and this means that even if we don't get enough money, everything gained so far will not be returned. Well, I would like to assure you that absolutely no cent will be send to any other place, but to charity purposes. This is the only way, and if the people contributed with some money, it is my duty to give them back to people, but this time, to people that really need the money. 

 What's your part in this?

 I came up with this idea, from scratch, thinking about all the people that would like to go to a large-scale festival, but can't afford it. Then, I decided that all the income should be given further, because I wanted to help more. Personally, besides the time and energy that I put in this project, I already spent some money for website purposes, and I will also donate some. However, I hope that I will get a free ticket and not be left behind by the volunteers. 

 How many volunteers do you need?

 Hmm.. as many as possible! The whole festival is based on the people's power, volunteer's power. Any thing that you could think of, concerning organising, requires a volunteer or more. So, we are desperately searching for volunteers that want to give us a hand and take part in something that will be a global inovation and I hope that this event will take part again, even if it's organised by me, even if other people will take my example and do the same thing where is needed. 

How can people that can't donate due to certain reasons help?

Any idea that could help us, or a person that has some kind of experience and would like to help is warmly welcomed to our website and asked to send us an email. We also provide accomodation, food and free entries for every volunteer. We need help in all fields, from the building process, to web-designing or security. Any help is welcomed!
For more details, check our website: 

MegaFestival.org
story_txt:
Update1: 
Here we have our first charity cause. "Breast Cancer Research Foundation" ecourages you to "Be the end of Cancer!". The mission of the foundation is to prevent and cure breast cancer by advancing the world's most promising research. Get involved with the cause and start saving lives!
Check the association website on www.bcrfcure.org


For the first time in history.
The internet takes over the world.
Just imagine:
Any country. Any artist. Any landscape. Any duration.
One single price: 20$ per day.
All the profit goes for charity!
Bring your own booze and food! 
Sounds interesting? 

The world of internet comes along together to create something that is going to be legendary forever. A brand new festival, on the largest scale, "designed by the people, for the people".
Hardwell, Armin Van Buuren, Martin Garrix, Tiesto, Avicii, David Guetta, Skrillex, Steve Aoki, Calvin Harris, Afrojack, Major Lazer, Wu Tang Clan, Zedd, Kaskade, Swedish House Mafia, Daft Punk, Fedde Le Grand, Carl Cox, Dash Berlin and more others, SKY IS THE LIMIT!
Our vision:
You are fed up with festivals organised by associations, companies, city councils or other people that have their own interest only. It's time for a new vision. All the profit goes for charity!
And here it is: THE BIGGEST FESTIVAL IN THE WORLD, COMPLETELY BY THE IDEAS AND THE OPINIONS OF THE CONTRIBUTORS !
100% donations, 100% internet, 100% you !
Our idea is to organise a festival that implies the smallest sum of money that can be possible used for a festival, but on the largest scale. Couldn't it be low-cost and good enough? We strongly believe it is possible! And yes, it is!You'll be able to bring your own food and booze, you won't be restricted in any way!  
All money goes for charity!
It is a "flexible-funding" campaign, so you will question what will happen with all the money if the target sum is not reached. 
Well, all the money will be donated to charity organisations. We are still searching because we want to help as many as we can, so any suggestion is welcomed. 
Perhaps you are involved in this kind of activity and you need some help.

The same thing will happen to any sum of money that will exceed our target. 
Any income cent will be sent towards charity purposes, after the closing of the festival. Feel free to contact us and share your knowledge at: charity@megafestival.org

Join in!

Do you want to feel the sand at the bottom of your feet? No problem!
Do you want Armin Van Buuren or maybe Afrojack? No problem!
Do you want to see Versailles from France or maybe Netherlands does fascinate you since your childhood? No problem!

You're on a large plateau, in the yard of a bavarian castle, on the top of a mountain. There you can see the Alpes through the horizon, also the air and the sun are caressing your face. The music is wonderful.
 In front of your eyes, you see the sunrise. The water splashes your knees. The sky is clear and blue. The sand is tickling your feet. Your lover is next to you. The music is marvelous.
 Far away, you'll see plenty of cars and impatient people. You just don't care. The lasers are giving their reflection over the nearby buildings, thousand of colorful lights make you jump simultaneously with the speakers. The music is astonishing.



What We Need
The expenses included in the budget are the following:
-volunteers fees (including accomodation, transport and so on)
- licences, organising fees.
- equipment and anything related to the technical part of organising (scene, decorations, proper camping areas, toilets, showers, and so on).
- fees that go to the artists (including accomodation, transport and other miscellaneous fees that may occur)
   
HOW DOES THE OPINION OF EACH CONTRIBUTOR MATTER:
First of all, there will be 4 main types of contributors, each one having a different level of access and costumization of the festival:
Basically, according to the amount of the funds given, you can be involved more or less in the costumization of the event and your preferences truly matter!


Basic - For 10€ : Favourite landscape. You can choose between the beach, the mountain or the city landscape.

Moderate - For 20€ : The duration of the festival: 3 days, 4 days or a week. +Vote for Landscape


High - For 50€ : Favourite country. You can choose between the 10 countries that are involved in the project, as it follows: U.S.A., England, Germany, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, France, Switzerland, Canada or Romania (yes, you heard it well, Romania!) +Vote for Landscape and Duration


Extra - For 100€ : A chart of the favourite artists. Each contributor will send an e-mail to the organisers who will line up weekly a chart of the favourite artists chosen. Any name sent will be taken into consideration. +Vote for Landscape, Duration and Country

   
The contributors are provided with free tickets and a drop-off during the festival, available for the foodstuff, as it follows:



Basic - 10%  off + 50% for 1 day ticket


Moderate - 20% off + 1 day ticket


High - 25% off + 2 day tickets


Extra - 50% off + 3 day tickets


Warning! Beer is not counted as foodstuff!   Other Way You Can Help - Volunteering!
We need volunteers!
 We are searching for volunteers in the following domains: 


 HR


 Marketing 


Security 


Backstage 


Engineering 


PR and social media 


Website maintenance  


 Every volunteer is provided by us with accomodation, food and free entry to the festival!
For signing up, sens us an email in which you must mention your favourite domain of work, also a CV attached to the following adress: help@megafestival.org


For more details, check our website: MegaFestival.org





FAQs and Press/Media


Who are you? 

 My name is Paul Bucur, I am 23 years old, I study international business at one of the best universities in Romania, in the heart of Transilvania, Cluj. In my free time I dance and teach dancing, after 10 years of gaining experience in this domain.

 What do you really want to acomplish by this campaign?

 The main goal is to show everyone that is possible. Ordinary people can organise such an event, without any help from other companies, agents or politicians that may lead the project and gain some benefits. I want a festival completely organised by people, for the people. I want anyone to afford to come to this kind of large-scale festival. I also want to show everyone that any income can go back to people, to charity organisations that really need help.
 
How did you come out with this idea? 

 Recently in Cluj were organised two big festivals. Both of them huge. Biggest names in the domain, a big amount of people, but very high prices, even if they were organised with the support of the community or local leadership. Public money has been used and it was nothing different than a private festival. Sponsors that imposed certain brands, many restrictions and all income redirected to certain "aknowledged people". 

 What is so different about this festival?

 Firstly, all income will be sent to charity organisations. Then, our main sponsors are the contributors themselves and in this way we won't be put in any situation to give any right to set the price of their products during the festival. In this way, when you're on a budget, this could be much smaller than any festival you've been at. Also, the basic price will be 20€/day for everyone.

Another inovative thing is the voting sistem for the costumization of the festival. Our contributors speak their minds and choose the landscape, the duration, the country and the artists.
 Also, you'll be able to bring your own food and booze, not being restricted in any way! Be aware though: We'll still be having shops from where you can buy anything you like.
 
Have you ever been involved in the organisation of a festival? 

I never took part in the organisation of such a big festival, I was just volunteering before. I organised many other small events. 


 Did you get in touch with any charity organisations that you would like to support? 

Yes. I hope that I will help them and I'm expecting the same thing from the other.


What will happen if you don't achieve the target sum of money?

 This makes the most important question, because, as you can tell, it's a "flexible-funding" campaign, and this means that even if we don't get enough money, everything gained so far will not be returned. Well, I would like to assure you that absolutely no cent will be send to any other place, but to charity purposes. This is the only way, and if the people contributed with some money, it is my duty to give them back to people, but this time, to people that really need the money. 

 What's your part in this?

 I came up with this idea, from scratch, thinking about all the people that would like to go to a large-scale festival, but can't afford it. Then, I decided that all the income should be given further, because I wanted to help more.
Personally, besides the time and energy that I put in this project, I already spent some money for website purposes, and I will also donate some. However, I hope that I will get a free ticket and not be left behind by the volunteers. 

 How many volunteers do you need?

 Hmm.. as many as possible! The whole festival is based on the people's power, volunteer's power. Any thing that you could think of, concerning organising, requires a volunteer or more. 
So, we are desperately searching for volunteers that want to give us a hand and take part in something that will be a global inovation and I hope that this event will take part again, even if it's organised by me, even if other people will take my example and do the same thing where is needed. 

How can people that can't donate due to certain reasons help?

Any idea that could help us, or a person that has some kind of experience and would like to help is warmly welcomed to our website and asked to send us an email.
We also provide accomodation, food and free entries for every volunteer. We need help in all fields, from the building process, to web-designing or security.
Any help is welcomed!

For more details, check our website: MegaFestival.org

story:
Short Summary

I am asking for financial support for the beginning of a unique touring concert beginning in 2020. STATE OF BEING is a touring concert experience for Ultrasoprano and Electronics, a COMBINATION NEVER HEARD BEFORE, featuring commissions by composers from the United States, UK, Germany, and Norway. This music deals with themes of looking within, illusion, distortion, the inner-most self, and the challenge of questioning what is real vs. what is imaginary. The music follows the journey of one woman questioning and exploring her own reality, both within herself and through the stories of others. As a result, the audience is brought into a unique sound world and new reality, where they must also begin to question their own perspectives about life both in terms of what they see on the outside, and who they are internally.

Those helping support this campaign allow me to get the proper equipment for the electronics, to pay the composers an introductory amount as a giant THANK YOU, and to help this incredible project get its feet off the ground!

Who I am:

International "ultra-soprano" (ultra-soprano" (Second Inversion, WA, USA) and "new music rising star" (The Stranger, WA, USA), I aim to continuously pave the path of new and engaging music as a vocalist and performer. STATE OF BEING is not your traditional concert. Its subject and aesthetics are unique, daring and emotionally raw. The included works represent  every composer involved, all of whom I am so incredibly stunned by, and wish to share their work with the world.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am seeking funding for all electronics equipment (estimated at $1500) and the first payment to each of the composers for writing commissions for me. (I am asking for $1500 as well to be divided amongst the composers as a starter.)
  • If additional funds are raised they will go towards the production of new performances and/or performance related costs (travel to venue, etc.).
  • Breakdown in detail:
    • EQUIPMENT:
      • Audio interface: ~€399
      • Headset Microphone + receiver: ~€1200
      • Midi connector: €60
      • Pedal: €22
      • Click track ear piece: €129
      • Estimated total: €1700
    • Desired total: €1700 for equipment and €1700 for composers.
    • The remaining €1600: production of new performances, travel costs, recording costs, AND OTHER performance related costs. If enough money is raised this could help make the next performances possible!
    • TOTAL: €5000

 

The Impact

  • What makes STATE OF BEING special is that it combines the extraordinary voice of an Ultrasoprano with the intriguing world of electronic music – a combination never done in concert before in the world.
  • The program and the performance dive into the world of the human mind, conscious and unconscious.
  • It is planned that in the future STATE OF BEING could be staged.
  • STATE OF BEING  features only works by incredibly talented and prominent living composers from around the globe, and helps their magnificent work to prosper.
  • For me personally, STATE OF BEING is the largest solo touring project thus far.
  • My goal is for there to be versions of the concert that have an educational element. I would like to hold masterclasses for young composers and singers when this is performed at Universities. 

Risks & Challenges

This is not your typical opera concert. STATE OF BEING exceeds all expectations that come with this notion both aesthetically and conceptually. The challenges thus consist of:

  • Reaching a brand new audience and
  • possibly reaching the traditional opera audience.

This is the plan to master these challenges:

  • make an entirely unique experience that fills in a niche
  • possibly include transformed snippets of well-known classical repertoire

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution, no matter how small, is helpful! If you can't...

  • Please consider sharing! Indiegogo has share tools built in.
  • If you are or know someone looking for side work that has experience in booking and/or grant applications, 
  • If you have an idea about a school, festival, or venue that would be great to bring STATE OF BEING to, please reach out! I always want to hear!

story:
WELCOME TO KORGY 

 

Who we are.

We are an up and coming electronic music duo hailing from two different countries trying our hardest to inject electronic music with heavy soundscapes and eerie atmospheres. We take the music we write and produce very seriously and have been in the shadows of the music industry for a while now. It's time to step out into the light and cast our shadow.

 

Compensation.

What you need to know:

We're asking for a $10,000 stretch goal so we can send our final mixes to a professional who can master these tracks and help produce something we can all be proud of. We also plan on releasing a full 12 track album with merchandise. 

Our "Digital Night Fighters EP" comes with 5 fully completed songs and 4 digital backgrounds you can use as wallpapers. We plan to update the project with more perks as time progresses. That includes merchandise and physical copies of our EP/Album.

While we appreciate everyone who decides to back us we want to make it very clear that all proceeds will go to making an amazing album and if we don't reach our goal we will still deliver on everything promised.

Welcome to the family.

Music is culture:

We feel that music has been sterilized and overall stolen from us by soulless corporations using synergy as their main writing tactic to ensure the status quo never changes. By supporting us you'll be breathing new life into the industry and pave the way for other independent musicians like us to have better success on the world stage and in the community at large.

Together we both have 15 years experience writing and recording and have dedicated ourselves to not only learn the difficulties of mixing and mastering but the challenges of marketing yourself to the broader public. We don't plan to stop anytime soon but we could use a little bit of help.

At the end of the day we're just two dudes living day to day and trying to make it all work out. All the sadness and anger washes away when you write a cool sounding riff or a nice catchy hook. This is all we do because this is all we know how to do. If you decide to take this journey with us know that we will forever be in your debt. Because you took the time to listen and care. We thank you for that.

Not everything is easy.

Life is always throwing curve balls and we'd be lying to you if we said there wouldn't be a risk in supporting us. That being said we take the utmost safety in our risk assessments and would never offer a perk we couldn't deliver on. If for any reason at all you don't receive physical/digital compensation for what you've paid for reach out to us immediately and we'll make you our first priority. Like everything else we want to be on the up and up and do things right.

Digital copies of the EP/LP will be sent immediately to you.
Physical merchandise is coming soon and we'll update that when we actually have it in our hands.

The extra mile

No money? No problem.

Simply spreading the word out is more than enough for us. We'll even give you a shout out on social media and follow you!

Also, don't forget to use the tools built into the indiegogo platform.

- TEAM KORGY

story:
Hello again!

Yes I'm doing the crowdfund thing again.. this time with vinyl!

I'm Lee Rosevere - I make ambient and electronic music. I've scored a documentary and you might have heard some of my music in podcasts (Radiolab, Invisibilia, Death Sex Money, 99% Invisible, etc) or enjoyed one of my many albums for free on Bandcamp.

So, vinyl eh?

I know, I know.. vinyl is super expensive these days. But I'm very pleased with this new album of chillhop/lofi music called Doodles, and feel it would really work in the vinyl medium. I was listening to alot of chilled cow/chillhop youtube streams and wanted to have a go making some.

I released an advance EP of five tracks last month, and there are 7 more new tracks/remixes on the album. None of them have appeared on vinyl before (mostly because I haven't done a proper vinyl release before but hey, it sounds fancy).

To have the album professionally pressed on vinyl takes about 8-10 weeks, give or take. I'm looking to have a limited edition of 200 copies pressed, which will make it cheaper, because economics. If I had only 100 copies pressed, it would cost double. So we're not doing that. 200 copies. Yup.

I'm using my local PEI record pressers Kaneshii, which do excellent work. And don't worry about that shortage you read about of lacquers - Canada has our own secret supply.

Also a portion of the funding will be donated to the artist Prawny who created all the artwork.

What you give is what you get

VINYL:
12" blue coloured vinyl of the album in a nice colourful jacket sleeve, with postcards and stickers.

CD-R:
The emphasis is really on vinyl for this project, but you can also get a CD-R with full colour artwork, professionally pressed in a jewel case. Yes, this is a CDR (not a silver pressed CD) made by Kunaki and that's why the price is so low. Also includes postcards and stickers*

VINYL + T-SHIRT COMBO:

You get the 12" blue colour vinyl, a special custom t-shirt in the colour and size of your choice, postcards, the stickers, and I'll throw in a CD-R for free!

Both VINYL and CD-R pledges come with:

- 2 postcards and 2 stickers
- digital download of the album
- my undying devotion

If the campaign is successful, the CDRs are shipped shortly after it closed but unfortunately, vinyl lovers will have to wait a minimum of 8-10 weeks after the end of the campaign before it goes into manufacturing and an additional week or so after it's mailed out. But good things come to those who wait! If there are any delays with the vinyl, I'll update you as I find out stuff.

You can also just pledge the digital download if you wish, but all vinyl pledges come with a complimentary digital download in the format of your choice.

THE BAD SHIPPING NEWS

** PLEASE NOTE **

What's more expensive than pressing vinyl? Shipping it!

It's ridiculous, I won't lie. So there will be an additional shipping cost on top of your vinyl pledge.  I know, I'm sorry. But I went to the post office with a record and the prices are actual shipping.

*For CDRs, Kunaki will ship anywhere in the world for a low price, so if you pledge for a CDR, it's $8 for everything: the CDR, shipping anywhere in the world and postcards and stickers - however since they are shipping the discs and not me, I will mail you the postcards and stickers separately.

..But what if I want more than one record? I ain't paying that much shipping! 

If you want to pledge for more than one copy of the vinyl (thank you!!), pledge once first and then send me a message using the "ASK A QUESTION" form at the top of this page and I will send you a secret link that will let you pledge for as many records as you want with a MUCH MUCH reduced shipping rate per record.

 

RISKY RISK and the RISKYTONES

This project is an all or nothing deal. So if the goal is not reached, nothing is pressed and you are not charged anything. So no risk.

Thanks for your interest and stay chill.

Yes, this is a CDR (not a silver pressed CD) made by Kunaki and that's why the price is so low. Also includes postcards and stickers*VINYL + T-SHIRT COMBO:You get the 12" blue colour vinyl, a special custom t-shirt in the colour and size of your choice, postcards, the stickers, and I'll throw in a CD-R for free!Both VINYL and CD-R pledges come with:- 2 postcards and 2 stickers- digital download of the album- my undying devotionIf the campaign is successful, the CDRs are shipped shortly after it closed but unfortunately, vinyl lovers will have to wait a minimum of 8-10 weeks after the end of the campaign before it goes into manufacturing and an additional week or so after it's mailed out. But good things come to those who wait! If there are any delays with the vinyl, I'll update you as I find out stuff.You can also just pledge the digital download if you wish, but all vinyl pledges come with a complimentary digital download in the format of your choice.THE BAD SHIPPING NEWS** PLEASE NOTE **What's more expensive than pressing vinyl? Shipping it!It's ridiculous, I won't lie. So there will be an additional shipping cost on top of your vinyl pledge.  I know, I'm sorry. But I went to the post office with a record and the prices are actual shipping.*For CDRs, Kunaki will ship anywhere in the world for a low price, so if you pledge for a CDR, it's $8 for everything: the CDR, shipping anywhere in the world and postcards and stickers - however since they are shipping the discs and not me, I will mail you the postcards and stickers separately...But what if I want more than one record? I ain't paying that much shipping! If you want to pledge for more than one copy of the vinyl (thank you!!), pledge once first and then send me a message using the "ASK A QUESTION" form at the top of this page and I will send you a secret link that will let you pledge for as many records as you want with a MUCH MUCH reduced shipping rate per record. RISKY RISK and the RISKYTONESThis project is an all or nothing deal. So if the goal is not reached, nothing is pressed and you are not charged anything. So no risk.Thanks for your interest and stay chill.

story:
La Festa della Musica di Caposele 2018.

Per il 7° anno consecutivo torna a Caposele (AV) la Festa della Musica Europea, in contemporanea con migliaia di città in tutta Europa.
Noi abbiamo in più, dalla nostra, uno scenario paesaggistico invidiabile a tutti. Infatti dal primo anno, la manifestazione si svolge nel Parco Fluviale di Caposele, vicino alle Sorgenti del fiume Sele, rendendo l'atmosfera magica dal crepuscolo all'alba. Volete farvela raccontare o preferite viverla?

La location

Il parco fluviale del Sele, un’area protetta dedicata al fiume nella quale, grazie ad una serie di sentieri, pedonali e ciclabili, si possono fare rilassanti passeggiate ed escursioni naturalistiche alla scoperta della flora e della fauna fluviale. Lungo il percorso, che parte dalla località Tredogge, sono presenti panchine e slarghi per la sosta.
Camminando, si possono osservare le cascate e le piante che avvolgono il territorio circostante e diversi tipi di animali, la trota, piccoli anfibi, rettili e farfalle.
Si procede fino alla fonte di S.Lucia dove, finito il percorso, ci si potrà rinfrescare.

L'impatto

La Festa si inserisce in un circuito internazionale e permette a tutto il territorio della Valle del Sele di avere una grande promozione e risonanza a livello sovraregionale.

Per info:

http://www.festadellamusica.beniculturali.it/in...

story:
Strange Signals from Outer Space

We have received a funky signal from outer space from a lost ship called the USS Profit, first launched in 1972. The ship is manned by a crew of scientist/funk musicians. They call their band SPACE FUNK. They want to play a gig. They have pioneered technology that will allow them to broadcast hard-light holograms of themselves through space for a single performance on Earth. We want to help them hit the stage with style and we could use your assistance.

​

If you don't back this event, you are leaving some serious space swag on the table.

Here are the main rewards:

  • Space Funk's Studio Album: 0-G Throwdown
  • Space Funk's Radio Drama Styled album with dramatic sound effects and an original soundtrack, entitled: The Wrong Stuff
  • A video download of the live event (this is included at every level)
  • Gangrene Comedy Festival T-Shirt
  • Gangrene Comedy Festival ballcap
  • Single Tickets for the live event
  • Family passes (up to 6 immediate family only) for the event

The reward level breakdown works like this:

1. First choose a space rank, this will determine at what level you want to back the campaign and what perks you will get. 

  • RemoteTeam includes digital downloads, T-Shirts, and ball caps, NO SHOW TIX
  • AwayTeam includes CDs, T-Shirts, and ball, caps, NO SHOW TIX
  • GroundCrew includes a single show ticket, show perks, digital downloads, T-shirts, ball caps
  • Cadet includes a single show ticket, show perks, CDs, T-shirts, ball caps
  • Squad includes a family pass show ticket, show perks, CDs, T-shirts, ball caps
  • Officer includes everything plus VIP seating front and center with space steward service (including food and snacks during the show)

2. Determine what rewards you want.

  • FirstWave includes the album: 0-G Throwdown as a download
  • SecondWave includes both 0-G Throwdown and The Wrong Stuff as downloads.
  • FirstDossier includes only the album: 0-G Throwdown as a CD (USA free shipping
  • SecondDossier includes both 0-G Throwdown and The Wrong Stuff on CD (USA free shipping)
  • Insignia includes both albums + t-shirt
  • Decorated includes both albums + t-shirt + ball cap
  • CrewAccess includes both albums + t-shirt + ball cap + backstage access pass
  • DirectorAccess includes both albums + t-shirt + ball cap +backstage access pass + a ticket to the exclusive directors' dinner

Space Funk has a limited supply of entertainment on their ship, a cobbled together space cruiser called The Profit. Among their derelict movies, they have found a cult classic called Star Odyssey. Space Funk has scored a new, hot original soundtrack for the film, which they intend to play live in synch with the screening. They have also marked up the video with tons of audience participation pop-ups for a spectator all-inclusive experience. Along with some new original songs, the soundtrack will debut in studio form on their album, 0-G Throwdown.

Under the guidance and funding of futurist and inter-galactic visionary,  Jim Profit, the crew of the SS Profit was built from a group of scientists of different persuasions from all over the United States. Here are their ranks, crew responsibilities and biographical information.

 

What is behind the fantasy?

As an independent group of performers, we have hosted an event called the Gangrene Comedy Festival in Northern Utah that features live acts, short comedy films, and tons of other surprises. This year, we want to do it up big with an outer space theme. By backing this project, you can get the band's double album + a video of the 1-night only show.

What We Need & What You Get

To put together the absolute best double album and to throw the most hilarious live event, we will need backing for several items, including:

  • Studio time
  • Actors
  • Extra musicians
  • Mixing and mastering expertise
  • CD Replication
  • Props and stage effects
  • Marketing funds to publicize the event and album

Your contribution means the world to us. We have thrown many hilarious events and recorded tons of great music. We are happy to throw in some of our back log should you want to contribute. We want this album/live event to be the best yet. We can't do it without your help.

Here are some of the events from the past:

The Gangrene Comedy Festival Goes Esquivel:

The Gangrene Comedy Festival Goes Bigfoot

The Gangrene Comedy Festival Goes to Space

The Gangrene Comedy Festival Goes Steampunk

Here's the good news: If you are in Northern Utah on the night of the live performance, you can actually be there in the flesh to see the performance, live, in person. You can meet the band, become a face-to-face friend. Here are the live event details:

Their live cross-spacetime hard-light holographic performance will take place on:

Friday, Sept 14th
7:00PM (Mountain Time)
The Ed Kenley Amphitheater
403 North Wasatch Blvd.
Layton, UT 84037

Risks & Challenges

We have hosted several crowd sourcing projects. We ALWAYS come through on our end. The products outlined in this campaign have been created. They are in motion and are being produced. The level of funding from this project determines how much production value will go into the final product.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we would greatly appreciate you spreading the word. Let your facebook friends know about the Gangrene Comedy Festival by sending them to our Facebook Page.

Other than that, the best way to contribute is by creating your own awesome things and putting them out into the world. Should you make anything cool, please let us know about it. We are behind all creativity.

story:
Hey guys, Dave Rodgers here.

This is my challenge: a new Eurobeat album. 

I cannot scream, I cannot pick up the phone and talk to everyone of you, so I want to tell you how much my broken heart is in these days about the worldwide situation. Especially, the American situation.

My new album is a message of hope. And, my friends... I need your help to spread the message.

 

My new Eurobeat album for you

My fans have always given me the strength to fight. That's why this challenge is so important to me. 

It's time to do something. It's time to bring a message of hope. 

That's why I decide to take this challenge! Me and you, together.

I’m preparing a new hit for a very special day: the 4th of July.

Also, I'll make a new album “God Bless You Americans” with:

  • 7 unreleased tracks
  • + 7 tracks that have never been printed on cd format before.
 

Why the 4th of July?

That's a short time but... that's a very special day for my message.

My album is for everybody, but I called it “God bless You Americans” as Americans have been hardest hit by the last events.

 

This is your chance to be a part of my project

I ask you and all my worldwide fans to help me sharing my feeling, to help me shouting my message of hope.

I believe in what I do, I believe in Eurobeat music and I really believe this album can reach your hearts.

 

50 % for charity

One dollar out of two (half of the sale) will go in support of a health institute,  in support to research.
