story:
Overview

Hello,

I'm working on my first ever EP  - soft.  With an old school sound and transparent lyrics, let’s redefine what it means to be a black man.  Your support would mean the world.  

 

Greetings Beautiful Souls, 

My name is Shaq Hester.  I am a singer-songwriter based in Brooklyn New York, and I find freedom in singing music that is a tribute to the era of Stevie Wonder, Luther Vandross, and Donny Hathaway but carries my personal truths.  

 

The EP

Soft, the name of my upcoming EP has a powerful meaning to me.  

Black men are pressured to be the epitome of toughness -- no emotion, little affection, no vulnerability, walls all the way up. 

I felt this pressure my whole life, but when I finally broke that hard exterior, I had my breakthrough. 

Softness is not our weakness. It is our STRENGTH! Through the sounds of old school soul and neosoul, I want to bring this universal truth to the world.  

My goal is to create a 5 track EP packed with a reprise and Live Unplugged song.  Let’s redefine what it means to be soft with a couple of feel good vibes and bops! 

The songs are written. The collaborators are secured. I just need your support so that I may get this project out by August 2021. 

 

THE COST:

Studio recording fees add up quick.  To pay for studio time, musicians, mixing and mastering fees, printing, distribution costs and marketing fees, and photoshoot costs -- I need your contributions.  
 

Here’s the math:  

Studio Related fees:  $4,250

 Music Video:  1800

Distribution costs:  $50

Professional photoshoot:  $400

Artwork:  $150 

Website: $480 

Total:  $7,130

 

What will YOU get? 

In return for your backing I have prepared some wonderful prizes  for you, including:

- Early digital download release just for you

- Signed Poster

- Exclusive Watch Party of Music Video on Zoom! 

- Exclusive Listening Party on Zoom! 

 - Free Access to my next (2) Virtual Live Concerts

 - Personalized Song for You  

- Performing for your special event in 2022

 

ABOUT ME:  

I am pretty sure I have been singing since birth. My mother taught me my first song by the Clark Sisters and it was a done deal after that.  At a young age, I would go from listening to a Jill Scottt song to a MAZE song  to a Stevie Wonder song and I loved them all.  Listening to these greats informed my musicianship and I am forever grateful for it. 

When both of my parents passed when I was 9, I crusaded into my passions more deeply as a way to overcome.  In short, music saved me,  sustained me and strengthened my relationship with God as I was growing up. I would sing my prayers to my mom because I believed in music’s transcending power.  

I eventually obtained a Bachelor of Music in Vocal Performance at the University of South Carolina and a Master of Music in Vocal Performance at Indiana University Jacobs School of Music. 

In 2018, I moved to New York and have been afforded the honor to sing with Bronx Opera, Trilogy Opera, and Off Broadway’s Antigone in Ferguson.  I have sung on the Apollo Mainstage and Soundstage.  I was a featured soloist in the Pyer Moss Fashion Show.  I also sang as part of a TEDXBroadway Presentation.  

My sound is deeply influenced by Baptist Churchiness, Soulquarian Neosoul, and the Oldies, though, I love all types of music -- classical, soft rock, funk! 

When I sing, people CONNECT with me.  Whether it’s a feeling of mutual nostalgia or a sense of humor, I take the audience on a vulnerable journey with me where I get to be myself and they get to be themselves too,

My EP is an extension of that.  Your support would allow that connection to have no limits. The return you will get for blessing me will astound you!  However,  even if you can't donate  to this, PLEASE SHARE THIS LINK! Thank you SOOOO much! 

 

Watch the Soft Jam HERE - it's a live premiere of original music that will be on the project. 

 

MORE FROM SHAQ HESTER

facebook.com/shaqhester

instagram.com/shaqhester

youtube.com/shaqhester

soundcloud.com/shaqhester

story:
Fund a beautiful late night jazz album from Paris, France.

    Immersed in the melancholy and contemplation of the Parisian spirit, this album will be like a gentle cup of tea in the moonlit hours past midnight. Nothing better captures the heart than the sound of melancholic notes on a piano alongside the sweet scuffling of an upright bassist. Add a dream-like locomotion of drums and cymbals like sailing on a chariot in the clouds and you have the ingredients for a major work of art. With a song list inspired by such greats as Chet Baker, Russ Freeman and Bill Evans, this album is sure to win over the hearts of many.

    Nothing destroys the heart of music more than fake instruments. This album will not only be played on real ones but the best of the best. A grand piano, vintage drums and cymbals and of course the maturity and wisdom of an upright bass. But the instruments don't make the music. People do. My name is Jonathan Crocco. It is my wish to bring to you an album of jazz of the highest quality and musicianship possible. Yet one that won't try to seduce your ego with virtuosity and fire. One that won't try to intellectualize harmony and rhythm beyond the peacefulness of the moon and a gentle breeze. Above all, one that won't disregard your need for love and companionship after the day has been put aside, as life carries you well past the hour of midnight.

    After several rehearsals with the group spanning the later part of 2019, one of the members had to sacrifice his convenient availability for financial reasons. This is all too often the drama that occurs behind the curtain of a musician's life. This project needs your help. I have already invested hundreds of dollars in this album from buying the appropriate vintage cymbals to finding and rehearsing the appropriate musicians. I've also just got done professionally recording the ambient time of almost 20 vintage cymbals in an effort to better anticipate the most appropriate sound-locomotion behind the music of this project. Albums of this quality demand such seeds of consideration. This group has already performed at a business function and received a very pleasant return from the audience.

    The studio, Bop City where the album was destined to be recorded awaits the green light. We were ready to officially record from my own finances this past February(2020). Everything has suddenly stopped. Depending on my budget I'd also like to hire a known Parisian trumpet player as special guest to intersperse references of the heart warming character of Chet Baker. I feel his subtle melancholic style will add the final touch to this beautifully simple, mature listening experience. I'm also very pleased to inform you that one of my long time friends from college now living in Seattle will be contributing one of his beautiful songs on piano to this album.

    The details: I am of the generation that believes that good music starts with the right casting of musicians. These are the best suited musicians I know of in Paris. They have faith in my experience and judgement.

Franck Morin/Piano

Corentin Decouture/Bass

Special guest: Pascal Lacuès/Trumpet

Special guest: Tom Van Duzer/Piano

    The studio is very important. The engineer is very important. There are several in Paris. The one I have chosen is very cozy, off the beaten path and absent of all sense of stardom and false character. Known for its engineer, it attracts almost exclusively the jazz artist. Additionally, it's one of the only studios that provides an in-house grand piano at the correct price.

    Studio: Bop City, 9 Rue de Stalingrad Le Pré-Saint Gervais France 93310

Max, the engineer and owner of Bop City, is a gentle European man concerned with mature and beautiful music. One full day of recording is all that is required. Most projects demanding this kind of quality span several days, some several months. In addition to this, because the musicians I selected are seasoned performers, mixing should take no more than a day. This is because good jazz musicians notoriously mix themselves as they play. However, any seasoned musician and engineer will tell you unforeseen problems always occur. One must always have a reserve of time for such cases. Funds for a second day of recording should be available.

    Mastering, as any seasoned engineer knows, is also very important. This allows for a professional quality sound across all platforms and entertainment systems. The higher quality mastering studios know how to give the overall experience a final shine, like the hot-wax cycle on a freshly cleaned car. This raises the album to a level coherent with the best of the best. That'll be the case for this album. The studio chosen "has provided music for Grammy winning artists, The BBC, KBAQ & KJZZ Radio, NAXOS Records, independent and signed artists, and various film scores."

Check it out for yourself. They represent quality and professionalism at a correct price.

www.thebluedoorstudios.com

    The album once completed will be distributed to all the popular platforms including Spotify, iTunes, Apple Music, Pandora, Amazon (allowing for on demand CD copies) Google Play, Tidal, iHeartRadio, Youtube, Deezer and 150+ other stores and streaming services. Knowing that you helped raise the needed finances to produce such a beautiful album in such a beautiful city is a reward in itself. This album will be a message from you to everyone for love, peace, beauty, simplicity, maturity, companionship and solidarity. The world will know because your contribution will also assure your name in the linear notes.

    The Impact

    This is not just another jazz album. If the fruit of this project is achieved it will be a work of humble, innocent beauty and companionship where the ego has been appropriately placed aside for the greater purpose, YOU. What better message to deliver the universe. This album will be a beacon in the dark to all that is priceless and closest to the whispers of the heart. Some members of this project have compared the sound achieved during rehearsals to some of the best sounding albums in jazz.

    I have never had the opportunity to pursue something of this nature. If you never try you'll never know. A few years ago a sound started to churn inside me. My work demands thousands upon thousands of hours listening and transcribing and performing music for my students. I have been doing this for almost two decades. After being immersed in so much music- dissecting it and explaining the workings of it to people for so long, I feel very confident in knowing what makes for a pleasant and worthy listening experience. Having said that, this album will surely appeal to lovers, parents, dreamers, lonely hearts, luxury brands and iconic cinematic moments. Though this album's true intention will undoubtedly appeal to the simplicity found in the coziness of any heart late into the night.

    The musicians have been chosen and enthusiastically desire to put this music into your history. The studios and engineers have been chosen for their reputable service of quality and professionalism. The music itself has been auditioned, chosen and arranged appropriately for the members of this album. The instruments themselves have been tested and chosen intentionally for the needs of this music. The distribution label has been chosen for its flawless service and relations with all the major streaming services in the world. And now you have been chosen for your own values of love and companionship. 

Please use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. 

Thank you. 

Musically yours, 

Jonathan Crocco 

 

(FRANÇAIS)

Financer un bel album de jazz de fin de soirée de Paris, France.

    Plongé dans la mélancolie et la contemplation de l'esprit parisien, cet album sera comme une douce tasse de thé au clair de lune après minuit. Rien ne saisit mieux le cœur que le son des notes mélancoliques sur un piano aux côtés de la douce bagarre d'un contrebassiste. Ajoutez une locomotive de tambours et de cymbales comme  un char dans les nuages et vous avez les ingrédients pour une œuvre d'art majeure. Avec une liste de chansons inspirées des grands noms comme Chet Baker, Russ Freeman et Bill Evans, cet album ne manquera pas de conquérir votre cœur.

    Rien ne détruit plus le cœur de la musique que de faux instruments. Cet album ne sera pas seulement joué sur de vrais instruments mais les meilleurs des meilleurs. Un piano à queue, des batteries et des cymbales vintages et bien sûr la maturité et la sagesse d'une contrebasse. Mais les instruments ne font pas la musique. Les gens font la musique. Je m'appelle Jonathan Crocco. C'est mon souhait de vous apporter un album de jazz de la plus haute qualité et musicalité possible. Pourtant, cet album n'essaiera pas de séduire votre ego avec virtuosité et feu. Il n'essaiera pas non plus d'intellectualiser l'harmonie et le rythme au-delà de la tranquillité de la lune et d'une douce brise. Surtout, cet album ne négligera pas votre besoin d'amour et de compagnie une fois la journée mise de côté au-delà de minuit.

     Après plusieurs répétitions avec le groupe pendant la dernière partie de 2019, l'un des membres a dû sacrifier sa disponibilité pour des raisons financières. C'est trop souvent le drame qui se déroule derrière le rideau de la vie d'un musicien. Ce projet a besoin de votre aide. J'ai déjà investi des centaines de dollars dans cet album, de l'achat des cymbales vintages appropriées à la recherche et à la répétition des musiciens adéquats. Je viens également d'enregistrer professionnellement le temps ambiant de près de 20 cymbales vintages dans le but de mieux anticiper la locomotion sonore la plus appropriée derrière la musique de ce projet. Les albums de cette qualité exigent de telles graines de considération. Ce groupe a déjà joué dans une fonction commerciale et a reçu un retour très agréable du public.

     Le studio Bop City où l'album était destiné à être enregistré attend le feu vert. Nous étions prêts à enregistrer officiellement avec mes propres finances en février (2020). Tout s'est soudainement arrêté. En fonction de mon budget, j'aimerais également engager un trompettiste parisien connu comme invité spécial pour entremêler les références du personnage réconfortant de Chet Baker. Je pense que son style mélancolique subtil ajoutera la touche finale à cette expérience d'écoute magnifiquement simple et mature. Je suis également très heureux de vous informer que l'un de mes amis de longue date de l'université vivant maintenant à Seattle contribuera à cet album d'une de ses belles chansons au piano.

  Les détails: je suis de la génération qui croit que la bonne musique commence par le bon casting des musiciens. Ce sont les musiciens les mieux adaptés que je connaisse à Paris. Ils ont foi en mon expérience et en mon jugement.

Franck Morin/Piano

Corentin Decouture/Bass

Special guest: Pascal Lacuès/Trumpet

Special guest: Tom Van Duzer/Piano

     Le studio est très important. L'ingénieur est très important. Il y en a plusieurs à Paris. Celui que j'ai choisi est très confortable, hors des sentiers battus et absent de tout sens de la célébrité et du faux caractère. Connu pour son ingénieur, il attire presque exclusivement l'artiste de jazz. De plus, c'est l'un des seuls studios à proposer un piano à queue maison au prix correct.

    Studio: Bop City, 9 Rue de Stalingrad Le Pré-Saint Gervais France 93310

    Max, l'ingénieur et propriétaire de Bop City, est un homme sympathique, soucieux de la musique mature et belle. Une journée complète d'enregistrement suffit. La plupart des projets exigeant ce type de qualité durent plusieurs jours, certains plusieurs mois. De plus, parce que les musiciens que j'ai sélectionnés sont des interprètes aguerris, le mixage ne devrait pas prendre plus d'une journée. C'est parce que les bons musiciens de jazz se "mixent" et s'adaptent  notamment  pendant qu'ils jouent. Cependant, tout musicien et ingénieur chevronné vous dira que des problèmes imprévus se produisent toujours. Il faut toujours avoir une réserve de temps pour de tels cas. Les fonds pour un deuxième jour d'enregistrement devraient être disponibles.

    Le "Mastering", comme tout ingénieur expérimenté  le sait, est également très important.  Cela permet un son de qualité professionnelle sur toutes les plates-formes et tous les systèmes de divertissement. Les studios de "mastering" de qualité supérieure savent comment donner à l'expérience globale un éclat final, comme l'étape de la cire chaude sur une voiture fraîchement nettoyée. Cela élève l'album à un niveau cohérent avec le meilleur des meilleurs. Ce sera le cas pour cet album. Le studio choisi "a fourni de la musique à des artistes primés aux Grammy Awards, à la BBC, à la radio KBAQ & KJZZ, à NAXOS Records, à des artistes indépendants et signés, et à diverses musiques de films."

Vérifiez par vous-même. Ils représentent la qualité et le professionnalisme à un prix correct.

www.thebluedoorstudios.com

     L'album une fois terminé sera distribué sur toutes les plateformes populaires, y compris Spotify, iTunes, Apple Music, Pandora, Amazon (permettant des copies de CD à la demande) Google Play, Tidal, iHeartRadio, Youtube, Deezer et plus de 150 autres magasins et services de streaming. Savoir que vous avez contribué à réunir les fonds nécessaires pour produire un si bel album dans une si belle ville est une récompense en soi. Cet album sera un message de votre part à tous pour l'amour, la paix, la beauté, la simplicité, la maturité, la camaraderie et la solidarité. Le monde le saura car votre contribution assurera également votre nom dans les notes linéaires.

     L'impact

    Ce n'est pas juste un autre album de jazz. Si le fruit de ce projet est atteint, ce sera une œuvre d'une beauté et d'une camaraderie humbles et innocentes où l'ego a été correctement mis de côté pour le plus grand dessein, VOUS. Quel meilleur message pour délivrer l'univers. Cet album sera un phare dans le noir pour tout ce qui n'a pas de prix et se rapproche le plus des chuchotements du cœur. Certains membres de ce projet ont comparé le son obtenu pendant les répétitions à certains des meilleurs albums de jazz...

    Je n'ai jamais eu l'occasion de poursuivre quelque chose de cette nature. Si vous n'essayez jamais, vous ne saurez jamais. Il y a quelques années, un son a commencé à résonner en moi. Mon travail exige des milliers et des milliers d'heures d'écoute, de transcription et d'interprétation de musique pour mes élèves. Je fais cela depuis près de deux décennies. Après avoir été immergé dans tant de musique - en disséquant et en expliquant le fonctionnement aux gens pendant si longtemps, je me sens très confiant de savoir ce qui fait une expérience d'écoute agréable et digne. Cela dit, cet album plaira sûrement aux amoureux, aux parents, aux rêveurs, aux cœurs solitaires, aux marques de luxe et aux moments cinématographiques emblématiques. Bien que la véritable intention de cet album fasse sans aucun doute appel à la simplicité trouvée dans le confort de tout cœur jusque tard dans la nuit.

    Les musiciens ont été choisis et désirent avec enthousiasme mettre cette musique dans votre histoire. Les studios et ingénieurs ont été choisis pour leur service réputé de qualité et professionnel. La musique elle-même a été auditionnée, choisie et arrangée de manière appropriée pour les membres de cet album. Les instruments eux-mêmes ont été testés et choisis intentionnellement pour les besoins de cette musique. Le label de distribution a été choisi pour son service irréprochable et ses relations avec tous les principaux services de streaming dans le monde. Et maintenant, vous avez été choisi pour vos propres valeurs d'amour et de camaraderie.

Veuillez utiliser les outils de partage indiegogo pour faire passer le mot.

Je vous remercie.

Musicalement vôtre,

Jonathan Crocco
story_txt:
Fund a beautiful late night jazz album from Paris, France.    Immersed in the melancholy and contemplation of the Parisian spirit, this album will be like a gentle cup of tea in the moonlit hours past midnight. Nothing better captures the heart than the sound of melancholic notes on a piano alongside the sweet scuffling of an upright bassist. Add a dream-like locomotion of drums and cymbals like sailing on a chariot in the clouds and you have the ingredients for a major work of art. With a song list inspired by such greats as Chet Baker, Russ Freeman and Bill Evans, this album is sure to win over the hearts of many.    Nothing destroys the heart of music more than fake instruments. This album will not only be played on real ones but the best of the best. A grand piano, vintage drums and cymbals and of course the maturity and wisdom of an upright bass. But the instruments don't make the music. People do. My name is Jonathan Crocco. It is my wish to bring to you an album of jazz of the highest quality and musicianship possible. Yet one that won't try to seduce your ego with virtuosity and fire. One that won't try to intellectualize harmony and rhythm beyond the peacefulness of the moon and a gentle breeze. Above all, one that won't disregard your need for love and companionship after the day has been put aside, as life carries you well past the hour of midnight.    After several rehearsals with the group spanning the later part of 2019, one of the members had to sacrifice his convenient availability for financial reasons. This is all too often the drama that occurs behind the curtain of a musician's life. This project needs your help. I have already invested hundreds of dollars in this album from buying the appropriate vintage cymbals to finding and rehearsing the appropriate musicians. I've also just got done professionally recording the ambient time of almost 20 vintage cymbals in an effort to better anticipate the most appropriate sound-locomotion behind the music of this project. Albums of this quality demand such seeds of consideration. This group has already performed at a business function and received a very pleasant return from the audience.    The studio, Bop City where the album was destined to be recorded awaits the green light. We were ready to officially record from my own finances this past February(2020). Everything has suddenly stopped. Depending on my budget I'd also like to hire a known Parisian trumpet player as special guest to intersperse references of the heart warming character of Chet Baker. I feel his subtle melancholic style will add the final touch to this beautifully simple, mature listening experience. I'm also very pleased to inform you that one of my long time friends from college now living in Seattle will be contributing one of his beautiful songs on piano to this album.    The details: I am of the generation that believes that good music starts with the right casting of musicians. story:
I am a massage therapist for my "day job", and when the pandemic hit, like a lot of other folks my business was shuttered - a wise move by the health department.  This gave me some extra space for the "music job", and I sent off for a copy of the Big Red Songbook from the Industrial Workers of the World's book store and started learning some tunes.  The original plan was to create a cd entirely from Big Red songs.  Then I started writing songs addressing the current situation, and decided to do a mix of old and new tunes.   As I was learning the old wobbly tunes, I was struck by how little difference there seems to be between the situation folks found themselves in a century ago and now.  The language of the time was more formal, and the popular music that the melodies were borrowed from would not be found on the charts today, but the basic themes and complaints still ring true.
 
This will be my 9th album, and is titled "Up With the Masses", taken from one of the old IWW tunes, Song for the Wage Slave.  I have been able to do the recording and production at my little studio, so the cost has been minimal on that end.   I wrapped up the audio portion of the project around 2am on Oct 28, and will be doing the artwork myself as well. 
 
What I need help with is the duplication and promotional costs. 
 

The quote from OasisCd is around 1500 for the 6 panel digipack package.  If I am unable to raise the entire amount for the campaign, it will still go towards the costs for the cd.   If more than the target amount is raised, it will go towards promotions, which will cost around the same as the duplication.    I have revised my goal from $3000 to $1800, but I am not certain that I can change that part of the campaign.

story:
...we have been struggling to raise enough money to keep him from being evicted at the end of the month.

Like many people in the past year, a close friend of mine was impacted heavily by the COVID-19 pandemic. I'm a film composer/producer and he's a fantastic drummer, so our first instinct was to play to our strengths to create something awesome to offer to people in exchange for their help. The problem is: we have less than two weeks to pull this off.

His Story

Already living paycheck to pay check, there was little margin of error when the pandemic hit the US. As a chronic sufferer of allergies, he found himself being sent home at his employer's whim, or at the slightest sneeze. Soon he also contracted the virus after exposure at his workplace, and was unable to work for an additional 3 weeks. After missing a total of 5 weeks of work, he found himself caught in an ever-growing snowball of fees and bills that made it impossible for him to get out on top.

Over the last few weeks, we have been struggling to raise enough money to keep him from being evicted at the end of the month. This is why we created the OP Drum library.

What you'll get

The OP Drum library is a collection of drum grooves, loops and fills that you can use in your personal music projects. You'll have a number of different styles and tempos to choose from in order to take your track to the next level, including classic rock, metal and country beats and fills. Everything was recorded live at SoundCast Studios in Winnetka, California, with state of the art equipment, and produced by industry professionals. Each successive perk contains even more of the original files and recordings used to create the library, for maximum control over your mix.

We're so close!

Through the efforts of another close friend, we were able to raise half of the amount needed to keep him housed! Now we just need the final push!

If you've read this far, thank you so much for your interest, and please share this with anyone who might be interested in our library and in supporting a fantastic and hard working musician!

story:
The PRE-ORDER campaign for our NEW ALBUM “EpiClassica”

officially closes on July 31st 2021.

After this date, it will no longer be possible to pre-order the album, or access the exclusive rewards. Those who PRE-ORDER by July 31st 2021 will receive the album BEFORE the release date.

Order NOW to gain EARLY ACCESS ahead of the general public!

Dear friends, our crowd-funding campaign page for our NEW album is OFFICIALLY LIVE! ✔

We invite you to join us as we begin the creation of our NEW All-Star album, which will feature a larger cast of world-class musicians than ever before!?

Throughout the campaign we will give you the opportunity to meet many of our artists, as we post weekly sneak-peek videos and exclusive previews from the making of our new album!✨

As with our previous record, this new album will showcase many amazing instrumentalists, vocalists, choirs, and orchestras from all across the globe. We are so excited to share this musical journey with you, and we want to thank you for your continued support; it truly means everything! ❤

~ NEW ALBUM ~

The new Vivaldi Metal Project album will not only feature classical masterworks by Vivaldi, but the works of other great composers such as Chopin, Mozart, Bach, Fauré, Schubert, Saint-Saens, Dvorak, Beethoven, Albinoni, Paganini, and more.

While based on classical themes, these songs will be largely composed of original material, representative of Vivaldi Metal Project’s symphonic-metal style.

As on the band’s previous album "The Four Seasons", all songs will include vocalists, band, orchestra and choir, as well as a featured cast of internationally-recognized metal and classical artists.

CONCEPT

The band's first record revolved around the concept of the various "seasons" of the human life - from birth to death. As a continuation of the last, this new album will explore the "seasons" of our emotional experience as human beings - from joys to sorrows and from frailty to deep strength. Each song creates a rich musical tapestry expressing the “colours” of raw human emotion, while weaving a common thread throughout the album.

~ OVERVIEW ~

The Vivaldi Metal Project is a symphonic-metal group conceived and produced by Italian keyboard player, composer and producer Mistheria

(solo artist, Bruce Dickinson, RoyZ, Rob Rock, Mark Boals, Artlantica, Tower of Babel)

 

Back in 2013, Mistheria started thinking about making a metal version of “The Four Seasons”, a masterpiece that he loved and kept listening to since his childhood. Mistheria started to play and record all the movements on the piano but then felt that a parallel symphonic-metal version would have been the perfect continuation.

Mistheria made the “innovative” choice – never done so far – to add lyrics and singers to “The Four Seasons” which, as composed by Vivaldi, is an instrumental work. For this important task, he invited Douglas R. Docker who perfectly translated the producer’s concept into brilliant lyrics. Additional lyrics were written by Mistheria, Rob Rock and Lance King.

A cast of 10 awesome arrangers joined Mistheria creating epic and memorable music, combining a standard metal band lineup with strings, orchestra and choir:
Douglas R. Docker, Francesco Dall’O’, Frank Caruso, Gabriels, Keiko Kumagai, Nicolas Waldo, Pawel Penksa, Tomas Varnagiris, Yannis Androulakakis, Zhivko Koev.

The cast furthermore includes performances by Mark Boals (Malmsteen, Royal Hunt), Fabio Lione (Rhapsody of Fire, Angra), Edu Falaschi (Almah), Rob Rock (Impellitteri), Mike Lepond (SymhonyX), Dani Löble (Helloween), Ruud Jolie (Within Temptation), Mark Cross (Firewind, Scorpions), Steve Di Giorgio (Testament), Rolf Pilve (Stratovarius), Victor Smolski (Rage, Almanac), Ruben Israel (Delain), John Macaluso (ARK), Marco Sfogli (James Labrie), Chris Caffery (Savatage), Mark Wood (Trans Siberian Orchestra), Dirk Verbeuren (Soilwork), Atma Anur (Tony MacAlpine), Vitalij Kuprij, Anna Portalupi (Tarja Turunen), Sean Tibbetts (Kamelot), Martijn Peters (Stream of Passion) and many more.

Moreover, the project features the “Sinfonietta Consonus Symphonic Orchestra” (Poland), the “Academic Choir Angel Manolov” (Bulgaria), the “Chamber Choir Ivan Filipovic” (Croatia) and the “Rock Academy Choir” (Croatia). It took more than 2 years of intensive non-stop hard work to complete the album.

Mixed and mastered by Ivan Moni Bidin at “Artesonika Recording Studio in Italy.

story:
Short Summary

The Words She Gave Me is a record written to be performed at the 2017 Capital Fringe Festival, and we need your help to finish it and get ready for our performances.

What We Need & What You Get

Since you are willing to support our campaign, we want to give you something in return. Rewards range from receiving a digital copy of the record to being publicly acknowledged during the run of the show in July 2017. As the campaign continues, more rewards may become available.

Here is a breakdown of what the funds from this campaign will cover:

  • Remainder of Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Copyrights & Publishing
  • Remainder of our 2017 Capital Fringe Festival Fees
  • The Short Film
  • Photography

 

All extra funding received will go into perfecting the record, improving the live-show experience, and covering all expenses of the production. Anything that will make The Words She Gave Me an exciting show for you to come watch.

The Impact

The goal of this project is to tell the stories of an African-American woman. By showing the many different stories that can make up an individual, we hope to break the monolith of the singular black woman and show that black women, as a collective, have a wealth of knowledge to share.

The record is the foundation upon which the stage production will be built, and it will exist long after the run of the show. Our goal is to produce a record, and ultimately a show, that will influence and inspire all who hear the record and come out to watch the show.

Risks & Challenges

Time is the Key - Every campaign has its challenges. The greatest challenge to this project is time. While there is a timeline in place to keep things on track, Murphy's law has a way of interfering with all projects both big and small. 

However, if there are any delays, you will be informed immediately. Any and all updates about the progress of the album will come out through this campaign as well as the production website. Follow us on our social media platforms to stay informed.

All-or-Nothing - This campaign is an all-or-nothing campaign. This means that if we reach our goal, then the album is fully funded and gets produced for all of you to enjoy before the show. If we do not reach our goal, then the stage production is at risk and we will be sad.

However, we have faith that we can not only reach our goal but surpass it and make a show that will be worth the lack of sleep we've been getting lately!

Mo' Money, No Problem! - The campaign has a set goal. However, if we happen to exceed our initial goal, please do not hesitate to continue supporting the campaign until it has reached completion.  All funds received will go towards the production of the album and the stage production in July 2017. Depending on how much extra money we receive, we may even have the opportunity to make some merch! Everything depends on you all and the success of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you aren't able to support the production financially. However, there are other ways to help us:

  • Share the campaign EVERYWHERE! - Post the link on social media and tag us when you do. The more people that know about the campaign the better!
     
  • Become a sponsor - Even if you can't support this starter campaign, you can still become a sponsor after this campaign is over. Visit our website to find out how.

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Ian Pickering was – and still is – an active member of the well-known British band Sneaker Pimps.

The main lyricist for the albums the band has released since 1996, he is now working on their brand new upcoming album.

In 1997, he was rewarded by ASCAP for writing the song "6 Underground" which was a hit in UK and the USA after it has been used in the American film "The Saint". 

Ian has always been known as a gifted and very talented lyricist but today he wants to show you that he is also a brilliant musician and vocalist with the release of his first solo album “Left Handed Tendencies”.

With initial recordings made in Chile in 2014, he has put his heart and soul into this album and now he is ready to share it with you but also to meet you, in the flesh, during a European Tour this coming autumn.

That’s why we need your help! We want to make this dream come true.

Your support, trust and faith mean the world to us!

We will keep you posted about the release date of the album and with the dates and venues of the European Tour as soon as possible.

Donate what you want, we will be eternally grateful... and if you cannot donate, spread the word please :-)

Thanks for your attention XxX


You may listen to the acoustic version of "When Horses Were King", one of the songs of the album, by following this link ;)

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/mauco-recordings/when-ho...

story:
Short version: we want your money. We’re also accepting satchels of gold nuggets, unwanted Bentleys, and mouthfuls of precious gems stolen from booby-trapped pirate ships.

Long version: Kangaralien’s recording efforts to this point have been modest in scope. For the most part we set up two mics in Eric’s basement, gaze adoringly into each other’s eyes, and try to get through a take without butchering it. We’re ready to try something new.

We’d like to “do it right” this time. Some of the process, namely the adoring gazes, will remain. But we’re expanding to full-band arrangements featuring some semi-recognizable names. Depending on how much cash we can drum up, we’ve been in talks with drummer Gavin Harrison (Porcupine Tree, Iggy Pop, King Crimson), bassist Tony Levin (Peter Gabriel, Liquid Tension Experiment, Paul Simon), and some other celebrity-type peoples. Was that enough name-dropping? Cool.

Some of these musicians we don’t know personally, so we’d need to pay them actual wages. And even our buddies like Max Zemanovic (Miranda Lambert, Andrew Duhon) should probably get paid I guess. Aside from paying musicians, once we add acoustic drums and dozens of overdubs into the fold, we may decide to hire a mix engineer. Beyond that we need to pay for studio time for live drums, mastering, artwork, graphic design, photography, duplication, and one gross of Shamwows. Eric is clumsy and he’s planning to spill stuff everywhere.

One of the reasons crowd-funding is useful is that it helps us gauge interest. How many vinyl copies should we press? Zero? Do people still buy CDs? Where do ponies go when they die?

So- what do you get in return for your contribution? Check out our list of incentives. The main prize, of course, is that I, Steve, will give you the “what’s up” nod when we see each other in public. You can’t put a price on that. But it’s $125. Also, give any amount and you're entitled to updates on our album. You’ll see videos of what we’re up to, videos of me riding my bike, maybe a super non-informative guitar instructional video, and definitely a makeup tutorial.

We literally can’t do this without you. Help me Obi-Wan Kenobi. You’re my only hope.

story:
Short Summary

 

Mo Javi is a classically trained and mostly self taught violinist who has been playing for 14 years. He specializes in Classical, Folk, and Blues, and can read music, write music, play by ear, and improvise. He has coined his original style as "Baroque Folk," combining influences from Bach, Mozart, Celtic, and American folk music. 

 

Royal Engagement is Mo Javi's very first EP, and he wants your help in bringing it to its fullest potential. If we can raise $500 (the minimum campaign goal), that will cover studio recording, mixing, and mastering expenses for the entire EP. As a result, it will be released FOR FREE. If the people make it, it's the people's. 

 

IF YOU DONATE, you will not only get to be awesome, but you will also get early access to Mo Javi's first full length album Royal Wedding, which was also recorded on his phone and will be released in October (there will be a campaign for that album as well). 

 

Please listen to Royal Engagement and support this campaign if you believe in the potential of this EP. If anything, please leave feedback (if you liked it or hated it), share it with your friends, and check out all of Mo Javi's other projects by visiting MoJaviMusic.com or just googling his name, "Mo Javi."

 

Thank you for your time, and please enjoy the music!

 

(Here is a link in case the video does not show on mobile: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7tBFHFYwvkg

He has coined his original style as "Baroque Folk," combining influences from Bach, Mozart, Celtic, and American folk music. 
 
Royal Engagement is Mo Javi's very first EP, and he wants your help in bringing it to its fullest potential. If we can raise $500 (the minimum campaign goal), that will cover studio recording, mixing, and mastering expenses for the entire EP. As a result, it will be released FOR FREE. If the people make it, it's the people's. 
 

IF YOU DONATE, you will not only get to be awesome, but you will also get early access to Mo Javi's first full length album Royal Wedding, which was also recorded on his phone and will be released in October (there will be a campaign for that album as well). 
 
Please listen to Royal Engagement and support this campaign if you believe in the potential of this EP. If anything, please leave feedback (if you liked it or hated it), share it with your friends, and check out all of Mo Javi's other projects by visiting MoJaviMusic.com or just googling his name, "Mo Javi."
 
Thank you for your time, and please enjoy the music!
 
(Here is a link in case the video does not show on mobile: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7tBFHFYwvkg

story:
Journalists write about us: "This is the only band playing Dream Rock in the world - a style that unites the best traditions of English nonsense, fairy tales, Irish folklore and Russian poetry. If you are real connoisseurs of moments, when the fairy tales left on the lost bookshelves of the distant childhood, suddenly come to life and penetrate, seep, pervade and fill the space of the premises of your souls, this music is for you!"

During the last 10 years we produced 4 studio albums. We experimented with sound & styles (baroque, psychedelic, acoustic metal etc.) Each of our albums is a collection of musical postmodern stories, parables & allegories in which we often refer to the characters and works of such classical and contemporary writers as Edgar Poe, Herbert Wells, Oscar Wilde, Lewis Carroll, Lyman Frank Baum, Neil Gaiman and the others. For example, our 4th album "The House that Jack Built" is a collection of songs based on children's rhymes and various horror stories, the main characters of which are a variety of Jack-of-all-trades (Jack on stilts, Jack the Ripper, Jack-Smith "Pumpkin Head" etc.). We also work closely with the artists & they like to illustrate our songs, here are some examples:

Now we are ready to begin recording our fifth album. This time we will tell in our songs about fearless pirates, ancient monsters lurking in the depths of the seas & oceans, chests & treasures, as well as about the eternal search for the road to home & wanderings in the time loop. It will be a truly exciting trip!

Most of our foreigner friends & fans were confused visiting Russian website due to language difficulties.

So this time we prepared all information in English to be transparent & understandable )

We Need to reach 3500$:

  • Rent & recording studio fee - 1500$
  • Mixing & mastering studio fee - 2000$

As we don't have any sponsors or other financial income than our gigs, we need your support to realize our project!

We are sure that our songs will say much more about us than any words and reassurances. Below you will find several links to our music from the previous releases:

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/bezumen

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/02a-1

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/04a

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/o-dzheke-kogda-to-postroivshem-dom

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/03a-1

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/those-who-have-returned-home

http://soundcloud.com/salvador2010-1/lovkach

Already today you can buy our future album, & we are absolutely confident that you will love our new experiments with sound and rhythms!

There are also many other possibilities to support the band according to your means & wishes. You will definitely find something interesting for you!

Besides the material support you can help us to create the buzz & tell about this campaign to your friends. You can use the Indiegogo share tools, write emails, make phone calls & just simply speak to the people about Russian noir & postmodern duet-band that is going to record their new album.

Any support is important to us!

Finally, we want to share with you a small humorous fragment of a funny song from the famous and cult Russian cartoon "Treasure Island" based on the novel by Robert Lewis Stevenson. Enjoy it!

Yours,

ESCHER'S STAIRS

story:
My name is Nice Brazil. I'm singer, composer and producer from São Paulo, Brazil. I love the Brazilian music, especially the Brazilian Jazz. I already produced 4 Albums - 3 Independents in my 15-years career as a professional musician. The album JaZZ Popular Brasileiro is my new project and will be presented on tour with a great Band in March 2018. During the Tour the Album will be recorded. I hope you will come on board to help make it happen!

My passion for music began in my childhood in São Paulo, my hometown. With the music of the Radio and major festivals. With the protest and revolt against the military dictatorship, present in the poetry of composers such as Chico Buarque, Geraldo Vandré and Joao Bosco. With MPB (Brazilian Popular Music), with Bossa Nova. And last but not least the great interpreters of Brazilian music, Jazz and Pop music.

Later, my experience as an actress in theater and musicals for kids would further reinforce my desire to deepen myself in the creative work of vocal expression. At that time the fascination for music and theater led me to an interest in different musical styles and their interpretations. This interest and fascination with music are still omnipresent.

It's a pleasure to express myself through music and have the prestige to share that passion not only with my musicians, but also with you,  fan of the Brazilian music.

With the new album JaZZ Popular Brasileiro I'll celebrate my musical roots and honor my ancestors.

The project will be realized with the support of amazing musicians: the Brazilian drumming legend Portinho (BR/USA), the great pianist and producer Klaus Mueller (G/USA) and the grant bass player Dudu Penz (BR/CH).

Help us with realizing this multifaceted project – support our effort and our love of the music !

Thank you very much !

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise Euro 18,000 for our tour & recording.
This money will go towards travel, hotel and catering costs during the tour and album recording.  Also album mixing, album mastering, album artwork, players fees, publicity and advertising efforts.
To show our appreciation to our backers, We have listed some perks that we think you will really love, from receiving the music you have graciously decided to support, to getting a personal show and everything in between.  

I hope that with this current campaign, we can achieve not only a financial support to implement our Album and our Tour, but also that we can count with the moral and emotional support which this project deserves.

Any money that is raised beyond my campaign goal will be put towards the album record budget, and increased online advertising and distribution.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word !

 

The Difference You Make

As you know if you’ve been watching my career in the last fifteen years, I sing, compose, manage and produce my own projects by myself.  I have also organized some concerts in Germany. I'm lucky to have real friends and great musicians by my side. My persistent musical work, my experience and musical insight, led me to successfully produce and record my independent albums:
Meu Caminho (My Way), Arcobaleno (Rainbow), Pra Voce (For You) and Minhas Raízes (My Roots).

The CD Arcobaleno at JazzMagazin, JazzThing:

https://www.jazzthing.de/review/arcobaleno-bossa-nova-more/

The CD Pra Voce won an honorable mention on the list of the best Brazilian music in 2014

http://www.melhoresdamusicabrasileira.com.br/2014/12/2014-amostra-completa.html

Since many years I've been singing with my band at many jazz clubs and several jazz festivals in Europe.

My repertoire consists of  compositions of the 60s and 70s only - and my own compositions.

About the new Project  "JaZZ Popular Brasileiro":

With this project, I want to reveal the parallels and discrepancies between Jazz and MPB (Brazilian Popular Music).
The basic idea is to reduce as far as possible the musical distance to jazz and to reveal all the jazz affinities in our popular music.
Opposing sounds, rhythms, poetry and a diverse mix of different Brazilian musical styles like Bossa-Nova, Samba, Choro, Baiao etc. are being offered.
In this way, already known compositions are interpreted in a new way and esteemed from another perspective.
In addition, the compositions themselves tell stories that invite you to reflect, feel and dream. The fusion of different styles of music lends the diversity of life a voice - the voice of jazz.

Thank you very much for your contribution to the realization of this project !

Live in Concert - Enjoy us live !

March, 

23st - in Bad Zurzach (CH), Sodi Jazz 

24st - in Frankfurt, Jazzkeller Frankfurt 

25st - in Frankfurt,  Jazzkeller Frankfurt

26st - in St. Gallen (CH) , Jazz Club Gambrinus

28st - in Oldenburg, Jazz Club Alluvium 

29st - in Einbeck, Tango Brücke

31st - in Bad Marienberg, Jazz We Can 

April,

02nd - in Rosenheim, Le Pirate

03rd - in Pforzheim - Studio Record AV-Music

04st - in Pforzheim - Studio Record AV-Music

05st - in Pforzheim - Studio Record AV-Music

06st - in Stuttgart, Jazz Club BIX 

07st - in Bamberg, Jazz Club Bamberg

08st - in Asperg - Portinho's Workshop

See You There !

story:
Short Summary

Hello, world! We are Foray Between Ocean (F.B.O.), five dudes based in Athens Greece (Jon, Themis, Kostas, Elias and Stefanos) who make sweet horror lullabies for your children's nightmares. Over the past two years we have released our 1st album "Depression neverending" .We've toured our country and played to some awesome venues, also supporting some notable acts like Annihilator, Belfegor etc. But now the time has come. Τhe time to write more horror stories, more sweet death/black metal tunes, for teachers to teach and preachers to preach. We've already began to write our beautiful hellish music, in order to take advantage of this incredible opportunity, we need some help!

Without you, it would be MUCH more difficult, delayed, and stressful to share the power of positive actions and perseverance through the music we create as Foray Between Ocean.

We live the music everyday. We hope that the notes and the words convey the strong feelings and emotions that inspired them. Each song built upon real life human experiences. We take inspiration from each other, from our fans, from our communities, and this world we share.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 3.000€ more in addition to our own funds in order to afford and create the massive and incredible sound we want to.. All of the money you donate to us, will go directly to paying SOUND!
  • Don't worry, we have many presents for you. Donate and you will receive tons of F.B.O. merch and other cool stuff and our everlasting gratitude 
  • Even if we don't raise all of the money, anything we receive will help us to get closer to our goal of completing this project.

We pride ourselves as being a self sustaining group. Every dollar we make throughout the year from music sales, touring, and merchandise keeps us going financially. It covers our fuel, our rehearsal space rent, equipment upkeep, and every once in a while accomidations when we’ve ventured far enough to deem the drive home unsafe.

 

 

The Impact

  • As most of you that music business faces the worst crisis in the history of music. So the impact to all of this will be huge, even by your smallest contribution.

  • Helping us put out this album will help to increase our platform and ability to inspire other people who might want to make music but feel uncomfortable doing so in the world of music crisis.

 

Some Of Our All ready Existing Merch

You can see some of our old stuff in official website

www.foraybetweenocean.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate (we understand, we're broke too) there are many ways you can help us out!

Like and share this page on Facebook, where we will also be reaching out for help! Send this link to all your friends!

Buy our merch/come to our shows! The more we can increase our own funds, the more we can contribute to our own recording costs. 

 

Unique Artwork from Jon

Get your personal ONE OF A KIND portrait artwork of your own picture, created by Jon Toussas!! Feel the growl with this 24" by 36" (approx 60 by 90cm) portrait printed on canvas. The artwork will be created for you exclusively, and will be SIGNED by Jon himself. See example picture Jon made of himself.

 

The Band

If you would still like to help but don't have funds, you can help us by telling all of your friends that this campaign is running. You can also share this campaign on your social media by using the Indiegogo share tools located at the top of this page.

Email!
Facebook!
Instagram!
Twitter!
Blogs!
Youtube!
Music forums!

We can't tell you how much we are looking forward to show you this second full-length album!!! This album is created from the HEART!!!

Thank you all so much!

Love,

Foray Between Ocean

Jon - Themis - Kostas - Elias - Stefanos

JOIN US ON OUR JOURNEY TO RELEASE OUR 2ND ALBUM

http://www.foraybetweenocean.com

story:
Hullo! We are Wam Dingis.  The purpose of this campaign is to help fund the creation of our music video for our latest single - ‘Dark Parlor.’ We’ve been working hard to write and create new music for our upcoming album. We start shooting in April and just need a little help with funding to get the ball rolling, so we can share our music and art in a way for everyone to enjoy from home with this new music video. 

Although COVID-19 has hit us all hard and we can no longer play live shows to source funding for our band’s projects, we refuse to let it stop us from making awesome music and content.

We aspire to take our creative processes to the next level with every sense of professionalism. In order to achieve this result, we need your help to cover production expenses, while supporting other industry professionals that will be involved. 

ABOUT US

Originally established in 2002, Wam Dingis is the Los Angeles foursome composed of Jor Avila, Mindy Dymin, Darren Cochran, and Angela Vasquez. With their gleefully warbled guitars, swirling strings, scorching keys, and frenetic rhythms - Wam Dingis conjures melodic art rock with undeniable pop hooks and an energy that is simply contagious.

Wam Dingis is the friction between silk and velvet. The mixture of pink and lime green. The image you must cross your eyes to see...the flight of champagne bubbles, the squeal of a tea kettle, the dream you remember having. The animal that pets you.

- Christian Koons of Song Exploder, Flood Magazine, The Dinner Party, and Goon

PERKS 

We invite you, our fans, friends, and friends of friends, to participate in this project! In return for your support at any level, we have prepared a list of exclusive experiences, band merchandise, memorabilia, and more:

MERCH

  • Wam Dingis ‘Footkini’ Mugs 
  • CDs 
  • Wam Dingis Vinyl Stickers
  • Screen Printed Tote Bag 
  • Embroidered Baseball Caps 
  • Screen Printed T-Shirts
  • Wam Dingis Buttons 
  • Wam Dingis Zines by Moonbox

MEMORABILIA 

  • Autographed Yamaha Black Bass used in show 
  • Autographed Jet King Ibanez Guitar 
  • Autographed Drumsticks
  • Autographed Zebra Fur Pearl Rack Tom Drum 
  • Army Green Jumpsuit Worn at Wam Dingis Show (Size S) 
  • Wam Dingis Leather Jacket Used in Music Video 
  • Handwritten Lyrics 

Once in a Lifetime Perks, You Won't Find Anywhere Else

  • Darren’s Wisdom Tooth Resin Necklace 
  • Personalized Caricature of anything by the artist, Jor 
  • Personalized Caricature of you or your pet by Darren
  • Commissioned Portrait Painting by Jordan 
  • Personalized Song by Jordan 
  • Jordan or Darren shaves his head
  • Footkini Fetish Photos of Wam Dingis Member Feet 
  • Zoom Master Class w/ Wam Dingis
    • 1 hr Painting Class 
    • 45 min. Guitar 
    • 45 min. Bass 
    • 45 min. Drums

story_txt:
Hullo! We are Wam Dingis.  The purpose of this campaign is to help fund the creation of our music video for our latest single - ‘Dark Parlor.’ We’ve been working hard to write and create new music for our upcoming album. We start shooting in April and just need a little help with funding to get the ball rolling, so we can share our music and art in a way for everyone to enjoy from home with this new music video. Although COVID-19 has hit us all hard and we can no longer play live shows to source funding for our band’s projects, we refuse to let it stop us from making awesome music and content.We aspire to take our creative processes to the next level with every sense of professionalism. In order to achieve this result, we need your help to cover production expenses, while supporting other industry professionals that will be involved. ABOUT USOriginally established in 2002, Wam Dingis is the Los Angeles foursome composed of Jor Avila, Mindy Dymin, Darren Cochran, and Angela Vasquez. With their gleefully warbled guitars, swirling strings, scorching keys, and frenetic rhythms - Wam Dingis conjures melodic art rock with undeniable pop hooks and an energy that is simply contagious.Wam Dingis is the friction between silk and velvet. The mixture of pink and lime green. The image you must cross your eyes to see...the flight of champagne bubbles, the squeal of a tea kettle, the dream you remember having. The animal that pets you.- Christian Koons of Song Exploder, Flood Magazine, The Dinner Party, and GoonPERKS We invite you, our fans, friends, and friends of friends, to participate in this project! In return for your support at any level, we have prepared a list of exclusive experiences, band merchandise, memorabilia, and more:MERCH

story:
The idea:

"Antilles, before the islands: our black blood. Antilles, a fusion of cultures, of peoples who, faced with kidnapping and plunder, responded with chants for freedom. The Antillean Confederation was an ideology of those who, like Ramón Emeterio Betances, saw in our islands the emergence of a new idiosyncrasy: the Caribbean spirit. Betances, the Antillean, by choice he knew our sea, he lived in many of our islands and fought for the freedom of our peoples. Faced with the threat of empires, either from the north or from the west, he proclaimed: the Antilles for the Antilleans. From that statement emerges the memory of our common stories, because we are islands bathed by the same sea, the same blood flows, the same joys and the same pain. We speak in Spanish, French, Creole, English. We are Fusion, flavors, colors and rhythms. And from our diversity the Antillean calls to beat in syncopated beats."

Our idea for the CD is born from the statement above.  I have been playing since I was a teenager and after many years I have noticed that we as people have more things in common than differences.  This recording is a celebration of that and what it means in this moment to the islands of the Caribbean.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The budget for the recording is about $15,000.  We can complete $2,000 with our savings as a band. So we need about $13,000 to complete what is needed to pay the studio recording, mixing, mastering, studio engineers, CD manufacturing, Art, etc.
  • As a perk for supporting our campaign we offer downloads, physical CD's and Fusion Beat T-Shirts
  • Please help us reach this goal by purchasing your CD in advance and claim one of our rewards.  Thank you !

The Impact

  • This project emphasize the things that we have in common as people.
  • We have been developing master classes on our music for beginners, intermediate and advanced levels. 
  • We can use the recording to improve the pedagogical quality of our instruction delivery
  • The community is always benefited by good and diverse music. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The challenge is to record a 6 piece jazz group all at the same time.  Also to do all the pre-production, production and post-production on time.
  • However the musician's proficiency and the quality of our arrangers and composers will help us to overcome this challenge.
  • As a band we all have been involved successfully before in the production of recordings.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, please help us to spread the word with social media.  You can use the Facebook, Twitter and Copy Link icons on IndieGoGo to spread the word. Thank you!

story:
How  To Do The VEGAS STEP

 

 

VEGAS STEP Performance Visual

Short Summary

Coming from the Capital of Entertainment "Las Vegas", You should know this city is about fun. I've Performed all my life around Las Vegas from local clubs, Downtown , even the Strip. Now it's about that time for me (Richard T.) and the Stereo Band to get back together and introduce the new single "Vegas Step" to the Stage, Clubs, Parties, Radio, better yet the world !

Now you may be thinking ... What is "Vegas Step" ? "Vegas Step" is a song written By myself ,and produced by my son Bosie T "THURSTY". We Know that when it comes to music, you can get a lot of things out of it, joy, sadness, energy  etc. We're inspired to bring people together and make a party where ever you are , by Listening and Learning the " Vegas Step". This new line dance represents the City of Las Vegas from the era of Sammy Davis Jr. , every day activities in vegas, and of course the Theme of Downtown and the Strip. (we have a tutorial you can learn the "Vegas Step" on the website www.VEGASSTEP.com)

"Vegas Step" is another way we can add to the culture/pride here in Vegas , along with building ourself up with #VegasStrong campaigns , our city is growing with Newly added Pro Sport Teams  from the WNBA,NHL, and NFL . So why not have a new theme song that our communities , tourist  can celebrate with. Altho it's a Vegas Made song , a bigger vision is the whole world can love and do the "Vegas Step" !

What We Need & What You Get

With us doing the groundwork from writing , music composition , Recording, Mixing and mastering. Another Step to laying down the foundation was copyrighting , publishing, and registering " Vegas Step " through the proper channels of the music industry. The Last move was to deliver " Vegas Step " to all digital retail and streaming services such as Apple Music/iTUNES, Tidal, and Spotify etc. Now you may think "We've crossed the finish line !! ", Not exactly.
 

This "Vegas Step" Fundraiser Campaign goal is set at $50,000. With your help the vision of making "Vegas Step" a celebration hit, will be grand. Every contribution from $1 - beyond will bring "Vegas Step" to life through Marketing/Promotion tools , along with a major professional video shoot. Just picture it now , Capturing the story (lyrics) of "Vegas Step" all over the city. With that being said not only are you helping 1 dream into reality, but also giving an opportunity to hire if not 1 but a team of Las Vegas based film companies . Im talking Fully staffed and film equipment , that you've only see on a Hollywood set (Just because we need the Quality Look). We're Talking as big as we can make it. To film on famous properties and communities , we will have to pull permits to film on location so it's no hassle on capturing whats need for the video. Keeping it Vegas , there are a lot of self owned restaurants that we would love to have apart of the filming day . Gotta keep the crew fed.

Your contribution will also help "Vegas Step"  establish the recognition as a brand through marketing and promotions. We're talking about T-shirts, Hats, water bottles ect. To create awareness we're looking to use the old school and the new school social methods. We would like to put together a " Vegas Step" Movement street team ,that will be active hand to hand with the people in the city , tourist and Natives. Social Media Marketing is away to reach people who also loves the city of Las Vegas , but may not be in town and needs to know about "Vegas Step", the social marketing Ads Campaign  will promote the Website www.VegasStep.com  , and everything that deals with the movement down to streaming the song , learning the dance (From Tutorial) , and uploading their self doing the "Vegas Step".

Theres many other events to come with "Vegas Step" such as setting up a Flash mob event. If you don't know , or even seen a flash mob , look it up and then imagine ... 500+ gathering around to do the "Vegas Step".

And Last but not Least . It's time to get the band back together , lets get Richard T. and the Stereo Band on the Big Stage at The Downtown Fremont ! To have a Celebration Event on completion and future of "Vegas Step"

We have some Awesome Perks to give to our contributors (you can see the list on the right). Just to say thank you for taking your time to see what "Vegas Step" is all about , and Believing and wanting to see us push forward . From "Vegas Step" Window Decals/Stickers , Ink  Pens , and T-shirts. Also with VIP invites to partake in the "Vegas Step" video shoot , and VIP area of the "Vegas Step" release Party. One of my favorite perks of them all ,  the  "VEGAS STEP" Record Plaque (Check Pledge list). Would love to say Thank you with something you can hang on the wall and feel proud to help and add to the History of Las Vegas Entertainment.

With asking for a goal of $50,000, you may wonder what happens if the goal is not Reached to the max. We like to insure you that what ever funds that is raised will still contribute to continuing and  reaching our vision of getting "Vegas Step" a platform at its best . And your pledge Perk will still be in your hands to say thank you. 

The Impact

Getting "Vegas Step" off the ground and into the universe will not only add to the legacy of Richard T. And The Stereo Band, but it will also add to the history of songs about Las Vegas. Ranging from Elvis, on down to the local independent artist. To introduce "Vegas Step" as the newest song party goers can do a line dance to , this will also be in the category of unforgettable , countless events and moments we've all did the "Hustle" , "Electric Slide" , the "Cha Cha Slide" , even down to the youth doing the "Whip and Nae Nae", so theres no way we can't come together one more time to enjoy this new "Vegas Step" !

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is being afraid of something new. But when 1 or more come together, we will continue to show #VegasStrong and still have a great time. It's all about Positivity

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If at this time you cannot contribute to this funding campaign. We still would love for you to be apart of the " Vegas Step" movement. With you taking the time to see what it's all about , it is inspiring and motivation to the cause. You can help in any Direction of sponsoring/referring service that can help us gain ground to making things happen. If our song, line dance, tutorials , or anything we've put together has moved you, a simple word of mouth , song stream , campaign share or social share will help get "Vegas Step" mission in the right places . This is for us !  

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who are we?

VTF PROJECT hails from South Florida and has been performing at local clubs and lounges around South Florida tri-county area (Miami-Dade, Broward, Palm Beach) and New Orleans, always receiving high praise from both fellow musicians and general public.

Our first album

As we struggle to get a foothold regionally and play live shows as much as we possibly can, we firmly believe the album to be the perfect vehicle for our music. It will reach a broader audience and deliver our proposal to a wider public. 

  • Your funding will help us cover recording studio, production and release expenses such as:
    • recording sessions
    • mixing
    • mastering
    • vinyl/cd production
    • marketing release
  • You will be the first to get our first album, self-titled VTF PROJECT!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always eager looking for fans and following. If you are not a local South Floridian, you can still visit our online properties, listen to our songs, see our videos, drop comments or simply read about us and our music:

  • https://vtfproject.com
  • https://facebook.com/vtfproject
  • https://instagram.com/vtfproject
  • https://reverbnation.com/vtfproject
  • https://twitter.com/vtfproject
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

story:
My fifth  MAGIC KINGDOM album and definitely the most Symphonic and Epic one!
Though it's a shame that the reality for musicians is becoming harder every day, we still want to make great music for our fans and give it our all.
Difficult times indeed. A big amount of budget must be spent on the production.
It would mean the world to me and everyone that works hard on the Magic Kingdom albums to get support from those who we do it for, our fans!

I have invested everything in my music since I was very young, my time, my effort and my money.
Music is a very hard and demanding job that needs you to invest until you can't anymore, then it asks you to find another way to invest more. 

AFM  and Marquee Avalon also always supported the best they could, but a big epic orchestra is really expensive and one hundred of musicians will be involved to produce the best album I ever wrote. Actually every song, structure and harmony is based on the orchestral arrangements for the new material and I always had in mind to write for the orchestra. 
Now it's time we get it for real!
My goal amount is only a little part of what I need for the new recordings, so let's see how this works!

If you want to figure out more or if you don't know my career or my bands ... check my facebook page or my website!

https://www.facebook.com/MAGICKINGDOMofficial
www.dushanpetrossi.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Spread around how you love our band and help us find even more fans.Like our things on Facebook and ask everyone you know to like our page.

Ask your local promotor to book us for gigs and festivals.

For all of your music, don't download but buy the CD.Support by ordering directly from the website or the Magic Kingdom facebook page (CD's, girlies, shirts...)

 

We thank you!

story:
Des Mantras pour le Yoga Kundalini !

Ce projet est d'abord l'histoire d'une rencontre, à Bordeaux, entre l'association Présence, proposant des cours de Yoga, des soins énergétiques et des voyages en Inde, et de Raphaël Raymond, compositeur.

Il y eu d'abord un premier "cadeau" de la part du compositeur à l'association, un mantra composé juste pour le plaisir d'offrir mais qui fît naître l'idée d'un projet de plus grande ampleur : un album entier dédié aux mantras kundalini.

Raphaël Raymond est compositeur et multi-instrumentiste, son travail mêle les voix, les instruments de la pop et ceux de l'orchestre classique, le tout donnant une musique variée, dynamique et colorée, se mariant avec les énergies de chaque mantra kundalini.

Les mantras de l'album seront :

  • Sa Ta Na Ma
  • Ek Ong Kar
  • Om Dom Hari Hari
  • Gobinday Mukanday
  • Sat Guray Namé
  • Pavan Guru
  • Ramadasa Sa Say So Hung

Tous ces mantras seront composés sur des mélodies originales.

Un mantra est une syllabe, un mot ou une phrase dans l'une des langues sacrées (comme le sanskrit et Ghurmeki) qui élève ou modifie la conscience par sa signification, le son lui-même, le rythme, et le ton.

Merci de collaborer à ce doux projet. Avec tout notre coeur, Sat Nam.
story_txt:
Des Mantras pour le Yoga Kundalini !Ce projet est d'abord l'histoire d'une rencontre, à Bordeaux, entre l'association Présence, proposant des cours de Yoga, des soins énergétiques et des voyages en Inde, et de Raphaël Raymond, compositeur.Il y eu d'abord un premier "cadeau" de la part du compositeur à l'association, un mantra composé juste pour le plaisir d'offrir mais qui fît naître l'idée d'un projet de plus grande ampleur : un album entier dédié aux mantras kundalini.Raphaël Raymond est compositeur et multi-instrumentiste, son travail mêle les voix, les instruments de la pop et ceux de l'orchestre classique, le tout donnant une musique variée, dynamique et colorée, se mariant avec les énergies de chaque mantra kundalini.Les mantras de l'album seront :
Sa Ta Na Ma
Ek Ong Kar
Om Dom Hari Hari
Gobinday Mukanday
Sat Guray Namé
Pavan Guru
Ramadasa Sa Say So Hung
Tous ces mantras seront composés sur des mélodies originales.Un mantra est une syllabe, un mot ou une phrase dans l'une des langues sacrées (comme le sanskrit et Ghurmeki) qui élève ou modifie la conscience par sa signification, le son lui-même, le rythme, et le ton.Merci de collaborer à ce doux projet. Avec tout notre coeur, Sat Nam.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Studio2 is an upcoming company working in all creative sectors! From Game Development, Music Production, Video Production and Online Radio.

Video Game Development: 
Studio2 all started when Chips Gray and Matt Jones began working together to create Final Frontier (an on-going project). Once a few others had joined the team, we noticed how well we are able work together to create great things. Now, Studio2 Games is working on two minor free to play games and three major games, an FPS, RTS and a Simulator. 

Music Production: On the Music side we currently have one artist signed with us, under the stage name Paull. We hope to help support his dream by giving him and others the resources needed to succeed. 

Video Production: 
This is a sector of the company that will require a lot of attention. We currently have two Dramas, a Horror Short Film, a Documentary and a Pilot Comedy Series being pushed for TV release. 

Online Radio: Studio2 Radio, still widely known as CurveRadio, started back in 2013. It has a great group of volunteer staff who present great shows. However, due to changes in licensing agreements it has become more expensive to run, even as a non-commercial station. 


In order to get everything to run smoothly, we need to have a starting point on our financial side. All our work so far has been voluntary and all expenditure has come out of the pockets of our staff. This is why we need your help! Your pledge will enable Studio2 to grow as a company and provide our staff with the resources they need to continue to turn their visions into reality. 


Risks and challenges

Challenges would be keeping all sectors organised, but we are combating this issue with trusted hard working managers in each sector, keeping things running. 
Even without this backing, everyone involved will still work hard and press on, but the only way we can see movement for the company is to have this financial support. 
Thank you for showing interest in this project!

story:
THE CARNIVAL RAP UP 2016???

How much does it mean to you?

Every year thousands of people in Trinidad & Tobago and abroad look forward to the release of the 'Carnival Rap Up" from Chromatics! A witty and incisive song that recaps the memorable moments and all the "Bachanal" of the Trinidad & Tobago Carnival Season.

This time we are doing it different! This time we want YOU the Fans to Help Create it! We are asking for 400 people to donate $10 US or more in order for Chromatics to write, record, produce, mix, master and release the Carnival Rap Up 2016! In turn each person that contributes will receive the song exclusively in their email.

Fans who donate $10 or more will receive an additional Perk of either a FREE ticket to Chromatics' next concert/event, or, a complimentary copy of Chromatics next album.

This is not only a way to fund a project people love, but to also introduce new ways in which artists sell their music and products. This is the first time a project like this has been approached in this manner in Trinidad & Tobago. So help create the "Carnival Rap Up 2016' and be a part of History!

____________________________________________________________________________

Important Things to Note: (Paypal Verified)

- If we reach our goal of $4000, contributions received via PayPal are held until the campaign's deadline. If we do not reach our goal, all contributions will be refunded within 3-5 business days of campaign's deadline.

- The Deadline to reach our goal is February 14th.

.- Paypal accepted for ease of transactions
