story:
Zur Idee

Vor einiger Zeit haben sich Musiker, Künstler und Interessierte zusammengeschlossen und trafen sich, um den Techno wieder zu beleben. Aus der Idee wurde ein Verein, aus den Plänen Wirklichkeit. Veranstaltungen wie z.B. "Der Zirkus ist in der Stadt" oder "NEON" wurden von uns umgesetzt und unterstützt. Wir haben nun beschlossen, abgesehen von den weiter laufenden Veranstaltungsreihen, ein Vereinshaus zu schaffen, um ab November/Dezember 2015 dort einen gemeinnützigen Club zu eröffnen! Denn wo kann man vor den Toren Frankfurts noch zu moderner Musik tanzen? Doch es geht nicht ausschließlich um Techno:
Unsere Ziele sind:
  1. Eröffnung des Vereinshauses ("Tabakmühle")
  2. Umsetzung von öffentlichen Veranstaltungsreihen
  3. Förderung von jungen DJs und Musikern
  4. Unterstützung von kleinen Veranstaltungsreihen
  5. Dauerhafte Betreibung der Tabakmühle als Kulturzentrum
  6. Förderung von Künstlern
  7. Präsentieren von Kunstobjekten in Form von Ausstellungen
  8. Eröffnung von Proberäumen für lokale Bands
  9. Spätere Expansion auf weitere Hallen
  10. Musiklegenden in den Taunus holen
Am Projekt wird des weiteren rein ehrenamtlich gearbeitet. Der gemeinnützige Verein "Förderverein für Kunst und Musik in Oberursel e.V." wird das Vereinshaus leiten und eröffnen! Für dich heißt das, dass die Tabakmühle ohne Konzentration auf Profit laufen wird, sie wird keinen dauerhaften Gewinn erwirtschaften.
Alles, was eingenommen wird kommt dem direkt Vereinshaus zu Gute.
Ausgegeben wird das Startkapital für größere Anlagen, mehr DJs und mehr gemeinnützige Förderungen.
Ganz speziell brauchen wir das Geld um damit die Miete in den ersten 2 Monaten zu bezahlen, bis sich die Tabakmühle selbst trägt. Eine Halle ist bereits für uns reserviert, Licht- und Ton ist schon eingelagert und Mitarbeiter (Bar, Security, Licht- und Tontechnik) stehen schon bereit um die Opening-Party zu starten.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Das Grundkapital dient der Erstfinanzierung der Halle. Mit dem Geld bezahlen wir den Immobilienmakler, der uns bereits seit Monaten bei der Suche nach einer Halle unterstützt, und stemmen die ersten Mieten des Vereinshauses. Danach finanziert sich die Tabakmühle selbst, was durch niedrige Immobilienpreise, gute Lage und Erwartung hoher Besucherzahlen begünstigt wird.
Das, was du also bekommst ist ein Club mit guter Musik in deiner Nähe (gut zu erreichen von Frankfurt am Main und Oberursel), die Möglichkeit neue Künste und Musikgenres kennen zu lernen sowie einen Raum, in dem auch deiner Kreativität keine Grenzen gesetzt sind. 
Sollte das Kapital nicht zusammen kommen erhältst du, wie bei Indiegogo üblich, dein Geld sofort und risikofrei zurück!


Das Team

Auch, wenn das am Projekt arbeitende Team die Anzahl von 20 und somit den Rahmen einer interessanten Kampagne sprengt, möchten wir dir, damit du weißt wem du dein Geld gibst, zumindest die Kerngruppe, die vier Vorstandsmitglieder des Fördervereins für Kunst und Musik in Oberursel e.V. vorstellen:

Till Kraus

Vorstandsvorsitzender

Gemeinsam mit Tim Hoh hab ich das Konzept eines Clubs im Taunus von Anfang an mitentwickelt, um dieses dann in der Gründung eines Vereins zu verwirklichen. Seitdem entwickeln wir immer wieder ausgefallene Veranstaltungskopnzepte für Veranstaltungen um Frankfurt.

Als ich vor einiger Zeit anfing Musik zu produzieren hätte dich mir in Oberursel mehr Möglichkeiten gewünscht, diese darbieten zu können.

Dies möchte ich den kommenden Generationen nun ermöglichen!


Tim Hoh

Stellvertretender Vorstandsvorsitzender

Seit mehreren Jahren bin ich in Frankfurt und Umgebung als (Techno-) DJ und Veranstalter unterwegs. Gemeinsam mit Lutz Bischoff und Leon Hasselwander habe ich das DJ-Trio Molchkragen gegründet. Ich freue mich unglaublich auf das Projekt "Tabakmühle", vor allem weil mein innigster Wunsch ist, die Oberurseler Musikszene zu beleben. Seit Jahren fahren alle jungen Leute aus Oberursel allwöchentlich ins Frankfurter Nachtleben, doch warum nicht einfach im Taunus feiern?

Ich freue mich auf ein Gemeinschaftsprojekt bei dem jeder seine Vorstellungen umsetzen kann.


Lutz Bischoff

Stellvertretender Vorstandsvorsitzender

Ich organisiere in meiner Freizeit sehr gerne Veranstaltungen. Dieses Hobby macht mir so viel Spaß, dass es auch in meiner Beruflichen Wahl mich geprägt hat. In Oberursel selbst gibt es eine geringe Auswahl an Veranstaltungen im Musikalischen Bereich für Jugendliche. Dies ist der Punkt, an dem wir arbeiten! Mit der Eröffnung der Tabakmühle durch den von uns gegründeten Förderverein wird das Freizeitleben vieler Jugendlicher und Erwachsener in Oberursel und Umgebung aktiv gestaltet. Wir möchten als Anlaufstelle für örtliche Künstler dienen und ihr könnt uns dabei helfen!


Oliver Lorscheid

Stellvertretender Vorstandsvorsitzender

Als erfahrener Eventmanager bringe ich vor allem technisches Verständnis und Kontrolle über Organisationsabläufe mit. Des weiteren biete ich dem Förderverein bereits seit über einem Jahr Räumlichkeiten in meinem Büro als Vereinsarbeitsplatz.

Vom Aufbau eines Vereinshauses erhoffe ich mir vor allem eine kulturelle Bereicherung für Oberursel sowie die Schaffung eines Netzwerkes zur Kommunikation und zum Austausch von Künstlern und Musikern untereinander.


Woher kennst du uns vielleicht schon?

Erfahrung gesammelt haben wir auf einigen Veranstaltungen. Hier nur einige wenige Beispiele:

"Der Zirkus ist in der Stadt!"


oder auch bei "Neon":

 


und bei diversen anderen (Outdoor-) Events:




Was ist der FoeKMO - und was macht er überhaupt?

Der Förderverein für Kunst und Musik in Oberursel e.V. wurde im Juni 2014 nach bereits längerer Projektarbeit von uns (Till Kraus, Tim Hoh, Lutz Bischoff und Oliver Lorscheid) gegründet, um eine Plattform zur Förderung von, wie der Vereinsname bereits verrät, Kunst, Kultur und Musik in Oberursel zu errichten.

Das Präambel der Vereinssatzung beschreibt die Vereinsarbeit am präzisesten

Der Förderverein hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt Kunst, Kultur und Musik in und aus Oberursel zu fördern. In diesem Sinne haben sich Freunde der Themengebiete zusammengefunden, um ihre einzelnen Bestreben in der Gründung eines Vereins zu bündeln. Es sollen Maßnahmen ergriffen und gefördert werden, die der Bekanntmachung örtlicher Künstler dienen.

Die Arbeit des Vereins erweitert und ergänzt sich dauerhaft, vor allem beschäftigen wir uns mit der:

-Förderung einzelner Künstler und Musiker (z.B. durch PR, Marketing und Organisation)

  Bsp.:  

➤ „Molchkragen“

➤ „DJ Detti“

➤  „Go Levin“

➤  „Tim H.“

➤  „Tommek A.“

➤  „Proteinbiosynthese“

➤  „Astor Club Band“

➤  „Greedz“

-Organisation  von Veranstaltungen und Ausstellungen, um jungen und/oder weniger bekannten Künstlern und Musikern eine Bühne zu bieten.

  Bsp.: 

➤ „Salvador Dalí“ Austellung (2015)

➤  „Der Zirkus ist in der Stadt“

➤  „NEON“

➤  „Abifeier 2015“

➤  „TANZDEMO 2015“

➤  Outdoor-Veranstaltungen („Raves“)

  Weitere Wochenendveranstaltungen

-Bereitstellung von Probe- und Aufnahmeräumlichkeiten für Musiker

-Bereitstellung und Findung von Flächen und Räumlichkeiten für Künstler

-Bereitstellung und Beschaffung von Technik und Materialien für Künstler und Musiker

-Organisation von Workshops in künstlerischen und musikalischen Themengebieten

(z.B. DMX-Workshop)


Der Verein plant, durch Eröffnung eines Vereinshauses, diese Förderungen in Zukunft kostengünstiger und vor allem qualitativ hochwertiger gestalten zu können, unter anderem durch die Eröffnung eines Vereinshauses („Tabakmühle“)

In den zukünftigen Räumlichkeiten sind geplant:

-Workshops

  Bsp.: 

➤ DMX-Workshops (Lichtsteuerung)

➤  DJ-Workshops

➤  Graffiti-Kurse und Ausstellungen

➤  Vinyl-Workshops

➤  Workshops für alternative Kunstformen

➤  Malen auf Leinwand mit Öl- und Acrylfarben

 ➤ Koch-Workshops (mit Felix Müller)

 

-Veranstaltungen

Bsp.:  

➤ Kunstausstellungen (in Kooperation Beispiels  mit Künstlerin Eva Stefanski)

➤  Eröffnung und Aufführung von Kunstinstallationen

➤  Band-Auftritte

➤  Weitere Live-Aufführungen alternativer Musikrichtungen

➤  Techno-/House-Veranstaltungen (Zur Förderung lokaler DJs)


-Bereitstellung von Proberäumen für Bands

-Bereitstellung von Aufnahmeräumen für Bands und Musiker

-Bereitstellung von Atelierräumlichkeiten für Künstler

-Bereitstellung von Lagerflächen für Künstler und Musiker

-Bereitstellung von Arbeitsplätzen und –flächen zur Organisation und Vermarktung von Konzerten und Veranstaltungen

-In Ausnahmefällen Weitervermietung der Räumlichkeiten an Fremdveranstalter und Kleinkünstler (unter Aufsicht des Vorstandes)

Der Verein erreicht seine Ziele vor allem durch gutes Eigenmarketing über Flyer, markeneigene Textilprodukte, Mitgliederkontakte („Networking“), soziale Netzwerke (Facebook-Reichweite: ca. 3000 Personen), sowie durch die Hilfe von privaten Unterstützern („Ehrenmitglieder“). Des Weiteren bildet der Verein als Plattform für Künstler und Musiker ein beständiges Netzwerk, welches die gegenseitige Unterstützung von Künstlern und Musikern begünstigt und fördert.

Die Kommunikation der Mitglieder untereinander wird hierzu vor allem durch die „Foekmo.org-App“ begünstigt, da diese über einen vereinseigenen Mitglieder-Chatroom verfügt.


Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Manche können einfach keinen finanziellen Beitrag leisten, das heißt aber nicht, dass sie nicht helfen können:

Abgesehen von unserer Kampagne könnt ihr uns auch persönlich unterstützen. Als Gemeinschaftsprojekt suchen wir immer Leute für Auf- und Umbau, Theken- und Barpersonal und sonstige Hilfe. Schreib einfach eine Mail an info@foekmo.org
story_txt:
Zur Idee

Vor einiger Zeit haben sich Musiker, Künstler und Interessierte zusammengeschlossen und trafen sich, um den Techno wieder zu beleben. Aus der Idee wurde ein Verein, aus den Plänen Wirklichkeit. Veranstaltungen wie z.B. "Der Zirkus ist in der Stadt" oder "NEON" wurden von uns umgesetzt und unterstützt. Wir haben nun beschlossen, abgesehen von den weiter laufenden Veranstaltungsreihen, ein Vereinshaus zu schaffen, um ab November/Dezember 2015 dort einen gemeinnützigen Club zu eröffnen! Denn wo kann man vor den Toren Frankfurts noch zu moderner Musik tanzen? Doch es geht nicht ausschließlich um Techno:

Unsere Ziele sind:


Eröffnung des Vereinshauses ("Tabakmühle")

Umsetzung von öffentlichen Veranstaltungsreihen

Förderung von jungen DJs und Musikern

Unterstützung von kleinen Veranstaltungsreihen

Dauerhafte Betreibung der Tabakmühle als Kulturzentrum

Förderung von Künstlern
Präsentieren von Kunstobjekten in Form von Ausstellungen
Eröffnung von Proberäumen für lokale Bands
Spätere Expansion auf weitere Hallen
Musiklegenden in den Taunus holen

Am Projekt wird des weiteren rein ehrenamtlich gearbeitet. Der gemeinnützige Verein "Förderverein für Kunst und Musik in Oberursel e.V." wird das Vereinshaus leiten und eröffnen! Für dich heißt das, dass die Tabakmühle ohne Konzentration auf Profit laufen wird, sie wird keinen dauerhaften Gewinn erwirtschaften.

Alles, was eingenommen wird kommt dem direkt Vereinshaus zu Gute.
Ausgegeben wird das Startkapital für größere Anlagen, mehr DJs und mehr gemeinnützige Förderungen.
Ganz speziell brauchen wir das Geld um damit die Miete in den ersten 2 Monaten zu bezahlen, bis sich die Tabakmühle selbst trägt. Eine Halle ist bereits für uns reserviert, Licht- und Ton ist schon eingelagert und Mitarbeiter (Bar, Security, Licht- und Tontechnik) stehen schon bereit um die Opening-Party zu starten. 
   Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst
Das Grundkapital dient der Erstfinanzierung der Halle. Mit dem Geld bezahlen wir den Immobilienmakler, der uns bereits seit Monaten bei der Suche nach einer Halle unterstützt, und stemmen die ersten Mieten des Vereinshauses. story:
WHATS NEXT Party App. - music how we want it!

What this app will do (to the point):
  • Make it easy to select and share the music at any size party.
  • Everyone will see what music is available and have their input.
  • As a guest, share your music the host doesn't have with everyone without having to change connected devices.
  • The music will evolve as the mood of the party changes. Everybody can vote.
  • Request songs from DJ's. (if they put their song list out there you could vote for it)
  • Best usable with 3+ people. e.g. on a car cruise, a small gathering or at a party with hundreds.

Top reasons to support this app:

  1. Easy to use, party friendly app.
  2. Get everybody involved when it comes to music selection.
  3. Amazing things we will be able to do such as link in streaming music (spotify).
  4. No must have in app purchases EVER. They will all be cosmetic or give certain effects.
  5. Both free (ad + restrictions) and premium versions available. 
  6. Unique, interactive skins and backgrounds will be made to make it feel more personal.
  7. Use your phone as the server making it accessible anywhere.
  8. Good for a car full of people to hundreds of people at a party.
  9. DJ can use it to get special requests from the crowd.
  10. It only costs $2 right now! Once made it will be $2.50+
  11. $25 perks or higher will see your votes and songs stand out from the crowd. Forever
What this app will do (Extended):

The Idea.

Create an app (IOS/Android) that will allow the host of a party to create a server everyone can log into and vote for "Whats Next". 

Easy to use and straight forward. Whip your phone out, vote for a few songs you would like to hear, check out Whats Next, upload 1 or 2 songs, or a playlist you have, put phone away, keep socializing/partying. All up, it would only take a minute or 3.

Compatible with both Android and Apple no one should be left out.

As mentioned above, Guests can upload their own music to the list if the host allows it. These songs can then be voted on by everyone. 

Ultimately the Host is in control of the music. they may Pause, Play, Skip, Change, Choose songs just like a normal Music Player. 

It will play songs that have been voted for, if no songs have been voted for it will just shuffle through whats on there.

So that is the basic idea without going into too much detail. There are many other features that will be implemented, such as more advanced hosting options, etc.

*At no time will ‘in-app’ purchases be essential for proper use of this application. All in-app purchases are purely cosmetic, affecting only app appearance or extra abilities (such as giving guests, with the free app, temporary premium access). Note that these extra features are not necessary for proper application use.*


About Me!

Hi, I’m Ryan and I know you are wondering what inspired me to create this app.

Well I, like many others, like to party. I host many parties in my home. In the pictures featured you see my living room with lasers, strobe lights, MASSIVE speakers, LED disco ball and last but not least smoke from a smoke machine! Sooo you can tell I like to party. Key to a great party is the music. Catering to everyone’s music taste can be a challenge and this is where the ‘What’s Next’ app idea was born. 

Everyone is different and being able to upload your own songs and voting for those songs creates a variety of music everyone can enjoy. No more changing the connection on the speakers so one person’s choice of music is played. No more hassles with people having so many different devices. The music mix is just not quite there at my house parties and as the night goes on, people getting more intoxicated, the harder it is to create the right music atmosphere. This app is easy to use and gets everyone’s music in the mix. It is the easy, drunk person friendly app, turning house parties from good to legendary.

The Project so far...

So far I have drawn wire-frames of the app (a couple very basic pictures featured below) and submitted them to some developers I have found. The funding target will ensure a fun, stable app for everyone to use.

Pre purchase the app now so we can start developing it. Any extra money you put in will go to in app purchases you will be able to buy upon success and launch of the app. Skins and such, almost every other feature will be available for premium users i.e. yourself. 

Start up page:

   

Song selection / vote page:

   

WHATS NEXT page (Wire frame + Concept art Metalic skin):

     



The Challenge.

Funding is currently the biggest challenge. I personally love technology and have many ideas.  All I need are the funds to start this project! Once it is up and running, keeping the app bug free and up to date will be easy. There are many avenues an app like this can take. 

This campaign is all or nothing. Reaching half the goal and resulting in a low quality product is not an option. Quality is what I strive for and I want this app to be done right the first time. I have selected the ‘fixed funding option’ which means if the app does not make the target you will get your money back. 

This app is for everyone! From chilling at home with a few mates to having a house party with lots of people, this app is for you! This app can even be used at pubs or clubs and people can vote and listen to what they actually want to hear. In between band sets or no DJ? Put the songs on shuffle and everyone is guaranteed to have a good time. This app is for you! Get it now.

What you can do.

Indegogo has some share tools, if you could use these that would be much appreciated.

Also you can Like and Share the Facebook page, Head over and check it out!


The Future.

Things I'll be looking into once it's running smooth.

  • Use Spotify and other popular streaming apps.
  • Skins such as transformers, hello kitty, rave textures and many more.
  • Chat page to request songs.
  • Intergrated YouTube.
  • Adding projector support.
Many other epic ideas can be put into practice with an app liek this. Make your party one to stand above the rest!

Cheers!

Top reasons to support this app:


Easy to use, party friendly app.
Get everybody involved when it comes to music selection.
Amazing things we will be able to do such as link in streaming music (spotify).
No must have in app purchases EVER. They will all be cosmetic or give certain effects.
Both free (ad + restrictions) and premium versions available. 
Unique, interactive skins and backgrounds will be made to make it feel more personal.
Use your phone as the server making it accessible anywhere.
Good for a car full of people to hundreds of people at a party.
DJ can use it to get special requests from the crowd.
It only costs $2 right now! Once made it will be $2.50+
$25 perks or higher will see your votes and songs stand out from the crowd. Forever


What this app will do (Extended):


The Idea.
 Create an app (IOS/Android) that will allow the host of a party to create a server everyone can log into and vote for "Whats Next". 
Easy to use and straight forward. Whip your phone out, vote for a few songs you would like to hear, check out Whats Next, upload 1 or 2 songs, or a playlist you have, put phone away, keep socializing/partying. All up, it would only take a minute or 3.
Compatible with both Android and Apple no one should be left out.
As mentioned above, Guests can upload their own music to the list if the host allows it. These songs can then be voted on by everyone. 
Ultimately the Host is in control of the music. they may Pause, Play, Skip, Change, Choose songs just like a normal Music Player. 
It will play songs that have been voted for, if no songs have been voted for it will just shuffle through whats on there.
So that is the basic idea without going into too much detail. There are many other features that will be implemented, such as more advanced hosting options, etc.
*At no time will ‘in-app’ purchases be essential for proper use of this application. All in-app purchases are purely cosmetic, affecting only app appearance or extra abilities (such as giving guests, with the free app, temporary premium access). Note that these extra features are not necessary for proper application use.*


About Me!
Hi, I’m Ryan and I know you are wondering what inspired me to create this app.Well I, like many others, like to party. I host many parties in my home. In the pictures featured you see my living room with lasers, strobe lights, MASSIVE speakers, LED disco ball and last but not least smoke from a smoke machine! Sooo you can tell I like to party. Key to a great party is the music. Catering to everyone’s music taste can be a challenge and this is where the ‘What’s Next’ app idea was born. 
Everyone is different and being able to upload your own songs and voting for those songs creates a variety of music everyone can enjoy. No more changing the connection on the speakers so one person’s choice of music is played. No more hassles with people having so many different devices. The music mix is just not quite there at my house parties and as the night goes on, people getting more intoxicated, the harder it is to create the right music atmosphere. This app is easy to use and gets everyone’s music in the mix. It is the easy, drunk person friendly app, turning house parties from good to legendary.


The Project so far...
 So far I have drawn wire-frames of the app (a couple very basic pictures featured below) and submitted them to some developers I have found. The funding target will ensure a fun, stable app for everyone to use.
Pre purchase the app now so we can start developing it. Any extra money you put in will go to in app purchases you will be able to buy upon success and launch of the app. Skins and such, almost every other feature will be available for premium users i.e. yourself. 
Start up page:

   
Song selection / vote page:
   
WHATS NEXT page (Wire frame + Concept art Metalic skin):

     


 The Challenge.
Funding is currently the biggest challenge. I personally love technology and have many ideas.  All I need are the funds to start this project! Once it is up and running, keeping the app bug free and up to date will be easy. There are many avenues an app like this can take. 
This campaign is all or nothing. Reaching half the goal and resulting in a low quality product is not an option. Quality is what I strive for and I want this app to be done right the first time. I have selected the ‘fixed funding option’ which means if the app does not make the target you will get your money back. This app is for everyone! From chilling at home with a few mates to having a house party with lots of people, this app is for you! This app can even be used at pubs or clubs and people can vote and listen to what they actually want to hear. In between band sets or no DJ? Put the songs on shuffle and everyone is guaranteed to have a good time. This app is for you! Get it now.


What you can do.
Indegogo has some share tools, if you could use these that would be much appreciated.
Also you can Like and Share the Facebook page, Head over and check it out!

The Future.
Things I'll be looking into once it's running smooth.


Use Spotify and other popular streaming apps.
Skins such as transformers, hello kitty, rave textures and many more.
Chat page to request songs.
Intergrated YouTube.
Adding projector support.

Many other epic ideas can be put into practice with an app liek this. Make your party one to stand above the rest!
Cheers!

story:
What is TourSmart?

My name is Christopher Murray, I've been in multiple metal acts for almost 6 years now as a vocalist touring my home state of Florida, and around the rest of the country. While touring a lot of the country, my band and I would be hundreds of miles from home and would end up booking with promoters that just didn't show up, only paid us 10 bucks (way less than what we agreed on, without reasonable cause) or just didn't pay us at all.

Being a DIY touring band and even being on a small label, you can get ripped off easily by many people. I'd like to flip the table on that, and help as many bands as possible before they get on the road. Showing them through this service, what people to trust and who to avoid. I wish I had something similar while touring, and I don't think it's fair that if you're not a huge agent with a thousand super trust worthy contacts, that you should just blindly book with strangers. The service will provide a similar atmosphere to Yelp, reviewing promoters based on past experiences and if they are poorly reviewed by a majority of users, we will recommend you booking with someone else to save time and frustration.

With these contributions, they will go straight to the start up costs to this idea. It will take a website design, app design and production, as well as server storage and space to run such a big idea.

What We Need & What You Get

I am going to keep the indiegogo simple, if everyone can contribute just five dollars, we will put your name on the website as a big THANK YOU for helping out musicians everywhere.

 

The Impact

Like Yelp, this could help weed out the great from the not so great. If you are new to touring and don't want to just place all your bets on booking with someone who could be trustworthy, then this service can show you who is actually worth booking with.

This could help bands EVERYWHERE, regardless of the size of the band. Bands nowadays have it hard enough as it is, we need to give power back to the artist in anyway we can, and I hope to accomplish that by doing this.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is creating enough start up capital to make this a reality, making a large website and app that can hold so many users isn't cheap, but your five dollars can go a long way in making this a reality. If we don't meet our goal- you will be refunded completely.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!

 

tell your friends who are in bands, and their friends who are in bands, and their dads that are also in bands.

story:
We are passionate about bringing awareness to the benefits of medical cannabis and we are a launching a campaign to fund an international music video of our song  “Heal Your Heart”, not to mention, once we reach our goal all the extra funds will go to help Veterans suffering from PTSD to get the help and medicine they need.

WHITTON: I was inspired you to write a cannabis / CBD song because growing up in a health conscience household, it was easy to become passionate about the cannabis and hemp plant. Since my family is in the business of wellness with their DLTA Los Angeles restaurant bar called, "PRANK", we thought it would be fun to create a theme song in support of our friends at Nevada Botanical Science and O.pen Vape. I thought my friends in the band “Jelly Bread” would be a perfect fit to write this jingle with because I knew they’d love to bring awareness to the world as well.

Jelly Bread : We want to be part of this life changing movement because it saddens us to see people suffer and ingest chemicals that ruin your liver or brain or your heart. Causing more issues on top of the issue you’re trying to help get better. It seems so simple to us…. This cannabis thing… It’s a plant that anyone could grow and is natural.

ALL : After we reach our goal, we have chosen to give the profits to veterans because after speaking with handful of doctors in the cannabis industry and patients, there seems to be controversy on if CBD / cannabis helps Veterans with PTSD. Vets and homeless shouldn’t be in the same sentence. They have done so much for our country, so how can we just brush their issue under the rug.  

We have chosen to support a 501c3 Non-Profit called the Veterans Resource Centers of America.  And after having the honor of hearing Shane Whitecloud’s story, whom is a Veteran and works for Veteran’s Resource Centers of America, he brought VRC to our attention and we feel that it’s a good match for us. They have 14 branches throughout CA, AZ, and NV housing homeless veterans and helping our vets become stable and independent again.

Please take a look at our campaign video… We’ve had the honor of hearing what these knowledgeable and experience physicians, nurses and patients have to say about the health benefits of medical cannabis. 

When we reach our goal our vision is to create a modern version of the “Heal The World” music video by Michael Jackson which helped bring awareness to world hunger. Our music video will spread a message about the health benefits of medical cannabis.

Oh annnnddd below, we have some great perks for your donations.  Check it out!

We are deeply thankful for your support for this amazing cause. We want our song to break the stigma attached to cannabis that causes fear and misunderstanding and its labeling as a destructive drug so that it can be used freely to help our suffering veterans.

Here’s to living our lives to the fullest with happy bodies and hearts, cheers!

~ Jelly Bread and Whitton

story:
Short Summary

On the 12th July, the Portland State Chamber Choir arrived in Singapore on their way to Bali. They sang spontaneously at Changi Airport. Since then their video has been viewed more than 100,000 times after it was reported on mothership, a Singapore blog site.

Well, the tamil song sung was a popular hit with the Indian community here in Singapore. 

I think the people in Singapore would love to hear the group sing live in a hall. It is also a celebration of friendship, international cross-cultural exchange and music. http://mothership.sg/2017/07/u-s-choral-group-s...

The choir comes in to Singapore on the 22nd July at  345p.m. They can perform in the evening at 8p.m of the 22nd July, Saturday.

As the time to organise this is short, we welcome and appreciate any and all help to spread this ASAP. Thank you! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking at 35 hosts or hosts who can collectively host 35 people on the 22nd July.
  • Hosts may receive 4 tickets to the concert to thank them for hosting the singers.
  • Transport to and from airport / concert venue and airport.
  • Venue for this performance.
  • Enroute ticket for conductor to fly to Singapore instead of going back via Taipei. ( Not sure how much at this stage. Waiting for response) 
  • The money you support will go towards expenses for this event. If there are extra, we will buy the choir drinks at the party after the concert. 

Thank you for your support! 

The Impact

  • Can we organise a concert in 6 days? With the help of a community, I think we can! 
  • Choral music is about community, friendship without borders and bringing people together.
  • A simple act of sharing a song can lead to bigger things. 
  • We hope that through this concert, we can bring people together. 
     

Risks & Challenges

Well we only have 6 days. So that itself is a challenge. But again we welcome any and all contribution. If the concert doesn't happen, we will refund all ticket money collected. We are quite confident we can pull it off though, with your help! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by: 

  • Being a host. ( You can fill up host information here:  http://bit.ly/whynotsinginahall) 
  • Purchasing tickets to the event. 
  • Spreading the word
  • Coming for the concert! 

That's it! On that note, we hope we can hear the Portland State Chamber Choir in Singapore. 

About Me

Hello. I'm Iris Koh. I've been in choirs all my life, in the beginning as a singer and organist, later as a choral conductor and now as a  founder of the Singapore company ChorusArt Pte Ltd. We are currently organising the Vienna Boys Choir in Singapore event. Something magical happens when people come together and sing. In that moment, the music unites us and we are joined in time in our humanity.

If you wish to find out more about what I do, you can go to www.svbc.sg.

story:
Short Summary

Through the doorway of hospitality walk people who begin the night as strangers and leave as friends. The Bucharest Drinking Team wants to share our passion for life with you: our community of musicians, dancers, singers, dreamers, storytellers, and feasters. We are embarking on a journey – a new record – to bring you our latest exploits, to bring songs of joy and woe and everything in between, directly into your homes.

What we need & what you get

We want to capture our live sound, which includes you, our community!  We need equipment that is high fidelity, portable and durable.  We also want to deliver our sound to you in artistic, user-friendly and high quality ways.  This band knows how to balance frugalness with a large enough vision to get our project done in style!, and this is how we will fund our vision:

Funding The Art

* High quality area mics and 4 channel portable digital recorder$1,300
* Equipment support (power, memory, cables, stands and protective cases)$780
* Mastering the recording$800
* Album design, marketing and distribution$800
* Professional support and training$500
* Royalties to composers$400
Total cost of the art$4,580

Funding the Fundraiser

* Gifts to funders$1,500
* Processing fee$250
* Indiegogo fee$420
* Marketing the Fundraiser$750

Total Budget$7500

The Bucharest Drinking Team is excited to share our new album with EVERYONE who supports this fundraiser.  We have a limited number of special offers, and if you are so lucky or generous, you will get a party WITH us!  Additionally, not only are we musicians; the Bucharest Drinking Team is full of multi-talented individuals who are excited to teach you new skills and tricks!  If we do not achieve our fundraising goal, your contributions will be returned.

The Impact

Seattle-based Bucharest Drinking Team is more that just a Balkan inspired band. At our shows and Pop-Up Kafanas, we bring you on a whirlwind trip through the Balkans with pop songs from old radios and cartoon theme songs; from wedding brass bands in dusty streets to smoky back rooms with old fiddlers getting down.

Though we are a group of mostly American-born people, we have grown to love the music and culture of the Balkans through family, friendships, travel, study, work, and activism. There is amazing music, dancing, and a wonderful culture of hospitality that spans southeastern Europe, a region where the Ottoman Empire once clashed with the Austro-Hungarians. We on the Bucharest Drinking Team take our inspiration from this great hospitality, which many of us have experienced first hand, and for you, we craft an experience that involves the sounds, sights, smells, and tastes to capture the essence of Kafana culture.

Our Pop-Up Kafana album starts with us recording everything we do for a year: our rehearsals, our shows, our practices and after-parties, stories of joy and songs of heartache. With these ingredients, we will distil the year of recordings into a 45 minute package of the finest of our fine moments. We hope that when all is said and done, we can raise a glass and toast each other and you to carry on toward another day. We throw these parties for you, because of you; otherwise it would just be practice.

Risks and Challenges

This project will propel the Bucharest Drinking Team to a new level of musical precision, professionalism and community connection.  We're also really good at giving ourselves very difficult assignments.  Some challenges with this project include:

  • Achieving good quality sound in the field.  This is why we are budgeting for special mics and recorders.  We have also budgeted money for training.  Our members are connected to the larger Seattle music community and will reach out for experience, help and wisdom.

  • We are very motivated by the vision of this project and we as individuals have already given personal funds to get the ball rolling.  If additional funds are not forthcoming, we will move forward at a much slower pace with personal funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit counts! Use the handy indiegogo "share" tool to share this fundraiser with your friends and family, with folks you'd like to get to know better, folks you'd like to sip tea with, and please help us to spread the word of the Bucharest Drinking Team and our Pop-Up Kafana.


Thanks as always for your friendship and support. We are excited to bring this project into the world, and we are certain you will enjoy what is to come!

We are excited to bring this project into the world, and we are certain you will enjoy what is to come!
